description:
Hands down my favorite restaurant in SF. Service is impeccable, soundtrack is on point, and food is consistently delicious. Ron and Nicole are the best waiters and will take such good care of you! Some notable dishes below (the menu does change often, though)...

Hummus - sounds boring but promise it's amazing and the pita is warm and delicious
Roasted veggies - they're cooked in this delish sweet sauce that's out of this world
Moroccan chicken 
Salmon entree - it has this delicious yogurt sauce  
The pasta entree(it changes but it's always amazing)
Side of onion rings - decadent and delicious 

They also have my fave wine - Zinphomaniac! Whether it's a date night, a special occasion, or just a casual dinner with friends, terzo nails it.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Had dinner here the other night--food was fine, but nothing to write home about in this city of fantastic restaurants. Service took a while, but no worries--we'd booked an early slot after work (6:00), so that was fine. They talked us into dessert (twist my arm, right?) and coffee. No big deal so far. 

Immediately after we'd finished dessert, one of my friends got up to use the restroom while we sorted out the check. While he was gone, a server came to our table in a huff and asked us to hurry up and leave--they now had a line at the front door and wanted our table right away! It was very strange, to say the least. We were clearly on our way out the door anyhow (and seriously we'd had the check for five minutes, tops). Terzo needs to treat their customers a little better or they won't have an overbooking problem for long!
author: Jen K.

description:
One of my favorite to go spots in San Francisco! 
Good Ambiance, friendly staff and a great wine selection. 

The "Roasted Beets" plate and the "Hummus" are a must...
author: Taraneh G.

description:
Wow - A 96/100 Health Score, to boot! Something so many others need to strive for!

This is a neighborhood gem in a gem of a neighborhood! With a laid back cozy vibe, solid food at reasonable prices, and a nice clientele, this place has it all... With the exception of parking.  On previous visits, I recall seeing valet parking, but haven't seen it the last couple of times.  We were there this evening at 9pm, so perhaps they called it a night, but it can be difficult to snag parking in Cow Hollow, particularly on a Friday and Saturday evening.  

Stellar food here.  There are a core group of staples on the menu, and some specials are usually rotated in.  

After dozens of visits here, my all-time favorites are: the onion rings, their Hummus with Homemade pita bread, the Chicken Spiedini, and the Roasted Steelhead.  These items are part of their "permanent collection".

The onion rings are reason enough to come here, in my book!  The batter stays crispy, and they always come out piping hot, directly out of the fryer. The good news is that you can get just a half order, which gives you a good sampling.  For me, the challenge is if I order a full order, I'll easily eat the entire full order.  Truly, the half order is plenty for me, and satiates my hankering for their onion rings! 

Also really love their hummus.  Ok, the hummus itself is very tasty, but what I really really love is their House-Made Pita bread. It is soooo good! Trust me and you'll thank me ten times over.  This is a great carb splurge.  This is another item that makes coming here worth the entire visit!

You'll never go wrong with going for the Free Range Chicken Spiedini.  Very filling skewers of large chunks of white meat chicken. 

The Roasted Steelhead is always nicely prepared.  Always moist with a crisp skin, although I'm not a huge fan of the mix of faro, zucchini and asparagus base it comes with, as it is somewhat liquidy.  

There's something for everyone on the menu here.  Chicken, hanger steak, a fish, a pasta, and some vegetarian salads...And there all good!

My one and only complaint this evening was that the iced tea was overly diluted by ice.  I had 3 refills, and each pour was with iced tea that barely even looked like iced tea because it was so light in color.  As a result, it was fairly tasteless.  They could easily fix this by using significantly less ice in the main serving vessel, or in whatever the iced tea is sitting in prior to being served.

Service is normally pleasant and helpful, without being intrusive.  

The dishes are ample enough to share, so we normally get a few appetizers and a main entree to share.  Everything, with the exception of the onion rings, are prepared fairly healthy, in the sense that there aren't items with globs of gravy, or fatty meats. 

It's quality food here, as opposed to quantity of food, though the portions are sufficient.  I'd choose quality over quantity on any given day, and I'd happily dine at Terzo on any given evening!  That much I'm sure of!!
author: Lori N.

description:
Great spot tucked away at the end of Union street. I was surprised to find that it's been around for a decade but it looks very modern and classy inside. 

One of our new favorite places to eat. We even went recently for restaurant week and loved it. Great pasta, meatballs and steak. Good for a nice, hearty meal and I can't tell if this place is Italian or Spanish. We also tried the scallops and steelhead, which were solid as well. 

Normally I don't do dessert but their flourless chocolate cake was the bomb.
author: Young Y.

description:
Great, intimate setting with options for larger groups, decent food (some hits, some misses), good service - what else can you ask for?

Venue / Service: very cozy, dimly lit interior, which is great for a somewhat casual yet intimate setting.  Not so dark that you needed to bust out flashlights, which is a plus.  Service-wise, people were pretty quick, filling up water glasses when appropriate and food came out at a good pace- I think the two of us finished in 1.5 hr?

Food: most of the dishes are shareable, and we ended up sharing everything.  They generally say 2-3 smaller plates and then an entree, depending on how hungry you are.  

-- Hummus (with House-Made Pita & Za'atar)($8.50) - Simple, but great.  Still a bit of bite from the ground up chickpeas, which I like.  Would have been great if the pita was a bit on the crispier side so that it wouldn't get soggy or sag when you put the hummus on it, but the za'atar complemented the hummus well.  

-- Sautéed Chanterelle Mushrooms (with Crispy Polenta, Crème Fraîche, Thyme, Wine & Ricotta Salata)($15) - polenta cake added a nice crunchy element to the dish and complemented the earthy chanterelles well.  Not sure if it needed the creme fraiche since it made the dish a bit heavier than I would have preferred it, but otherwise a good dish to try if you like your mushrooms.

-- Tomato Braised Pork Meatballs (with Creamy Polenta & Reggiano)($13.50) - hard to go wrong with a braised meatball, especially since you end up with a nice, juicy pork ball.  Polenta and parmesan were nice extras to the meatball- this dish is gonna be a bit on the richer side.

-- Linguine alla Carbonara (with Pancetta, Leeks, Garlic, Cream, Black Pepper & Pecorino)($22 for large plate, $14 for small) - I usually associate carbonara with an overly creamy sauce drenching the pasta, so thankfully this wasn't the case here.  There was enough sauce to coat the pasta without overpowering it, and the pancetta added a great amount of savoriness, along with the garlic and pecorino.  One of those dishes that seem to use fewer ingredients but are all impactful altogether.  We ordered a large plate, and this was quite a large plate.  Unfortunately, not for peeps with lactose intolerance or small stomachs (double whammy to me), but still worth a taste. 

-- Braised Chicken alla Cacciatore (with Orzo, Herbs, Tomato, Mushrooms & Fried Rosemary)($21) - chicken was juicy and quite flavorful, having soaked up all of the braising liquids!  Orzo was well cooked and also had soaked up the liquids so it wasn't just a plain cooked orzo.  This dish is a little more difficult to share since you'll have to pick your way through the bones to the meat, but perhaps better if ordered as an individual entree.

All in all, there could be some tweeks to the food to make it awesome, but quite happy with the vibe and service enough to want to bring friends here for a nice, quieter yet slightly upscale dinner.
author: Audrey H.

description:
Terzo was a friend's choice and I'm glad to say we were pleasantly surprised with how good it turned out to be. I don't fancy $$$ places as the food usually is not up to the mark or price for that matter, but Terzo delivered, and it did that so well.

We had a booking for 4 at 8pm yesterday and the place was quite packed for a Monday night - not too shabby ;)

Place had dim lights (which I love) giving the ambience that romantic touch and was overall very neat and clean. Oh and they have gender neutral bathrooms - Super!

Food was spectacular really. Everything was nicely cooked, tasty and good quality. Between the 4 of us we shared small plates of:

- Hummus with house made pita $8.5
- Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari on a bed of lentils $14
- Tomato Braised Pork Meatballs $13.5
- Gnocchi Beef Bolognese on a bed of polenta $15
- Chicken Spiedini  $14
- Flourless Chocolate cake $9.5
- 3 flavor ice cream scoops (vanilla, salted caramel and chocolate)

Allow me to start with the hummus - simply delicious. That pita was oh so good! Calamari lacked taste (but that's calamari though...) but the lentils were such a welcomed addition that I really enjoyed this dish. Meatballs were superb and what a smart combination with the polenta. Gnocchi were soft, reach and paired so well with the bolognese. Chicken spiedini was really nice too with chicken being soft and the green chutney had a nice kick to it :). Last but not least, the queen of the night had to be the flourless choco cake - so rich and yummy! I might just be back for this!

Service however wasn't the most pleasant. Nothing in particularly wrong with it, just not very friendly and warm so it definitely didn't add to our beautiful experience which is something I expect from a pricey place like this.

Definitely recommend for group dinners so that people can share different plates or a nice date night. Will be back!
author: Heliana M.

description:
I knew I loved this place when they handed me the wine menu and almost all the wines were biodynamic, organic, or sustainably produced. 

Another reason they earned my effusive praise is the ease they handle dietary restrictions and allergies. Specifically gluten free & nightshade free (a difficult one!) 

Lively yet intimate atmosphere, could easily chat but didn't feel stuffy or pompous. I'd like to pretend like this is my neighborhood restaurant - even if I don't live that close.
author: Anna S.

description:
A solid 4 stars.

We came here for date night- but be warned it is pretty loud in there, and the tables are close together.

We got a bunch of things to split.

Meatballs with Polenta - they were very tender
Onion rings - HUGE portion for $6
(small portion) Pasta carbonara 
Chicken Spedini - Pretty good, you must like Cilantro to enjoy
Polenta with mushrooms - Our favorite of the night

Our server was a doll. I was pretty bummed out that there was no hazelnut cake on the dessert menu.
author: Amy W.

description: This is probably more 3.5 for food, the onion fries were not served with any roumalade or dipping sauce (don't know if that's an error?), the beet dish just had way too many beets and too many pickled onions- we love beets but this was probably the low light. The highlight was probably the hummus.
author: Piper W.

description:
Terzo is such a cute, overlooked spot over by the Marina.  Probably one of my favorite Mediterranean spots in the city other than Kokkari.  

Open table is such a convenient method to ensure a table.  Our server was super attentive and gave us a bunch of recommendations when it came to food and wine.  Their wine list touches all over Europe and it wasn't hard to find something we wanted.  

Food, on the other hand, was tough to decide on because I wanted to order everything!  We went a different route and decided to order 5 small plates to share.

Hummus with house made pita:  The pita was definitely the winner on the plate.  Super soft, fresh, great chew, texture, fantastic.

Roasted beets:  What can I say...I love beets.  And this was also a winner and seasoned well.

Grilled monterey bay calamari:  Served with lentils.  Tender, cooked well, gone in a flash.

Tomato braised pork meatballs with polenta:  Probably my least favorite dish although not terrible.  I thought the polenta was underwhelming but the meatballs had good flavor.

Free range chicken spiedini:  Definitely my favorite dish of the night!  I'd come back just for this.  The chicken was on a stick with bread, cilantro, chiles, and onion.  Ugh...so good!!!  A must order if you visit terzo.

For dessert, we had the flourless chocolate cake with a cup of coffee.  This was the perfect way to end the meal as the cake was fabulous!  Not overly sweet...perfect for 2 to share.  

5 stars and pretty easy to get reservations at!
author: Jen W.

description:
Wasn't a big fan of this place. The ambiance was nice and cozy but the food and customer service was so so.  

None of the dishes seemed to nail it.  The calamari appetizer was more like lentil soup with only 4 small pieces of calamari.  The calamari itself was pretty tasty but the lentils ruined it for me and so did the small amount of calamari. I thought this would be more like a calamari dish not lentil soup!

The only reason why I ordered the calamari was to replace the gnocchi appetizer which wasn't great either.  It was way under cooked and too soft. I've had way better gnocchi dishes at other restaurants.  

For the main meal I asked for the skirt steak to be medium rare and it came out rare. Although it did have a nice buttery flavor to it but I was mainly annoyed that it came out way undercooked.  

The chicken dish was decent.  Not great flavoring but not bad and the chicken was tender. I actually thought the rice served with it tasted better than the chicken. The rice had a nice combination of raisins, pistachios and I believe mint.  

The only items that I thought were really great were the red wine and ice cream trio for dessert, which neither one had to do with the food! 

The service was also ok.  The hostess weren't that friendly as we entered the restaurant and it took awhile for our waitress to greet us.  And none of the staff greeted us goodbye or said thank you as we left either. 

Overall I'd say, there are plenty of other great restaurants in San Francisco that have better food and service and appreciates your business.  I'd try other places first and keep this place as a back up option.
author: April F.

description:
Fantastic food, ambiance and service. The hummus and bread is a must try! Also, the chicken skewers with the bread (yes, bread on a skewer) is one of the best things we have had in a while. 

Wine selection was pretty good and the server we had was helpful in recommending a wine to go with our food selections. 

Living in Marin, I would easily make the trek again to Terzo.
author: Zach N.

description:
I really enjoyed my experience at Terzo! I came sigh my family to celebrate my brother's birthday and we had made reservations ahead of time, which means we were seated immediately upon arrival. 

We ordered the pita and hummus along with calamari for appetizers and we were not disappointed in the slightest. The hummus was rich with flavor and texture (there was even a hint of garlic) and the calamari was amazingly fresh. 

For our entrees we ordered the Grilled Niman Pork Loin and Braised Mary's Chicken. Both meats were tender and cooked just right. And for dessert we had this delicious almond cake with ice cream, and they added candles on top to celebrate my brother's birthday. 

Overall food and presentation was great. Service was a bit slow but  we never felt neglected. I would love to come back!
author: Allison T.

description:
How Terzo fell off my radar is beyond me.  The place was great in every way last evening and by that I mean the service was top-notch and the food was wonderful.  

I did three small plates and each in its own way was perfect.  Whenever I see a plate with sun gold tomatoes I order it.   These small, very sweet tomatoes are a perfect counterpoint for an ample serving of mozzarella and toasted focaccia. 

Next up was meatballs over some very nice polenta.  The meatballs were two to the order and tender and tasty; the polenta was thick, smooth and perfect.

Finally chicken spiedini with bread, cilantro, chilies and onion.  Perfect.   The meat was nicely charred and the spicing was just perfect.

Terzo becomes a place that will be visited regularly.
author: David D.

description:
You know, it's incredibly disappointing when you dream of the chimichurri flank steak & then they bring the dish but tell you they don't have any more scalloped potatoes to accompany your steak so you get the poor mans substitute of roasted potatoes which frankly were a ver poor, inadequate substitute...particularly for a 8pm friday night reservation & an item on your menu that is there EVERY NIGHT. Sitting there watching my partner savor the scalloped potatoes was torture & well just pure laziness on the kitchen staffs behalf. Our server was wonderful but a huge letdown from the kitchen...




The chimichurri steak with potatoes & broccoli I was ridiculously good! Perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked....an absolutely delicious dish that I'd highly recommend!
author: Nicole E.

description:
Honestly we had low expectations as a few friends told us this place was okay. I didn't care and booked this for my birthday party. We had a party of ten and I'm glad I didn't listen to anyone because the food and service was amazing. I am grateful we had a big group so I was able to try many of the dishes on the menu. 
Service was also top notch in making sure we always had wine or drinks and food was plentiful. This made for a very fun experience! 
We had literally 2 of everything on the menu but the stand out favorites were: 
Tomato braised meatballs-so tender and flavorful. It's a small plate with 3 small meatballs so plan accordingly. It literally melts in your mouth. 
Fried egg bruschetta-perfectly seasoned and cooked. The ricotta helped to create richness and the bread was crunchy and perfect compliment 
Fresh fettuccine 
Grilled Norman Ranch pork loin-juicy and had the perfect clean pork taste. I love the mustard grain butter which pops in your mouth
Crispy onions-this was my favorite! So crispy, onion flavored and delicious. You don't need any sauce just a napkin because it is just the right amount of greasy you want for something fried. 
We didn't do dessert as my husband brought a birthday cake for us but I want to come back to try it!
author: Jen C.

description: LOVE this place. Super cute vibes and good food. I got the scallops and steak and it was delicious. I don't even like mushrooms but it was really, really good here.
author: Tina L.

description: Food tasted like it came from a frozen dinner. Menu said it had pancetta which i had to search for. Had to wait for 20 min for them to take our order then another hour for the food to come. No bread to hold you over. Appetizers can barely be shared. Example if you go with four people you each get one leg of calamari. Don't go here if you are actually hungry. Don't go here if you want good service. Just in general go to one of the 50 other restaurants you pass as you come here.
author: Ryan J.

description:
Everything was A-ok.  One thing in each dish was exceptional while others ingredients lacked:
Grilled calamari: calamari was slightly undercooked. Beans were the best.
Grilled veggies: butternut squash was tasty with so much rich butter.  The rest of the veggies tasted boiled.
Chicken skewers: chicken was a tad tough and flavorless, the crouton and chutney was phenomenal 
Meatballs: just pass...
Crispy onions: perfect and a huge portion
Bruschetta:  flavors were good and fresh.  Wish they executed the bread grilling better.  

Service was friendly and prompt.
author: Janet L.

description:
Decided to give this place a try during restaurant week in SF and we were in for a treat.

Appetizers:

Calamari

Entrees:

Pork Shoulder
Skirt Steak

Drinks:

Wine pairings

Dessert:

Tart

Thankfully, SF restaurant week was able to expose me to this place. Good food and wine pairings and will definitely recommend to others and will try again!
author: Marc M.

description:
Rude! We went here because they have a good selection of gluten free dishes for my friend who is allergic. Between the four of us we had 6 glasses of wine, appetizers, entrees and 2 desserts. The food was good, but on the fatty side. 

My main complaint was that literally within one minute of the last dessert dished being cleared, the (I assume hostess) came to our table and asked us to leave, because "we need the table."  

This is the first time I have been to a restaurant and then been asked to clear out. I understand the food industry is about turn over, but this is just bad business. I will never return.
author: Paul D.

description:
Great food, our server provided good service. However, the host was downright rude and not accommodating at all. Ruined the entire experience - I would highly recommend avoiding this restaurant until they change their host.
We had a great server and great music at the restaurant and had a nice time but our bad table seating and hostess experience put a dampener on the mood.
author: Stephen F.

description:
Terzo is excellent. I've been twice now for dinner, the first time with a group of four and this time to be seated at the bar. 

I highly recommend making a reservation! They are always booked, especially on weekends. We were able to snag two seats at the bar after only waiting a few minutes and had a wonderful meal there. We were lucky as the bar has limited seating. 

Wine options are great. The dinner menu is even better. I appreciate that they update the menu. The pork option with sweet potatoes and cabbage changed a bit but was excellent both times. I appreciate having new yummy options. 

For Starters:

The hummus will rock your world. That hot seasoned pita is to die for. 
Butternut squash plate is also exceptional! 
Brussels sprouts are always a yes. 

Main: 
Dive into the entrees head first. I've had the pork option twice now though the cut was different each time. Juicy, perfectly tender, with sautéed cabbage and mashed sweet potatoes hiding below it. Their herbed butter is top notch. Great flavor, would get over and over again.
author: Nichole W.

description:
If you've been tasked with planning a romantic date night, Terzo is your spot.  The food and service feel high end, yet the atmosphere and pricing are comfortable and casual.

You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but some of my favorites are the chicken spiedini and the hummus.  Both are fairly simple dishes, yet they're consistently prepared to perfection.  My husband and I are so obsessed with the spiedini that we found the recipe online and frequently make it for dinner guests, who always rave about it.  Mmm.
author: Connie S.

description:
The food was fantastic! Highly recommend the hummus, chicken spiedini, morel mushrooms and fava beans and the almond cake for dessert! Our waitress was great too...friendly and helpful. 

Only reason I couldn't give 5 stars was because...the busboy kept trying to take our plates before we were done eating- on multiple occasions!!
author: Shilps S.

description: Terzo is still one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The menu is unique, focusing on seasonal and local ingredients with a California/Mediterranean flare. The standouts for me continue to be the meatballs over polenta, the pita with hummus, their yogurt marinated chicken, and whatever seasonal veggie dish is on the menu. You really can't go wrong with anything!
author: Sophie S.

description: The food was unique and really well done. Each dish was incredible. The service was amazing as well. I am dairy free and the waitress went over and beyond to make me feel comfortable and accommodate my dietary needs. Can't wait to be back!
author: Mcknzie R.

description:
Really wanted to love this place because it was one of the most special days, my family was celebrating an engagement. We called ahead and requested the private room but when we arrived we were seated at the high top table in the middle of the dining room. They had 9 high chairs and 1 stool- said they didn't have any more chairs for us. 

Bottom line is the food was good, not amazing but pretty good, however the bad service and overall apathy overshadowed what could have been a good experience. Also we told them weeks in advance that we were celebrating an engagement that was going to happen hours before the meal- any other nice restaurant would have added a special touch to the evening to make it more memorable.
author: Lauren F.

description:
Everything here is top notch. The ambiance is quiet but busy. The bartender is amazing and very exact about his job. The chef hovers outside the kitchen making sure everything is perfect. He even asked me about butter on my rice since I asked for no cheese with everything. Very worried about quality and customer service. Love it!
Wait staff is friendly and efficient.
Not a bad word to say about anything and I've been there three or more times.

The food is definitely six stars.
author: Cassy R.

description:
Awesome spot for a great night out! There was a bit of a wait for a table, but we had a seat at the bar within 5 minutes of arriving - perfect!

Our server, Phil, was perfect as well. He was super friendly and welcoming, and he gave us great recommendations with the menu. He definitely made this a 5-star experience, along with the DELICIOUS food and wine. Highly recommended!
author: Zack Z.

description:
I loved the overall layout and atmosphere of Terzo - It was relaxed and noise level was energetic but not disruptive. A great atmosphere would be worthless unless the food met the same standard and it did. The menu was creative and for the most part, "outstanding", though we were not that impressed with the Artichoke dish as it seemed to lack flavor and not worth the ~$12 price-tag. !  The grilled calamari was amazing and we ordered as an appetizer and then again as part of our entrees!  Service was well-timed and friendly, wines were affordable and the Barolo we had was delicious.
I definitely would return to try more dishes.
author: Hari J.

description: My gf and I enjoyed the hummus and arugula salad tonight over wine. It was alright.... hummus you can't do wrong. Be sure to ask for more pita bread. It's good. The arugula salad wasn't much to write home about, but if you are needing greens, I guess it's ok. I liked that the apples were match size. I really don't like chunks of apple on my salad and the cheese was also barely existent. Good for the "vegan" in your life.
author: Kym P.

description:
We stumbled onto this place because the guy at the stuck up restaurant around the corner was very rude and we definitely did to want to wait 45+ mins to dine at a place that didn't  seem to even want our business. Luckily, there was no-show party so we were able to get a table and I'm still amazed at how lucky we were for that because this place is amazing. 

Service is top notch and the food...omg, can we just say orgasmic? Started off with a bottle of sauvignon blanc, hummus, and the tomato confit. All delicious. Main courses were the Paccheri (BN ranch raised beef bolognese and pecorino), braised pork shoulder, skirt steak, and the braised chicken. All equally delicious but my favorite was the Paccheri. Get it! We were here to celebrate a friend's birthday and ordered the chocolate cake and also tried the gelato. That chocolate cake was so good! Been telling everyone about this place since that night and will definitely be back for more!
author: Tracy Y.

description:
As soon as I walked into Terzo, I knew I would have a fantastic dining experience - the atmosphere was airy, warm, and romantic, and our server was attentive and planned out the order of dishes at an easy pace. 

And the food was no less impressive. Everything we ordered deserved a rave - pita and hummus, grilled calamari, meatball, and braised chicken. Braised chicken is extremely moist and juicy with a distinct lemon and rosary flavor, as if it bathed in a rich soup and soaked up all the vapor and flavor. 

And kudos to their drink menu! I had the best Cabernet Sauvignon of this year, from "Kith & Kin Round Pond, Napa, to pair with the food. Their Italian flavored soda is a great alternative if you prefer to be sober while as the same time ecstatic. 

I would definitely return for my next special occasion!
author: Yuhuan T.

description:
our waiter was beyond a gem... the food was ok.. nothing special. 
I would return to visit the waiter and sit by the fire. 
cozy atmosphere by the fire but overall fun place decent food
author: Spike 2.

description: It was late in the evening and my Birthday to boot and I have an unusual reason to give a glowing review to Terzo. My car broke down on my way back from Santa Rosa and I ended up right in front of Terzo.  Though I haven't had a meal there, I can't say enough about the warm, friendly, concerned, compassionate, inviting staff, especially, Ron.  I'm going to have to come back to enjoy a meal, but for now...I'm a huge fan just for being looked after and treated very kindly by Ron and his colleagues (and many customers as well) while I was stuck and waiting two hours for a tow.  Thank you very much!!!
author: Karen L.

description: Loved the food and the atmosphere. Just walked in without a reservation and were immediately seated at a communal table for eight, which was very nice. We had Nicole as our server and she was excellent, both knowledgeable and fun.
author: Daniel D.

description:
We were a group of 8 girls celebrating a bachelorette party and two birthdays. The restaurant and staff could not have been more accommodating to us. Our waitress, Nicole, was amazing and guided us through the menu suggesting how many of each small plate to get for our group. 

The restaurant sat us in the back room, with two other tables of 4. One of the other tables in the room, was comprised of 2 older ladies and an older man- who were extremely rude to our group. After telling us to "just shut up" and calling us the "rudest people they ever met" they ended up leaving and our waitress and the manager came over to apologize for their behavior (they were even rude to them). 

Any event- the restaurant knew we were celebrating special occasions and brought out birthday desserts and bachelorette desserts for us. They were also super accommodating of the shellfish and nut allergies in our group! We had a fantastic night with amazing food. 

Food highlights for us: mozzarella de buffalo, bruschetta (ordered like 4 of them!), hummus, meatballs & polenta, spaghetti, skirt steak and flourless chocolate cake - but really everything we ordered was delicious!

Thank you Nicole and management for a truly special night.
author: Pam J.

description:
Came here with a friend for SF Restaurant Week, which was a great deal. Unlike other Restaurant Week menu offerings which are limited to a handful of options, their $40 dinner lets you pick a small plate, a large plate and a dessert from their daily menu.

FOOD: AMAZING. Everything on the menu sounded good, everything we ordered was delicious and all the other dishes we saw other people having looked amazing as well! I wish I came with more people so I could have tried more dishes. All the meat and seafood were perfectly cooked and the dishes were all full of flavor. On the oily side but not at all heavy. Portion sizes are on the smaller side (a healthy portion size), which was disappointing because everything was so good I wanted more!

PRICE: On the pricey side, especially given the portion sizes, so I wouldn't frequent here. But the food quality definitely matches the price.

SERVICE: Friendly staff and food came out reasonably quick.

ATMOSPHERE: I love the general vibe here. There's a bar and a communal table in addition to individual tables. Sophisticated, cozy, dimly lit, a little crowded but not too noisy. Great for a date or special occasion. 

==============================

*** SMALL PLATES ***

-GRILLED MONTEREY BAY CALAMARI ($13) - 5/5
[with Umbrian Lentils, Wild Arugula, Pimentón & Aïoli]
I've never had calamari with such amazing texture! Incredibly soft and tender. None of that chewiness you normally get with squid. Great flavors in this dish from the aioli. I'm not a fan of lentils in general so that part was just okay.

-BRAISED NIMAN RANCH LAMB SHOULDER ($15) - 5/5
[with Roasted Romanesco & Salsa Verde]
My friend and I cut the lamb in half to share, and we could immediately tell that it was cooked perfectly from how easily it cut. SUPER TENDER. A little fatty and oily,  but not heavy. The salsa went really well with the lamb.


*** LARGE PLATES ***

-ROASTED STEELHEAD SALMON ($28) - 5/5
[with Green Basmati Rice, Green Beans, Spigariello & Tzatziki]
I LOVE salmon and there's nothing that makes me happier than salmon that melts in your mouth. Soo soft and flaky that I didn't want to share! I skipped most of the skin because it was pretty fatty, but it had a nice texture to it. I'm usually indifferent towards rice, but the basmati rice in this dish was really flavorful (probably from the oil..). The green beans added a nice crunch and texture to the dish as well. I didn't feel the need to have the tzatziki with the salmon because it was already flavorful on its own.

-GRILLED NIMAN RANCH SKIRT STEAK ($29) - 4/5
[with Potato-Leek Gratin, Roasted Broccoli & Olio Nuovo]
We asked for our steak medium rare. Normally, restaurants err towards the medium side of medium rare, but to my surprise, they cooked it towards the rare side of medium rare, which is exactly how I like my steak. The meat looked like it would be incredibly tender, but I was a little disappointed to find it a little stringy with a slight chew. Full of flavor, but I would have preferred less salt.


*** DESSERT ***

-LEMON YOGURT SORBETTO ($8) - 3/5
I picked the sorbetto because I wanted a lighter, more refreshing dessert, and everything else looked heavy or rich. I really enjoyed the first few bites - light with some tartness -  but then I started finding it too sweet.

-ORGANIC ICE CREAM ($8) - 3.5/5
[Mint Confetti, Salted Caramel, Milk Coffee]
There's also vanilla and chocolate ice cream, but you can only pick 3 flavors, so we went for the more "interesting" ones. I thought the ice cream might be too sweet or rich, but theirs was nice and light. My favorite of the trio was the mint confetti, which was refreshing and had small nibbles ("confetti") of chocolate in it rather than chunks. The milk coffee was pretty good too, but I thought the salted caramel was too sweet.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Absolutely phenomenal on so many dimensions:

One of the most flavorful food I've had in the city
Wonderful service
Romantic and welcoming ambience

We were here for my fiancé's birthday and the food was phenomenal. Favorites were skirt steak, mussels, gnocchi, and potato chips with aoli

Definitely will come back
author: Helen M.

description:
The worst customer service that I've experienced in any restaurant. We appeared for a reservation, waited for 30 minutes, and then when complaining the manager said he wouldn't speak to us when we asked for a round to take the edge off for waiting. He erroneously said that our table was not ready because we were late, despite arriving on time. 

Once we were finally seated, food was cold. We have been dining here for years, but will not return again.
author: Jack K.

description: Terzo is a wonderful neighborhood spot in the marina for dinner.  The atmosphere is cozy and warm and the food is delicious.  The hummus is literally out of this world, it would be a crime to go there and not order it.  I've been about a dozen time in the last few years and have always had a wonderful experience. It's perfect for a date night or a celebratory meal (they have a large table for parties) that is great.   Highly recommend for anyone who is looking for a cozy dinner spot with sensational food and wine!
author: Chelsea W.

description:
A nice little find in the Cal Hollow area.  A nice dinner after a day of holiday shopping in Union Square.  

I had a previously horrendous experience at a Tapas restaurant in the bay area so I was reluctant to try another one in area (after having recently gone to Spain and had spectacular tapas).  All concerns were brushed aside once the first order of food arrived at the table.

The grilled calimari was tender and had a nice flavorfull char.

Next up was the mozzarella di bufala - fresh cheese, toasted bread, salad with the right amount of acidity to balance the dish. 

Gnocchi - this was recommended by our server, but it was the least liked dish.  Bland and starchy gnocchi was not what I expected.  The only thing going for the dish was the truffle shavings. 

Steamed clams was gobbled up by the table quickly.  I took that as a sign that everyone agreed it was good.  

We also ordered two larger entrees:

The Niman Skirt Steak: tender, flavorful, and cooked to heavenly perfection of medium rare on the rare side.  It doesn't get better than that. 

Finally, we had the house made fettuccine dish - wow, it was amazing.  I was worried when the earlier gnocchi dish bombed out, this dish ended the dinner on a great note.
author: John L.

description:
I went to dinner here last night and was not disappointed! The ambiance of this place is exactly what I love, intimate but yet casual. The place was packed on a Thursday night with no tables open. I loved, loved the atmosphere. 

As for the food, everything we ordered was amazing. The two dishes that really stuck out to me was the Lamb Keftas. I probably could have ordered 5 more plates of this. It comes with a dipping sauce that's absolutely amazing. It tastes like a mix of hummus and Indian green chutney. 

The other dish that blew me away was the skirt steak. I was actually going to order the salmon and then our waitress suggested the steak would probably be a better option when I asked her which one she would prefer. It definitely did not disappoint. The chimchurri sauce that comes with the sauce is phenomenal! Overall, I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Tina J.

description:
It's time to make amends. I made dinner reservations with my girl and it was an excellent experience. 

Food: scrumptious. We started by sharing the hummus and pita, and the cauliflower apps. And it was good. I know how can you swoon over hummus and pita. Well... I did 

We weren't too hungry so we split the pork shoulder with Brussels sprouts (pulled pork) and it was outstanding. Bottle of Sangiovese ($50). 

Service was outstanding

Not five stars because in spite of the excellent decor the tables are a bit too close to each other and I felt no privacy.
author: Massimo M.

description: went there last night. Good food and good device. Cramped space though. There website has pictures of alcohol bottles but they dont have a liquor license. Thats weird.
author: Davis M.

description: Excellent Mediterranean food to share with friends.  Great wait staff, bartenders and hostess. Strong selection of beer, wine etc.  My "go to" choice in Cow Hollow. What else can I say?
author: Theo G.

description:
Great food - but terribly overpriced. 
The pita and hummus was only okay. I got the skirt steak for the entree, and it was also just pretty good. The only thing that stood out to me was the potato gratin that came with the steak. Everything else was not worth the high, high prices. Ambience was very nice, however - the music was nice and I appreciated the dimmed lights.
author: Ally M.

description:
Everything what you order here is all from Local Farmers, organic and fresh.

Menu changes everyday

What we had for dinner
- Calamari (A plus)
- Beets
- Steak
- Chicken (AA plus)

Everything we ordered had different ingredient, light, fresh taste of it. Make sure you have extra bread to soak in the soup / sauce from each dish because is finger licking Delicous.

Dessers the Panna Cotta was Superb and the Flourless Chocolate. 

Service is Outstanding as the Waiter had explained every dish and recommendations.

BYO BOTTLE (Fees may apply)
VALET PARKING available
Make RSVP
author: Helena H.

description:
The food here was INCREDIBLE (5 star caliber) and I don't know how I haven't heard of it before... The 3 star rating comes from the very mediocre/bordering on bad service that we received throughout our 2.5 HOUR long dinner. I came in with the fam (part of 4) on a Sunday night and were seated for our reservation right away. The restaurant was pretty empty at this point and through the course of the night we watched it fill up, and empty our entirely.  We seemed to have like 3 different servers (bartender, waitress, hostess?) which caused for loooong wait times between every aspect of the meal. I don't know if they're understaffed at the moment since other reviews are very different. We waited around 15 minutes to be offered water, 10 more to order a drink, couldn't find a server to order additional food twice (had to ask the bus boy to get us more pitas), consistently had empty water glasses, and waited another 15 minutes after putting our card down to pay to have the server/hostess/bartender take the check and say "oh no one has gotten this for you yet?".  Not that I don't like long, drawn out dinners, but this was punctuated with empty glasses and plates so it was not by design.   

Onto the food-which was awesome!! We ordered the hummus & pita with spices that came out warm & delicious. My mom wasn't feeling well so we ordered (after a while) additional pita to mop up other sauces.  We also split the meatballs (my sister thinks they may be the best she's had), the grilled calamari (perfectly cooked & with a nice touch of acidity), and the arugula salad with peaches/ cheese that was delicious as well.  I split the steak with chimichurri and smashed potatoes that was fantastic in taste but very buttery/oily at the bottom.  I also had a taste of their almond cake with strawberries that was both rich (from the almond) and light in texture.  

I may return for the food-but if I do I would prepare to spend the evening dining here/not come starving because the service is SLOOWWWWW.
author: Raina D.

description:
Went with a group of people to Terzo to celebrate a friend's birthday.  This place has a lot of good things going for it...decent location, nice atmosphere, solid food... So why only three stars?  Well the service was terrible.  She was rude, condescending, impatient, etc.  Perhaps because it was a table of 8 "youngish" people who didn't look like we would tip well?  Not sure. 

My other huge problem with this place was the price point.  I get it, restaurants love to do tapas because they make more money on each dish, but come on... While ordering someone asked how many meatballs were in the $12.50 meatball dish.  She said they were about the size of golf balls and it comes with 2 meatballs.  $6.25/tiny little meatball.  Are you kidding me?  I can buy a couple pounds of meatballs for that price.   The thing is, I am not a super cheapskate fast-food eating type of person.  I eat at a lot of good (and expensive) restaurants.  However for me there needs to be something special to justify spending a ton of money on food.  Terzo just did not have this something special for me.  

The other food we tried was good, including the hummus, but nothing was life changing or worth the price.  If money is no object to you and you look like a good tipper than check our Terzo for some above average tasting food.  If you are looking for upscale Mediterranean I recommend Kokkari Estiatorio.  If you are looking for something that is a better value check out Troya or La Méditerranée.
author: Paul W.

description: Rude bartender, felt rushed to leave. Good place for a date if you go well before closing time
author: Britton C.

description: Had a fabulous dinner last night at Terri.  Was impressed on all levels.  Starting with the wine selection at the bar-great choices and my fav montepulciano d'abruzzo.  Not only a great vibe with a real vibrant crowd, the playlist music they chose was unique, nostalgic and set a great tone.  Our food was over the top. Started with the grilled calamari then the chicken cacciatore served in brodo so succulent and tasty. Not the usual heavy sauces hunters stew. The chicken feel off the bone!!! I'll be back for sure!
author: Midge C.

description: I love this restaurant! I live right down the street, and I love sitting and having a glass of wine and an appetizer at the bar. The bartender Phil is awesome! The food is delicious. Great music, not too loud. One of the best restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Claire W.

description:
This restaurant deserves 6-star rating, hands down. After a few of my party ended up not coming, we were still taken care of. Ron offered to take our coats at the beginning of the meal and seated us at the communal table. The ambiance was on point and all our needs were taken care of - water, the timing for meals brought out, seating arrangements, etc. Just phenomenal. 

My wife is gluten and dairy intolerant and Ron took extra care to mark the menu based on what she could eat. He was extremely helpful and delightful.  After helping all of us through the ordering process, he estimated perfectly how much food we would need and didn't push us to order more than necessary.

We ordered the following: arugula salad, roasted beets, hummus, patatas bravas, sauteed black trumpet mushrooms, potato gnocchi, calamari, bruschetta, tomato braised pork meatballs, Brussel sprouts and potatoes, crispy chicken breast. They were all off the charts. My personal favorite was the mushrooms or bruschetta.

I wouldn't hesitate to book another event here.
author: Benjamin H.

description:
Terzo is a cozy Mediterranean restaurant in Russian Hill, with food comparable in taste to Kokkari but executed in a more subtle way. My boyfriend and I came during Restaurant Week and were blown away by the dishes. The food was right up my alley and I have absolutely nothing to complain about.

We started with the chicken spiedini, hummus and pita, and grilled calamari. The chicken spiedini came with two skewers of perfectly grilled chicken, onions, and chunks of doughy bread drizzled with an amazing cilantro sauce. The portion was bigger than I expected and it was like no chicken skewer I've ever had before. The grilled calamari was definitely another highlight, maintaining its tender texture without being rubbery. The seafood sat on a bed of beans with a light sauce that let the calamari shine. To round out the small plates, we ordered an extra hummus and pita that is definitely a must-try. Their pita is house made and baked to order, with a fragrant blend of herbs rubbed on top that really makes it unique and delicious.

For our large plates, we ordered the grilled pork loin as well as the salmon. Both proteins were cooked perfectly, with sides that complemented them well. The salmon had the best crispy skin I've had on a piece of fish in a long time, breaking way to the flaky inside. It was served on a bed of green basmati rice that brought a slight Asian feel to the dish. The grilled pork loin came with braised cabbage and spaetzle, a heartier dish that reminded me of German cuisine. 

To finish off the amazing meal, we had the flourless chocolate cake and the apple crumble. The size of our previous dishes were just right, leaving us with room to enjoy their incredible desserts. The chocolate cake was rich without being too sweet, and the house made whipped cream even had me spooning up dollops when I'd usually be scraping it off. The apple crumble was piping hot out of the oven, with a light crumble and apples tossed in brown sugar and cinnamon. It was a simple but perfect ending to a more complex meal. Terzo has definitely become one of my top favorites in the city and I will without a doubt be back for more!
author: Ashley T.

description: Terzo has amazing food, service and atmosphere. It is warm, inviting and sophisticated inside. I had the Chicken and it delicious. I also loved their wine menu. I sat at the bar and was helped by Phil. He was amazing at making wine and food suggestions and was great company. I definitely recommend visiting this amazing restaurant. I can't wait to go back!
author: Jenell V.

description:
The ambiance is the only positive aspect of our dinner. The decor is very modern and vibrant.
However, the food was subpar. Between the four of us we tried four different dishes and we all agreed upon their mediocrity. Some were too salty, other were simply not worth the price. 
I understand that the Marina/pac heights is an expensive area to run a business, yet the quality of your goods should never be overlooked.
Based on the competition in area, I feel it's safe to say that it is very simple to find better quality within a 1000 ft radius.
author: Mr. Food G.

description: Nice room.  Nice people work there, professional while friendly.  Needs anticipated.  Food good, but not great, or perhaps just not what we were expecting.  Had the calamari small plate, but lentils were the predominant flavor, with calamari a side note and no hint of the anticipated char.  Excellent hummus.  The skirt steak tasted predominantly of the aoli/topping.  Again no char tasted.  Nothing tasted bad, it was a nice meal, we would have preferred that calamari be the star of the calamari dish and skirt steak be the star of the skirt steak dish, not hidden amongst other ingredients.  $200 for 2 small plates, 2 large plates, 4 glasses of wine.  Next time we are in the area, we will be back at Zarzuela.
author: Mark M.

description:
Excellent Neighborhood Spot!

A great selection of small plates perfect for sharing.  We had the Hummus, the meatballs with polenta, an arugula salad, and the sardines on toast which was the highlight of the night.  The rice pudding for dessert was also delicious.  The wine list was good, the service was great and the atmosphere is sophisticated but friendly.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
We shared several small plates.  2 excellent, 1 good, 1 meh and 1 bad.  The meatballs and the gnocchi with brisket ragu were both excellent.  The chicken skewers were good.  

We were very excited to try the BBQed peach bruschetta, but the bread it came on was way too thick and tasted like a (higher quality) wonder bread.  The bread and cheese, which was like cream cheese, overpowered the peaches and balsamic.  There was no BBQ charring flavor at all.  Though I am inspired to make a simpler and more traditional bruschetta with grilled peaches at home so it wasn't a total loss.

The patatas bravas were bad.  Thick chunks of potato deep fried with sauces that didn't do anything for us.  Ketchup would have been better.  And if you're thinking home fries... Don't.  These were thicker.  It just tasted like a mouthful of bland potato.

I'm not sure where they get their bread from, but it also showed up in the chicken skewer, where it worked a lot better.  Still, it seems like this bread is a point of pride for Terzo and frankly it's below average for a restaurant of this caliber.  The bread  with butter placed on most 4 star restraunt tables is better.

Despite 3 negative paragraphs above, I like the atmosphere and would go back.
author: Andrew F.

description: Absolutely delicious!! Nice front patio with heater that allowed dogs. Absolutely great. The hummus was so creamy an absolute must!! 10/10 recommend
author: Autumn G.

description:
We hadn't been to Terzo in years, but driving down Union St. in SF around dinner time prompted us to drive by.  Parking is a pain, but there was a space around the corner so  we snagged it - clearly dinner at Terzo was meant to be.  Hubs and I shared numerous small plates: Mozzarella di Bufala , Marinated Artichokes & Roasted Pepper, Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari, Sautéed Wild Mushrooms and the Free Range Chicken Spiedini. The only dish that was a bit underwhelming was the Marinated Artichokes, otherwise the dishes had layered flavors that were amazing and complemented each other.  

We didn't need dessert, but split the warm apple crisp with vanilla ice cream and 2 coffees.  Great end to a great meal.

I really like the look and feel of the restaurant, and the music playing last night was great.  Also want to compliment our server, Catherine, who was friendly, very knowledgeable about the food and wine, and helped guide us through the menu.
author: Joli W.

description:
Last weekend, I dined at Terzo for the 2nd time, and I confirmed to myself that it's one of my favorite restaurants in the city.

I dined with 4 others, which was great because we got to share a several dishes and get a good taste for them all.  I recommend trying a bunch of dishes when visiting.  

Here's a dish by dish commentary of what we tried:

Hummus:  Bread was particularly good and flavorful; hummus was decent. 

Roasted Butternut Squash:  excellent dish texture and flavor was great!  This was unanimious hit among our group. 

Tomato Braised Pork Meatballs:  Nice meatballs; I felt they were cooked a bit more rare than I would have liked, but the excellent tomato sauce made up for it. 

Arugula Salad:  This dish was nice.  Nothing to write home about but good.

Mozzarella di Bufala:  This was also nice. Again, not mind blowing but good.

Braised Greek Style Chicken:  This dish was excellent.  The chicken fell off the bone so tender.

Linguine:  I really liked this dish as well.  Texture and flavor both stood out.  

I thought the Beer Selection on Tap was pretty unique: Chimay, Trumer (German Pilsner), Big Daddy IPA.  I went with the Trumer, which came in a tall skinny glass with the European measurement "cut off" listed.

Out table shared 2 desserts as well.   We had the Apple Crisp with Vanilla Ice Cream and the Pumpkin Cheesecake.   Both desserts were blow away.  I'm a big dessert guy, and I felt that this really capped off an excellent dinner.

I'm told that the menu changes very often (want to say daily but not sure), so I'm looking forward to coming back again and again!
author: Sebastian N.

description: I went herewith my gf after she saw a show of CheckPlease of the bay area on tv, and I have to admit that if she hadn't pretty much forced me to go, I wouldnt'vve bothered to drive down there. I was starved by the time we got there, and it wasn't awseome, kinda  bland and they really didn't give much on a plate, not enough to share. The show went on and on about how great the pasta and meatballs were, but I've had better at Pasta Pomodoro, which is a chain. It was ordinary and even my gf had say the same thing, though she did like her salad. I'd same my money and wouldn't go back.
author: Mack L.

description:
Went here with my boyfriend on a Wednesday night. Super cute date spot. 

Ordered and shared:

Appetizer - 
Mushrooms - SO GOOD
Asparagus and prosciutto - mediocre, nothing special

Entree -
Steelhead - really good, salmon skin was really crispy and loved the rice and greens that came with it. 

Will definitely come back again.
author: Leighann Y.

description:
Went here with the family after my dad found this place on yelp.  It is a medium sized restaurant, with friendly staff.  The menu is made for family style with small and large sized dishes, which rotates daily.  We tried an array of things.  Some of the most notable were the mozzarella salad, very yummy.  The meatballs were also very tasty with the polenta.  I also really liked the salmon large dish which was very well cooked and melted in your mouth.  The home made egg noodles were very good as well!

The desserts we tried were the panna cotta and the flourless chocolate cake, both of which were yummy.

The staff here was helpful, though not as attentive at times but it was a busy night.  Parking is along the street, with the option for valet.
author: Jenn T.

description:
Tried Terzo for the first time the other night and it was "meh."  First off, my boss and I show up at 5:18 and apparently they open at 5:30.  The manager/server/whomever he was wouldn't let us inside.  I mean, we would've just sat and drank wine and waited until the kitchen was ready.  So I said "you want us to wait 10 minutes?" in which he snapped back "13 minutes!"  I rolled my eyes and we left.  We were turned off by the experience and walked around the block.  We only came back because my boss was REALLY wanting some red wine.

Once inside, the hostess said we can eat and drink, but we must leave by 7:15.  At this point, I'm completely over the people and am hoping the food will at least save them and this review.

For the wine, I had the Banshee Pinot Noir.  It was fine.  My boss...I think she ordered the Zin-Phomaniac Zinfandel Old Vines.  If that's the one, then it was really good and definitely recommend it.

For food, we ordered 4 appetizers and 1 dessert.  We ordered: Wild Nettles-Ricotta Ravioli, Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari, Tomato Braised Pork Meatballs, and Grilled Halloumi Cheese.  The funny thing here is that I thought the Grilled Halloumi Cheese was going to be gross, but it turned out to be my favorite!  It was perfectly seasoned and I totally recommend it.  As for the other dishes...pffft!  (rolls eyes)  They weren't bad per se, but they weren't great = None of them had any flavor whatsoever!  For dessert, we had the Flourless Chocolate Cake with Cocoa Nib Toffee Whipped Cream.  That was a good time and I'd recommend that as well.  The presentation of the food was nice and pretty.  Our server was nice and attentive and recommended the wine.

I guess since the restaurant is located in Cow Hollow/Pacific Heights area with all this old money around here, all the old people love the food.  It seems old people are like kids in that they like bland food.  The place, the staff attitudes, the food, the prices, it's all very pretentious.  They think they're rockstars or royalty when really it's all very basic and underwhelming.  Unless my boss wants to go back and drink AND pick up the bill, i won't return or recommend the the place.
author: Shaun W.

description: Had a wonderful at Terzo. Food had wondetful flavours, with some choices a new exoerience. The staff were helpful and genuinely welcoming, like they really enjoyed being at Terzo. I would give them a 4.5. When we told them we were celebrating my birthday, they surpised my wife and me with two fantastic desserts which they didn't charge us for. Nice being in a place where peopke love what they do, do it well and make you feel welcome. Beautiful!
author: John L.

description:
Love this restaurant for it's warm contemporary interior. As a past diner I anticipated another delicious meal here, but this time I thought the food was too salty. It took a series of refills of my water glass to quench the thirst as our table shared calamari, skirt steak, chicken and steelhead. Everything was fresh and plated nicely including the appetizers.

We had a very nice waiter which made enjoying the evening as easy as always.  TIP:  I'd skip the chocolate cake with carmel/expresso whipped cream unless you'd be happy with a chunk of plain chocolate cake (the topping didn't wow enough to justify the price).
author: Lynn S.

description:
Great ambience but the music needed more refinement (loungy music accompanied us throughout hand picked by the bartender). decent quality of food.

Artichokes appetizer - great dish but the grapefruit should be pitted

Calamari with cantollini beans - pretty tasty. Would have liked a bit less beans proportionally comparing to calamari

Fava bean flatbread - great balance of flavors with citrus within fava bean paste along with subtle flavored cheese.

Chicken main dish - too salty. recommend skipping
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Great location in the neighborhood part of the Marina. Very quiet neighborhood great for a date. The service is amazing and out of this world!

For white wines I would highly recommend the Falanghina Campanis Italy 2012. The ricotta and greens ravioli is great and the chicken spiedini.
author: Kunal T.

description:
Came in for dinner on a friday and there was no wait, though we got seated by the bar which we did not mind because it was cozy and comfy.

Shared a plate of the roasted beets which was delicious and also the salmon dish was amazingly delectable.

For drinks we ordered a glass of carianne wine and balckberry italian soda.

We truly enjoyed our dinner.

We wiil be back.

By the way, the bartender who served us has a great personality.
author: Nelle A.

description:
I would had rated this place with 3 stars if it wasn't because of their incredible food.

We had to wait for 45 minutes!! (with a reservation). After we were sited, our waiter just decided to disappear! Where was he for the next 25 minutes?! We'll never know. Total wait = 1 hour and 10 minutes!!!

You can guess we were not in our best mood by now, but food was really delicious and it came out really fast, so we didn't have to wait long to eat (we were starving by now!)

The only miss were the scrambled eggs with truffle. 
I would come back again hoping we won't have to wait this long.
author: Maggie J.

description:
We came here for the restaurant week menu last weekend with another couple and were very impressed by the food and service.

The restaurant has a very warm ambiance and a great vibe.  We were seated at a four top in the back room and our server promptly greeted us.  

The restaurant week menu you can select from 3 appetizers, 3 entrees and 2 desserts. It also includes a glass of white or red wine, for $65. 2 of us ordered off menu while the other 2 selected the RW menu.  

We shared the calamari and beets as starters, both were very tasty. We all ended up ordering the same entrees, the skirt steak with chimichurri sauce, and none of us were disappointed.  The meat was cooked perfectly. The dessert was an apple crisp with vanilla ice cream and it was delicious.

Next time we go, I'd like to go with others that are willing to share so we can try several small plates.  They all looked amazing.
author: Ladan G.

description:
Great place, really awesome food. Service is fantastic. If you sit at the bar, chances are Phil will serve you and he's a solid dude. 
The vegetable plate is one of my favorite things...and somewhat healthy.
author: Brett B.

description:
I really like the ambiance here. Very dark, not too loud. Fun waiter.

Recommended is 2 - 3 dishes per person... I think we got to maybe about 5? Left pretty satisfied though. 

Highlight: Meatballs with Polenta. Incredibly moist, and the polenta is a surprise texture to the dish. Honestly I didn't even really need the polenta. I could have had it on it's own! 

2nd place goes to the celery soup. Incredibly creamy with the right amount of citris. 

Honorable mention goes to the side of fried onions. It is HUGE. Way too big for two people. Made with buttermilk batter and red onions, great sweet flavor. 

Downfalls: Lemon Sorbet. Was creamy because it is homemade, but way too sweet. Came with a dusting of powdered sugar, which was not needed. Also the beet salad, while good, was nothing special. 

Overall an a ok experience.
author: Kim T.

description:
Amazing food with an excellent selection for vegetarian palates as well.  Terzo features great 'Mediterranean' food, with a truly diverse array of offerings seemingly 'themed' with Greek, Italian, and other regional specialties.  The hummus & pita plate is a MUST order- and usually we wind up getting extra pita to finish off the generous heap of hummus. We've recently enjoyed their grilled asparagus, cheese plates, their meatballs and much more.  The mahi mahi dish is typically on the menu and is a true winner as well.  Honestly, everything we have ordered is really impressive and flavorful.  This is a great place to share plates!

The restaurant is in a fun and pretty corner within Cow Hollow, they have valet parking as needed, and the prices are reasonable.  Really this place is a winner and I will be back again asap.
author: Andy S.

description: Great food and atmosphere. The chicken spiedini and skirt steak were amazing! Niccole was awesome too. We will definitely return.
author: Trina W.

description: I'm visiting SF over the weekend on a mixed-purpose trip...a little business and a little pleasure. I ate here last night with some family on their recommendation and it was excellent. We tried a mix of small plates of hummus, chicken spiedini, trout rillettes and meatballs to start, all very tasty and well presented. Two of us had the skirt steak for the main and one had the fettuccine. This was accompanied by some really good North Coast Pinot Noir. The service was both friendly and very professional, a balance that a lot of restaurants struggle to achieve but this was right on. Overall a really pleasurable experience!
author: Brian C.

description:
I'll never look at pita and hummus the same again. Shared a few of the smaller plates and enjoyed everything.

Great date spot and I highly recommend the hummus and asparagus small plates!
author: Linda X.

description:
Cute Mediterranean place with a variety of dishes and fresh local ingredients! 

Hummus - A little disappointed in the portion size, but maybe because it was spread flat out on a wide plate, instead of into a smaller bowl. Nonetheless, it was delicious, with nicely toasted pita to dip.

Roasted Beets - Fresh, juicy, and plump! 

Red Wine Braised Wagyu Brisket - Simply divine. It melts in your mouth like the most delectable cotton candy brisket, if that were such a thing.

Penne Rigate alla Norma - Pretty good. Interesting mix of crispy and smooth textures.

Grilled Niman Ranch Skirt Steak - This was good, but was consumed after I had taken a bite of the brisket, so was far too tough in comparison. But the true start of this dish was the Potato-Leek Gratin! Also melts in your mouth. Maybe I'm just lazy and prefer food that requires minimal chewing.

For dessert we had a Chocolate Mousse and Plum Ginger Upside Down Cake. The Plum Ginger cake was more Plum than Ginger, and I was hoping for a slightly spicier kick, but it was still tasty! Chocolate Mousse was fantastic, though I'm super biased because I love anything chocolate.
author: Jane K.

description:
Came for a sponsored dinner and had some great food.

Appetizers included pita with hummus and a green salad. Main course with mahi mahi. Dessert with apple crisp.

All in all a great experience with good service (thought since it was a sponsored, usually the service is constant impeccability). 

Valet parking available. Ambiance is quaint.
author: Julia P.

description:
This is one of the most amazing restaurants I have ever eaten at. From their house made hummus and pita to the skirt steak, everything is fresh and of the highest quality.

This is a perfect date spot for a special occasion. Everything is made to share which is perfect because you will get to try more than one thing. Make sure you make a reservation on the weekends because it can fill up quick.
author: Ryan O.

description: I went to Terzo on a whim, and ended up loving it. I grabbed dinner with my brother and we started off with some wine. I usually stick to Sauvignon Blanc, and it was a great drink to start off my dinner. We first ordered three small plates: the tomato braised pork meatballs, sautéed wild mushrooms and the free range chicken spiedini. Out of the three the sautéed mushrooms were my favorite and it was AMAZING. The crispy polenta with the delicious mushrooms went together so well. The meatballs were my second favorite small plate and the spiedini was just okay. The meatballs also had polenta, and it was very creamy and tasted perfect with the meat. My brother and I shared the grilled niman ranch skirt steak and WOW the flavor! The skirt steak comes with with potato-green garlic gratin and broccoli di Cicco which were great but the steak itself was so perfect that I didn't need any sides. Terzo's skirt steak is one of the best skirt steaks I've had. I can't wait to go back!
author: Radhika G.

description:
Great recommendation from a colleague.

Food was amazing, service was great - all around a great date night! We just wish we weren't in the back room, it's a bit secluded. Only other recommendation is that the halloumi cheese should be bigger for it's price. Other than that everything was great! I believe Isaac was our server, he was on top of everything and very friendly. We look forward to heading back soon!
author: Christine J.

description:
Cute little spot in cow hollow in my friends hood. He picked it, and the menu looked great. Very cute space with nice decor.

We ended up ordering a bunch of smaller plates to try (we ordered most of them). Most of the plates were quite good. The wine list is also good. The service here was pretty good

Issue here is that it's really expensive, which caught be a bit off guard until I got the bill.
author: Jonah K.

description: Went to Terzo with some friends during SF Restaurant Week and was blown away! The vegetarian version of the prix-fixe dinner menu included a truffle butter risotto, spaghetti olio and chocolate mousse for dessert. Each item on the menu was tastefully made and paired well with the wine selection that was offered that night. By 8:30pm the restaurant didn't have an empty table but the service remained impeccable. Would highly recommend checking out this little gem in the Marina!
author: Niyati M.

description:
Adding this to my list of favorite restaurants in the city!

Ambience:
Came here with my husband on a Sunday night with no wait. The accident outside the window was the biggest conversation piece of the night but it was nice to sit at a "nice restaurant". Very upscale but relaxing. We shared a bunch of tapas and everything was amazing although very pricey :(

Food:
+Sweet Corn- loved the touch of mint in the corn and peas-delish
+Roasted Beet- a lot sweeter than i thought but very tasty with the yogurt sauce
+Arugula salad- the warm potato cubes and cheese made this amazing
+Hummus & Pita- the hummus was meh but the seasoned pita was DELICIOUS; ordered extra pita for the leftover hummus
+Chicken Spiedini- sooo flavorful and the perfect spinachy sauce to go with it
+Rice Pudding- amazingly cool and fresh with peaches in it
+Cherry & Blackberry soda- perfect drink to go along with the tapas

Service:
Very friendly waitress and staff. Quick to bring out our foods and get us what we needed.

I can't wait to come back here and bring friends and family back!

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Simply prepared food using good basic ingredients.  Some things really clicked, such as the bruschetta, onion rings, and roast pork loin (nice large portion).  Others not so much ... e.g., the Porcini salad.  Great wine and very inviting decor.  Worth a drive if you're in SF.
author: Tom N.

description:
Is the food life changing at Terzo? Probably not. 
But is it consistently delicious, time and time again? Yes. 
Add in byob (corkage is $20 I believe), good service, and available seating often, you've got yourself a winner. 

5 stars in my books.
author: Vic C.

description:
So the fam was in town from Asia and we wanted to grab some tapas style food so we made our way over to Terzo in the marina. We were not starving and my parents were still jetlagged so we decided to keep it a small meal. The inside of the restaurant is very warm and inviting with a bar and a view into the kitchen. The dining area is spaced out nicely leaving enough room between tables. They also have a back room which can be rented out it appears to groups for small events. The servers were extremely friendly here and very attentive. We perused the vino list and were able to get a solid recommendation based on what we were searching for and there were plenty of reasonably priced vinos on the list. I noticed that they also had an interesting beer list. Not extensive but definitely some surprises on the list that I have not seen in too many restaurants. 

After looking through the menu, we decided to focus on the small plates and ordered an assortment of them. Ordered the hummus, steamed mussels, black truffle risotto, tomato braised pork meatballs, and the arugula salad. They provided bread (which you have to ask for apparently?) which was good and apparently homemade so definitely ask for it. The hummus was a simple & classic dish and the pita was quite good. The mussels were actually really good also with the sauce being unique. Definitely ask for more toast points because you will definitely want to dip it in the sauce. The mussels were well cooked and delicious. The black truffle risotto was okay but a bit bland for me so not a dish that I would probably order again. The arugula salad was a nice simple dish and the dressing was well made which was a nice palette cleanser. The meatballs with polenta were awesome with the polenta being a perfect complement to the meatballs which are straight up authentic. It comes out with two but feel free to add one more meatball for a slight charge! 

All in all, a solid restaurant for tapas. I wish I had tried a few of their large plates but we left feeling pretty full after these dishes. Definitely will be back.
author: Dan M.

description:
Terzo was absolutely great. Favorites were the grilled calamari, the sautéed wild mushrooms, and the pita + hummus! The flavour of the squid was so amazing, with just the right amount of aioli and salt to really draw out the sea. Garbanzo beans and veggies under the squid were also delicious, having absorbed all that seafood goodness. And yeah.. everyone raves about the pita and hummus, the pita is REALLY good and the hummus is sooooo creamy.

We also ordered the pork loin, lamb keftas, and arugula salad. Service was a little choppy and I felt forgotten a few times, which might have to do with sitting at the bar. 

Dessert: apple crisp with ice cream is a nice way to end the meal ;)
author: Kathy Z.

description:
Solid 4 stars, if possible would give 4.5 stars. 

Thank you, 7x7 for putting this gem on the big eat list. 

American style tapas with mostly small plates and a few large plates. 

The four of us ordered almost all the small plates sans 1 or 2 and got the pork large plate. 

The unforgettable for me:
Hummus and pita
Bruschetta with farm egg
Chanterelle mushrooms with polenta

$240 including tax and tip for 4. Brought our own wine. Not cheap but food doesn't disappoint and ambiance is romantic, warm and quiet enough to catch up with friends.
author: Melody T.

description:
My friends and I went to Terzo for a group dinner - perfect place for a group since you can try a bunch of different dishes. 

We ordered the hummus, meatballs, chicken speidini, sauteed mushrooms with polenta and the pasta special of the night. The most popular dishes of the night were the hummus, meatballs and chicken speidini. The chicken speidini is as good as everybody says it is - juicy, tender and flavorful. 

Service was great - very friendly and accommodating!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Midweek dinner with one of my favorite dining companions.  Since we're both preggers, no lovely libations for us, so no review about the adult beverages :(  On the upside, all of the cheeses Terzo uses are pasteurized!  Yay!  

We shared an order of hummus with fresh pita, which was a good starter, though I didn't care for the pool of olive oil in the middle of the hummus.  We also shared an order of pork meatballs on a bed of creamy polenta.  The meatballs didn't pack a punch of flavor, but it was tasty nonetheless and just the right density.

My friend had the beet salad, which she didn't enjoy so much.  On the flipside, I had the potato gnocchi, which were just about the perfect consistency, not too dense, soft pillows of pasta in a spicy tomato sauce along with fresh mozzarella bits.  Loved it!

Just a little note about our waiter.  I found him to be delightful, but he may be a bit touchy feely for some people.  He came by throughout our meal at appropriate intervals to check on how we were doing, and most of the times he came by for a check in, he lightly touched or tapped a shoulder or side arm.  Again, not a problem for me, since I am a bit touchy feely myself, and I personally found it endearing, but I could see some people being put off by it.

Grand total with tip and tax:  $76.
author: Christina L.

description:
My hubby and I came from hiking and wanted to get a bite to eat in the sf area so we found Terzo on Yelp and went for it.

I was a bit concerned that we were too sporty for this joint but as soon as we walked in we were greeted by a friendly hostess and there didn't seem to be a problem.

The hostess asked of course if we had reservations and we said no, even though there were plenty of seats open. 

She was super nice and gave us a table that was reserved at 7:30pm because we said we'd be done with our meal before then. We arrived at 6:24pm.

We were greeted by a very friendly server and our awesome meal began. I ordered a side of hummus and small plate tomato pork dish with polenta, which was simply out of this world. It was tender and all the rich flavors were in perfect harmony with one another. Wow!!!

My husband had the spicy kobe beef tri-tip small plate and we were both amazed at how awesomely tender and flavorful this dish tasted that I wished I would have ordered that instead of what I did.

As for the hummus + pita we were both greatly disappointed. The texture of the pita/herbs were a little too sandpapery and the hummus was also grainy and failed completely especially in flavor. How could this be? It's a greek restaurant. 

Our evening came to about $50, which was a little pricy but worth it. We will definitely be coming back but will skip the hummus next time around.
author: V W.

description:
We tried Terzo this weekend with a few friends for dinner. 
It was.... one of those places that is good, and you can't really complain, but just not one of my favorites. I think the reason has to be that it just wasn't memorable. 
The food was great, the drink selection is great (great beer and wine list) and the dessert was great too. It is a nice little place with great décor, but I can just think of a lot of other places I'd rather eat dinner at. 
Would I come here again? yes
Would it be my first choice on a Saturday night? not really.
author: Cara C.

description:
I wasn't too blown away by this place. Came here for a reservation at 8:30, still waited 15 minutes or so to be seated. Our server was nice, Nicole? I think her name was.  I didn't like how dark the restaurant was, and the music was way too loud. I couldn't hear half of what my date was saying, let alone what the server was saying. 

The food was very hit or miss! I enjoyed both of the entrees we ordered! The skirt steak was nice, rare, and perfect in my opinion. I wasn't a fan of the potato casserole-like thing that came with it. The king salmon was delicious as well, very simply grilled.
