Neither of the desserts blew me away. The apples in the apple crisp needed to be softer and more cooked, although the crunchy topping was good. The tapioca was too bland, it needed more flavor. 

The sautéed wild mushrooms we had as an appetizer didn't have enough mushrooms and the cheese overpowered what little mushroom there was.  The other appetizer we got was good! It was a blend of three cheeses with honey and bread on the side. The cheese was nice and creamy and just slightly sweet! 

I wouldn't rush back to this place. Only the entrees stood out as stars to me.
author: Kay A.

description:
Knocked off another restaurant that remained dormant on my bookmarks for some time...

Terzo is rather cozy and it was a full house that night. Ambiance was great regardless of whether you are on a date, dinner with friends/group date or having dinner with your parents. 

We shared the following:
- Hummus with house made pita and Za'atar (a must)
- Grilled Asparagus with Brown Butter, Hazelnuts, Almonds & Manchego
- Mozzarella di Bufala with Crème Fraîche, Smoked Salt, Rosemary & Sicilian Olive Oil
- Braised Moroccan Style Chicken with Basmati Rice, Pistachios, Sultanas, Herbs & Yogurt

Service was fine and my water glass was kept full. I did feel as though they were a bit short staffed as our server seemed to be somewhat struggling to juggle his tables. He was good on his word to make a one hour dinner happen. We had exactly a hour to eat dinner. We walked in w/out reservations and they let us sit at a table until it was time to prep for the more efficient diners who planned ahead and called. 

One regret though; with all this rushing we had to make do without dessert. Perhaps next time.
author: Esther A.

description:
No jokes. We made a reservation for 2115 on a Saturday night and they made us wait an extra 35 minutes until we were seated. Typically if this happens at a nice restaurant, they would compensate you with a little appetizer or something. This place didn't even bat an eyelash.  NEGLECTFUL customer service!!!!!

The only reason why I'm giving this place a 3 star is because the food was pretty good and the waiter was freaking awesome (I think his name was Ron or Rob). 

I absolutely loved the gnocchi and buffalo mozzarella. 
The hummus was okay but the bread that came with it was delish.
author: Astro D A.

description: This place is one of our favorite restaurants! The service is always amazing and able to accommodate some special requests. By far our favorite appetizer is chicken spiedini and the lamb kofta. We always start with the humus and pita bread since it made in house and absolutely delicious. We had the skirt steak and salmon many times and never disappoints. Just make sure you make reservations this place aways gets busy.
author: Sheila N.

description: Perfect food. One of the best value for money in SF. Great atmosphere and very friendly staff. Highly recommended
author: Lamiaâ B.

description:
Amazing call for dinner by my friend.  Definitely a must try. 

Food was delicious and out right flavorful.  Kudos.

Fried Farm Egg Bruschetta
Tomato Braised Pork Meatballs
Free Range Chicken Spiedini
Sautéed Chanterelles Mushrooms
author: Becky U.

description:
Terzo is a great place if you are looking to meet up with a friend on a Friday night, celebrate a birthday, or just enjoy a nice glass of wine with a decadent piece of chocolate cake.

On Tuesday, my sister brought me here to celebrate my birthday. Being that I had never been here before, I didn't know quite what to expect. I read the reviews before, and also looked at the pictures, but I have to tell you, those did not do it justice.

Let me first off tell you how incredible the staff was. Catherine was our waitress and she was the sweetest gal. She quickly brought us our drinks and made sure to give us just the right amount of time to look over the menu, before she came back to take our order. Now although the menu is not huge, there are a lot of items on there that sound equally as good as the other, but there is where Catherine really came to the rescue. 

We were debating between a few items, but she assured us, that we would not regret ordering the meatballs. Boy was she right! The meatballs are a must have when ordering at Terzo. There was the perfect amount of meatball to polenta.

We also ordered the Chicken Speiendini, recommended by our fabulous waitress herself, and again she was on point with the recommendations. The chicken was cooked perfectly, and the sauce they used, well that was to die for. The little bit of heaven that topped it all off was the small pieces of bread that were placed on the skewer in-between the onion and the marinated chicken. Cut those us, mix it together and well let me just tell you, you will not be disappointed. 

At this point we were beyond full, but because it was my birthday, we decided to go for some dessert. The only problem was, that we couldn't decide between the apple cobbler, and the chocolate cake. I think you already know where I'm going with this, but... we asked Catherine yet again for her recommendation and she was steered us in the direction of the flourless chocolate cake.  That cake was the best chocolate cake that I have ever had. It was super rich, and creamy, with a side of fresh whipped cream with some kind of chocolate flakes in it... absolutely heavenly.

Terzo, you have completely outdone yourself, and have gained two new frequent customers. I will definitely be visiting again, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place to a friend. So if you are looking for a great place to eat, you would be crazy to pass this place up. Oh and if you do find decide to try it out, ask to be seated in Catherine's section, because she is a rock star!
author: Kim J.

description: I was in SF and tried Terzo based on other positive Yelp reviews.  I was impressed.  First off, even though the place was about half full  the noise level was still at a comfortable range.  I hate having to shout at my dining companion because places are so loud.  Service was attentive but somewhat casual.  Food was DELICIOUS.  We had the grilled asparagus and ravioli to start, both yummy.  Then we split (2 people) the braised pork shoulder for dinner.  It was a good as it gets.  Served with mashed potatoes and gravy, it was comfort food in the best sense of the term.  Finished it off with the creamy, dark chocolate flourless cake.  I would absolutely go again when I am in the city.
author: E M.

description:
Great neighborhood restaurant with a fantastic vibe and food.  Had a great dinner here with friends.  Service was friendly and fast.  Really enjoyed the potato gnocchi with truffle as well as the fried egg bruschetta (a simple idea well-executed).  

The decor is sleek and the crowd is classy.  A great place to grab a drink as well.  Did think the club music didn't quite match the decor as my friend noted.

Terzo (third restaurant in their business group as well as the third place to stop by after work and home) was busy on a Saturday night and it's easy to see why.  They accept credit cards, including American Express.
author: Randy F.

description:
Terzo is soooo good, I am reluctant to even share its greatness with anyone.....but here goes anyway!

My boyfriend and I come here every year for Valentines Day. The food is divine and the ambiance very romantic. The menu isn't extensive - double the amount of small plates options to entrees - so expect to eat (or share!) lots of smaller dishes! 

We had the meatballs, hummus, and ravioli and couldn't believe how flavorful and delicious each one was! We also split the Linguini, which was very difficult to share. The wine list has absolutely everything you could want for perfect pairings with the food. 

I recommend Terzo for couples and small groups! What an absolute treat.
author: Kathryn D.

description:
Terzo was an overall quality experience. They have a great menu, including a large mix of small plates as well as bigger-sized entrees. It's a very intimate setting, great for a date or a small group catch-up. While the service was generally attentive and friendly, she wasn't terribly warm to over-chatty, which was appreciated. We went with another couple as well and everyone was eating vegetarian - at first glance, the menu didn't look to have too many vegetarian options, but between all of the small plates, there was more than enough to make us all comfortably full! They seem to rotate the menu seasonally and even monthly based on what's freshest. Everyone else at the table split a bottle of dry Riesling to complement the vegetables and they all seemed to like the flavor.
 
Food -
 
Beets and pickled onions served atop a creamy cheese sauce - The beets were roasted nicely so they didn't have too much of a "beet-y" flavor. When you got a whole forkful of everything together, the cool cheese paired well with the hearty flavor of the beet and the pickled onion.
 
Hummus and za'atar bread - The za'atar had a great spice/pesto-esque blend on it. The hummus was your regular, run-of-the-mill hummus, but was a nice creamy addition to the top of the za'atar.
 
Arugala salad - Very basic salad. Arugala mixed with nut and apple. Simple but a good combination of food and not overdressed.
 
Roasted vegetables (brussel sprouts, potato, carrot) - These had a delicious sweet glaze on them. They were tossed in that and an olive oil and truly seasoned to perfection!
 
Small toasts with burrata and shredded brussel sprouts - This was surprisingly good! A generous serving of burrata and warm/soft brussel sprouts. Upon first glance, the brussel sprouts looked like shriveled lettuce, but it was a great light texture and as it was sautéed, it really melted in your mouth. The combo of all three ingredients was relatively plain but packed a flavorful punch.
 
Gnocchi - This had a sharp white cheddar taste. Again, it really melted in your mouth. It was tossed with a bitter green, which broke up the sharpness. It was perfectly shaped homemade little puffs.
 
Mushroom and crispy polenta - The polenta had a nice pan fry to it and was topped with a variety of mushrooms. The mushrooms had been sautéed in what seemed to be a mix of olive oil (or butter) with a touch of cream. We ordered a second one of this - while it was light and airy it still had a bit of heartiness to it with the way the polenta was cooked.
 
Spicy pasta with spinach and pepper - The waitress said the chef had offered to cook us a full-sized version of vegetarian pasta if we were interested. This was cooked in an olive oil and all of the vegetables were sautéed. There was a nice heat to it and while the pasta was simple, it was cooked to a great texture between al dente and being too soft.
 
Bread pudding - This was great - almost like a cinnamon bun wrapped into bread pudding - was such a treat! Had cherries cooked throughout for an added touch of sweet/tartness. It was topped with what they called whipped cream, but it almost had the consistency/taste of a marshmallow fluff on top, which spread out perfectly over the bread pudding. It was really terrific!
 
Trio of ice creams - Another very simple thing done very well. Small scoops of ice cream (mint chocolate chip, chocolate and salted caramel) that again seemed to be made in-house. You could really taste the flavor in each (mint chocolate chip tasted like a girl scout thin mint), and we enjoyed these too.
author: Jackie W.

description:
HOW DID IT TAKE ME SO LONG TO FIND YOU, TERZO?!

We live 2 blocks away from this little gem.  I have no idea how this went under my radar for the last 8 years in SF.  I had always heard about their discount wine during certain days (can't remember which days now), but never heard about how great their food is.  Since coming for the first time a month ago, I have been here already two additional times.  

Hummus - delish.
Meatballs - Bomb.com
Chicken breast - yep
Skirt steak - double yep
Heirloom tomato panzanella - order it now.

I'll be back, Terzo.  I'll take any discounts you got on wine.
author: Maggie P.

description: Best meal I ate in San Francisco!  The atmosphere is lovely, the service was good and the food was amazing.  I ordered the Mozzarella di Buffala appetizer and the Hand Cut Noodles as an entree.  Both were incredibly flavorful.  The hummus appetizer is homemade with amazing pita that has a really nice seasoning on top.  Even the crispy onions were done well and added a nice little touch to our dinner.  Highly recommend!
author: Carrie F.

description: Love Terzo, it's one of my favorite places in San Francisco and you can always get a reservation the week of which is tough most places.  Great selection of wine and the service is awesome, all of the waiters are super knowledgeable.  The hummus and olives are really good as well as the meatballs with polenta. All of the pastas are incredible, I love that the menu changes daily.
author: Erin D.

description:
Hummus and House-Made Pita- #16 on the 2013 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list.

I stopped by Terzo specifically to pick up their hummus and pita since I was in this area a couple of weeks ago. Thank goodness I didn't have to park, because there weren't any spaces close by even on a Sunday night. I called in about 10 minutes before, and my order was ready when I got there. The staff is really nice and friendly, and I was able to double park and get in and out very quickly. The restaurant inside is really modern looking, but still had an intimate ambiance. I tried the hummus and house-made pita and za'atar ($8, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/terzo-san-francisco?select=d3dD1uVM9aheHCU4e6X6Hw#d3dD1uVM9aheHCU4e6X6Hw) later on, and it was delicious! The pita had too many sesame seeds sprinkled on top for my liking, but it was soft and fluffy, and the hummus was very smooth and creamy with the perfect amount of nutty taste from the tahini. Highly recommended, and I hope to come back to dine at Terzo soon!
author: Amy D.

description: GO, NOW. This is a foodie's paradise (great for vegetarians/ GF, too). We got a selection of 6 small plates (a lot for two people but perfect over a few hours). The squid was absolutely delicious, followed closely by the mushrooms over perfectly crispy polenta cake. The best part about our experience was how well phased the meal was, they really understood the concept of pairing plates and staggering when they came to your table. Our server was incredibly knowledgeable and helpful without smothering us. He never once rushed our leisurely pace. This is an absolute gem!
author: Emma D.

description: This is one of those restaurants where I tasted the food and said yes I need to come back. The first time I came here was for a friend's birthday and I was blown away with the taste of the food. I came back with a smaller group a few months later. I had the braised pork shoulder ($28). It was so tender and the meat just fell off the bone. We also had hummus ($8) and ravioli ($14) for appetizers. They were also both really good. If you're confused as to what to order, I would definitely go with the hummus. It was one of the best hummus dishes I've ever had. I will definitely keep coming back.
author: Rebecca D.

description: One of the better restaurants I've been to in the city. The atmosphere is warm and inviting - perfect for date night or to sit at the bar with a friends. There are a ton of small plate options to split, which is my favorite way to dine. And they have some of the best meatballs I've ever had in the city, and I've tried a lot!
author: Jeanna B.

description: We visited here on a whim and had an OK dinner. The restaurant in general has a nice feel to it, clean lines, open spaces. Seemed like a local spot - it seemed like the people around us or walking in knew the wait staff and bartenders. We were a little confused when we first came in because it was a very early dinner with lots of open tables, and the hostess decided to seat us at the two-person table in the walkway, near the bathrooms. We had to ask her to please move us since there were so many other open tables and she seemed put off by the request. We ordered two appetizers and the highly-recommended Greek-style chicken. We were disappointed with the appetizers but WOW WOW WOW on the chicken - they really nailed it! We were also excited about the wine list and had fun trying some new wines. Ultimately, we would come back and try again. But it's not our first choice.
author: Convict T.

description: I can't tell you how many times I've walked along Steiner st and missed Terzo. If you are in the neighborhood you should definitely keep a look out for it, it's a great find! The food was excellent and so is the service. I had the arugula salad and the ligurian chicken. The salad was very good and the chicken was amazing, such great flavors. My husband had the pasta and that was also very good. I didn't think it was all that pricey for SF. We will definitely will be back!
author: Elzabeth G.

description: Great food, service and ambiance! I had the steak dish and it was perfect.
author: Candice M.

description:
Excellent place for ambience, service, food and of course the wine. 

Tucked in a rather residential area, they serve some of the tastiest small plates. We had hummus, lamb shoulder, chicken skewers and beets.

The meats were super tender and flavorful! Beets were well marinated and yummm too! 

The only downsides were - the place isnt 100% Med, only a few dishes are Mediterranean.  The desserts were almost all American comfort foods (ice creams, apple pie etc) which is good but not what I expected from a Med/ tapas place. Also, the food is on the (extra virgin olive) oilier side.
author: Neha M.

description:
This is one of my favorite neighborhood spots in Cow Hollow.

The food is very good. My favorites are the meatballs, hummus and chicken speidini. 

Good wine list and the service is always friendly.
author: Alissa D.

description:
I held my brother's pre-wedding dinner here with our new extended family and we had an amazing night! We did private dining in their wine room and everything was absolutely perfect, from the wine, to the delicious food and desserts, the personalized printed menus they created for us, to the wonderful service we got. The chef accommodated food allergies in our party and recommended all the best dishes for a lot of variety in our meal. It was a really special (and delicious!) night, and everyone at Terzo contributed to this.

I worked with their marketing manager Miranda, who was excellent. She is professional, kind, and great to work with all around. 

I will definitely have another dinner here the next time I'm up in SF!
author: Beryl L.

description: Obviously, a place for locals. This was nice since I am not and like to avoid the tourist traps. Good food - felt more of a farm to table concept. Presentation was nice. A good place.
author: Joshua P.

description: One of my favorite places to eat when in San Francisco.  The menu changes but the food is consistently fabulous!  They serve small plates so order a few and share. The place is small and popular so make reservations and don't expect an intimate experience. The staff is wonderful, attentive and polite and even the chef will come out and say hello.  Great experience every time.
author: Suzie K.
Andrea L.

description:
A solid 3 stars. 

The first thing that ruined this place for me was our server - he seemed annoyed with us for some reason and/or he really hated his job.  This definitely started dinner on a sour note...

As far as other aspects of the restaurant, the ambience is pretty cool, and the food is decent.

For dinner, we tried:
- hummus
- arugula salad
- grilled calamari 
- roasted mahi mahi with garbanzo beans

The hummus and grilled calamari were decent, the mahi mahi was okay, and the arugula salad was definitely the weakest dish of the evening.  In summary, I wasn't very impressed with the food, and our server's attitude contributed to my overall dissatisfaction with the restaurant.  In my opinion, if a restaurant has really bad service, the food has to be quite amazing for me to keep coming back.   I may consider giving Terzo another try, but I'm definitely in no rush to do so.
author: Juliana K.

description:
Very delicious food, fine for vegetarians (at least one entree and several small plates are meat free), long wine list, romantic ambiance, and helpful staff. Great place for date night or group parties.

I came here for a first date and it was a good pick on his part. The staff was patient with us and helpful in picking out a wine. We were so involved in our conversation that we didn't notice that the restaurant was closing around us and we were the only ones left - staff never tried to kick us out. 

The entree menu allows you to get a smaller portions of the normal size, which I recommend if you're trying out other dishes and drinking a lot.
author: Lana L.

description: The best onion strings/rings I have ever had in my life here, place was a bit small but beyond that few complaints. More italian then greek I'd say.
author: Raymond H.

description:
So amazing!  Came here after a nice day of doing touristy things in SF with my parents.  Not sure if parking was actually difficult, but we got valet anyway since we were all starving.

The menu was not very big, but the was a wide selection to choose from.  I don't remember exactly what we got, but the waiter made great recommendations and didn't try to pressure us to order a ton of food we didn't want.

We started with an arugula salad, which was - in short - perfect. 

My parents ordered the pork loin, but I didn't have any since I don't like pork much.

Wish I could remember more, but I think it's a good idea to ask the waiter about the portion sizes.  I think it's a good place to come with 3 or four people.  Setting is intimate.  Don't come here with a big group!  

Love the ambiance of this place-- would love to come back for wine with the girls or something :)

If I were a guy, I'd definitely consider taking a girl out here for a nicer dinner.  The menu changes so don't always expect to see the same thing every time.  I guarantee you that this will impress her though!  Not too commercialized, intimate, fresh food, small bites... just be prepared to spend some money... but it will be worth it.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great meal. Delicious food. Started with 3 small plates/appetizers to share. The hummus was delicious, the grilled octopus was out of this world and the pork meatballs were amazing. For a main dish I shared the chicken and yogurt arrozo plate. Overall I give 5 stars for food ur took one away for service.
author: Shelly P.

description: I haven't been in awhile, but they had the best meatballs I have had in years. Great ambience.  Great chef.  I think they're a bit too pricey, however for frequent visits.
author: Molly C.

description:
Good wine selection, great small plates, awesome servers and friendly chef! 

Gotta love the Hummus. 

Try the Crispy Onions if you're craving something greasy yet delicious! One of those things that you know you probably shouldn't be eating, but just can't resist! Make sure you do share this, cause it's a huge pile! 

Always listen to the servers, they know what they are talking about and have good recommendations!
author: Helen D.

description: Great restaurant! We went there for our anniversary. We had the squid and muscles for appetizers and the steak for the main course.
author: Jamie S.

description: I came here on a whim because I got out of a conference and when I looked up some restaurants on Yelp close by, Terzo caught my eyes. This place is small and quaint with a very modern decor. My partner and I ordered a bottle of Ramsey 2013 Pinot noir $36! What a deal! We started with the Potato Gnocchi, Tomato braised Pork Meatballs, Free range Chicken Spiedini and concluded our meal with the Hummus. All the dishes here were fantastic! I highly recommend this place and I would be back when I'm in the area for some nice wines and good food!
author: Sue L.

description:
I saw Stephen Jenkins from Third Eye Blind here.  Since I saw a star here, I'm adding an extra star to their review!  Overall just wasn't impressed and have no plans to return.  The restaurant is super cute though.

Get:
polenta and mushrooms
the squid.

Skip:
meat dish I no longer recall (http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/boWnNnvmafRvIXdJ-PfEsA/l.jpg)
gnocchi
sausage
apple crisp
pot de creme
author: Erika C.

description: There isn't one bad thing I could say about this place. The staff was friendly and the food was absolutely to die for. The portion and prices fit for the medium scale restaurant. The hummus was amazing, but I honestly ate most the pita alone it was so good. Always warm. The Kefta small plate was excellent and the steak was so tender you could cut it with a fork. Will definitely come back to try the winter menu.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Delicious food and great ambience. I got the chicken entree which was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth. The lemon orzo is came with was to die for!

We also got the greek salad, meatball, and chicken skewer appetizers. All were so amazing.

Only complaint was the service, which several of us pointed out, was sub-par. Just a lot of rookie moves that added up. Overall- come here!
author: Alexandra W.

description: I really like Terzo, it's one of my go-to spots in the Marina these days. My favorite dish is their hummus plate, but most every small plate I've tried has been a winner. Last night the salmon was particularly outstanding. Also the flourless chocolate cake and fresh mint tea ended our meal on a high note. Service is always great and I've had excellent luck with their wine selection. It's a place I'm sure I'll be coming back to for years and years.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Service was really slow and they gave away our reserved table even though I had called in because we were running slightly late and they said it was ok. Food made me and my husband sick.
author: Felice S.

description: This place sucks! I had everything and it was mediocre at best. Meatballs were raw, hummus was what?, the only thing that wasn't #basic was the calamari.
author: Josh J.

description: Wow! Amazing experience! Salmon w tzatziki was delicious! Great service and ambiance!
author: Marika S. I.

description: A great find! Charming, each dish a gem. I love sharing small plates but large entrees are available as well. The calamari with lentils was simply out of this world. We were too full for dessert but am going back next month to try them!
author: Lynda B.

description: This was our first time dining here last Sunday. We were a big group of 9 people. Our waiter, was superb!!! He took our order and made sure everything gets to our dinner table on time, without extra waiting, without any errors. My 10yo son was personally asked about his dining preferences and his dish (pasta w/meatballs) was excellent. All of our allergy/food preferences were honored. We ordered whole bunch of appetizers, few bottles of wine and main dishes. Would definitely come back here for very good food!!!!!! Highly recommend!
author: Natalya V.

description: I went there for a birthday dinner last night and my mind was continuously blown. The food was incredible. The wine was incredible. The service was incredible. The ambiance was incredible. All around an incredible place. The meat was some of the most tender and savory meat I've ever had. Seriously, go to this place.
author: Gregory Z.

description:
Terzo is probably my favorite restaurant in the Marina and Upper Pac Heights neighborhoods. Delarosa is a close second but it is perpetually packed.

Food: simple, healthy, well-prepared, and delicious Mediterranean/Californian fare. My favorites: hummus, meatballs, calamari, skirt steak, salmon. 

Ambiance: Never empty, never 100% full (if you don't mind sitting at the bar during peak hours). Intimate. Great for a date but not overtly romantic (good for friends as well).

Service: some of the most friendly waiters I have had in a neighborhood restaurant. They are quick to remember names and faces and seem to always be happy.

Simply put, it's consistently good on all fronts. I come here once every few weeks and will continue to do so.
author: Alexander K.

description:
The wonderful boyfriend took me here for Friday night date night. I've walked by here a here a few times and always wanted to try it. Orin made a reservation and we were promptly seated when we arrived. Our waitress was very, VERY, friendly. She was uber cheerful and bared so much teeth every time she smiled, I had to suppress the urge to reach into my purse and rattle my Prozac bottle for affirmation.

Terzo offers a selection of around 10 small plates and 5 large plates. After consulting our waitress, we decided to order 3 small plates and one big one. Yes, these little piggies were hungry! We ordered the baked zucchini blossoms stuffed with cheese, roasted squash topped with cheese, the bacon wrapped dates stuffed with cheese and the braised pork shoulder entree. 

Our food came in rapid succession. This was the first time that I've tried zucchini flowers and I loved it! The preparation was simple and light to let the freshness and quality of the ingredients to shine through. The stuffed flowers were topped with a little parsley and lemon to cut the creaminess of the ricotta. When I read roasted squash on the menu, I was expecting butternut squash, but it was actually zucchinis that arrived on the plate. The suckers were so tender, they were bursting! The cheese was a great addition, adding nuttiness and saltiness. The bacon on the dates were crispy and the cheese melted with the sweetness of the fruit. All three were winners.

The pork shoulder was my favorite of the night. The meat was so tender, you could cut it with a fork. As with the other dishes, the chef showed restraint with the seasoning to let the ingredients speak for themselves. The mashed potatoes was silky and the wilted chard still had a bite to it.

We were pretty stuffed at the end of the meal so decided to skip dessert. 

Terzo has wonderful atmosphere and definitely great for date night. The lighting is dim, the noise level is manageable and a fairly large wine selection. Very good night indeed.
author: Alice W.

description:
i went to terzo with some friends for dinner and wine and we really enjoyed our time there. it is a great spot for dining with friends or for a date, since the food is intended to be shared and there is a nice wine list with many options in a relatively affordable price range.

the waiter recommended that we get 2-3 dishes each, but luckily we only started with 1 each (4 dishes total) since after the first 4, we were hungry enough for one more. the roasted beets were first, which were also my favorite. it was large chunks of golden and red beet on top of a creamy sweet sauce and topped with pickled onion. we then received the kale bruschetta. i thought the combination of the kale and prosciuitto was flavorful, but the bread was neither crunchy nor soft and therefore very hard to cut into pieces. we also had the sauteed yellow foot mushrooms with polenta; i thought the mushrooms were very flavorful but the polenta a bit dry. the grilled calamari was an excellent choice, cooked perfectly and served over lentils and rabe that had a very smokey, earthy taste. we then followed these dishes with the gnocci that was perfectly chewy with a spicy marinara sauce.

most of us enjoyed our wine, but my friend ordered a glass of syrah that seemed to taste a bit off. she was hesitant about sending it back, but the waiter was completely understanding and allowed her to choose something different instead. 

overall, we really enjoyed the meal. the server was attentive and helpful with the menu (despite the ambitious recommendation for number of dishes) and the food was interesting, flavorful, and surprisingly filling.
author: Jamie H.

description:
Full disclosure: Terzo is one of my clients.

That said, I took my wife here for "date night" with high expectations. My expectations were surpassed
author: Kevin B.

description:
Terzo marries fresh, Mediterranean cuisine with a relaxed, low-lit ambiance that's ideal for a date night or a night out with the girls. Go with someone who likes to share since there are so many delicious plates on the menu!

We ordered:
- Hummus with House Made Pita & Za'atar: I'd return just for this dish! 
- Roasted Beets: really tender and nestled on top of labneh (Greek yogurt-ish). The labneh helps to balance the strong flavor of the beets.
- Roasted Steelhead with Farro and English peas: I rarely order farro, but it was a fun mix with the (abnormally large) peas.
- Moroccan Chicken with Basmati: not as spicy as I was expecting, but quite well prepared.
author: Kelcey M.

description:
Loved this place! I'm so glad I finally checked it off the list of restaurant to-dos. Terzo met the mark, and then some, on all of my weekend-night-out dining necessities.

1. Ambiance - classic wine bar/restaurant, perfect lighting, wine bottles lining the windows, open bar area.

2. Service - our waiter Phil was so great. Typical girls night out entailed more talking than menu browsing but Phil was more than patient with us. He also did a great job of providing recommendations and timing our meal. 

3. Drum roll please for the food! 

Hummus (4 stars) - nothing not to love about this dish! Simple and classic. 

Beets (5 stars) - beautifully presented and perfectly cooked. It came with a caramelized onion topping which was just enough flavor to not detract from the beets but turn the dish into something special.

Brussels (4 stars) - delicious and cooked well but personal preference on these guys is to be a little darker. Still a great dish though with melted romano cheese on the top.

Mushrooms with Polenta (5 stars) - Terzo nailed it with this one. Arguably the "richest" dish of the night but but this dish was light and downright fun to eat.

Calamari - (5 stars) rivaled the above said mushrooms as my favorite of the night. Grilled fish on top of a bed of white beans. Simple ingredients with a flavor profile that more than wowed.

We brought our own wine to share - $20 corkage. 

This place gave me all I could ask for, I will definitely be back!
author: Brianna M.

description: I liked this place. We dined here for a company dinner so it was closed to the public. Their house hummus was divine and I also ate this chicken dish that was absolutely amazing! Great wine selection and just an overall good time.
author: Carla M.

description:
Terzo's solid. The food is never short of great and you can always expect a full menu of apps, entrees and wine. Their meatballs, skirt steak, pork loin and beet salad are some of my favorites. Wine selection by the glass is good and the place is just around the corner from my apartment. 

Why don't I come here for dinner every week then? Not sure. Think it's the general aura of the place. Staff aren't all that friendly--not unfriendly per say--but generally they seem like they're just waiting for their shifts to end.  Instead of speaking to the diners at the bar, the bartenders will just chat with other servers on the side. I've dined there a few times, and haven't gotten the feel that they care about me coming back. Not a big deal, but it just lacks the charm that other places nearby have, like Gamine, where the owners are always present and welcoming.  Such a shame, it could be so great if it were more intimate.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
Small plates to share.

Arugula salad - with cherries, nice starter. Nothing special for a fancy place

Buffalo mozzarella

Hand cut noodles with porcini mushrooms - the truffle flavor added extra depth to the soft chewy noodles.

Pork meatballs with polenta - melt in your mouth goodness. And I don't usually go for meatballs anywhere.

Chicken spiediini - tender, moist, tasty. A few too many large crouton chunks on those skewers to make it look like more food.

Grilled calamari - a bit too much crouton in that small bowl trying to make it take up more room in the presentation. Calamari was grilled to perfection and the tomato-y salsa was fresh and delicious on its own.

A calzone-like pastry/pizza (forgot the name, and not on the current menu today) - fresh mozzarella cheese in here was excellent. Unfortunately running out of room in the stummy to eat much more of it.

Minus 1 star for desserts. All three desserts were subpar.

A chocolate "mousse" - was like a chocolate pudding in a glass cup. For $8. It was described as "in between a mousse and a flourless cake." It was neither of those things.
Pistachio ice cream - I'm sure it was organic as they say, but there were small ice chips in the consistency that told me it's been sitting there for a while in the freezer. Had actual pistachio, so it wasn't just flavored, but not that creamy due to ice chips/being old.
Strawberry shortcake - not that fresh, lemon curd not the best, a little hard and old-tasting

Wish we hadn't ordered any desserts, kind of put a damper on an otherwise excellent meal.
author: Victoria C.

description: This place is beautiful.... loved the food, loved the service and loved the ambiance. It's a fabulous place, and the food is brilliant.
author: D H.

description:
Came  here with a friend around 7:30pm on Tuesday.  We did not make reservation and good that the restaurant was not busy when we got there.

The hostess and server were very friendly, welcome and helpful.  However, it took forever for the food to come out. So took out one star here.  3 stars for the service.

We have ordered:

Roasted Peach Bruschetta - 3 Stars.  Not too bad but came with one big piece, hard to share.  The roasted peach was sweet and was good with the ricotta.  

Arugula Salad - 2 Stars.  Nothing special.  Very little walnuts (four little pieces) and goat cheese.  

Grilled Pork Loin - 4 Stars.  My friend doesn't like the potato and they replaced it with corn, tomato and squash.  I think that was even better than potato because it was more light and healthy.  The pork was juicy and tender.  Very good.

We also wanted to order grilled calamari but too bad they did not have it that night.  

Overall, the food was ok but the wait of the food was too long.
author: Liza T.

description:
Great neighborhood place for upscale tapas. Nice ambiance and interesting selection of plates.

We ordered the hummus which came with some of the better pita I've had so far (and I've had a lot!), brisket (not my favorite dish but hearty and flavorful), meatballs (nothing out of this world), the mozarella with artichokes (so great with the artichockes and grilled bread-definitely more unique than your average mozzarella dish), and last but not least--the chicken spiedini. This was by far my favorite dish. It came as small pieces of grilled chicken on a skewer with grilled flavorful bread and onions. The flavors were out of control (in a great way) and the bread+chicken combo reminded me of a better version of Zuni's famous chicken (seriously-save yourself the $45 bucks and just come to terzo instead.) I would come back every day just to get this chicken!

Good job, Terzo! I'll be back soon.
author: Rachel L.

description: My experience at Terzo was amazing! Four of us shared several small and large dishes and. Everything from appetizers to desserts, was incredible!
author: Emily F.

description:
This was a surprised find. Very good/modern mediterranean food. We ordered one appetizer and two entries to share. All of them turned out to be delicious. 

Good ambience, well. Very classy and modern. 

We enjoyed our dinner there and look forward to going back again to try other things on their menu.
author: Kai Y.

description: Fun spot with some smaller plates and great wines. A little expensive so save it for a nice occasion or date
author: Jim N.

description: The food here is delicious! Get the chicken spiedini over and over again! The hummus is delicious, the meatballs are delicious, and everything else is delicious. Their food is flavorful and the service is outstanding. If you're ever in San Francisco, please get a reservation here then head to The Tipsy Pig for drinks!
author: Obinna A.

description: Terzo offered a delicious array of plates but the prices seemed a bit high for the main dishes. Regardless of price, I'd suggest going with small plates and sharing with your tablemates. I had a delicious beet salad and a grilled calamari dish. The hummus was also delicious and for a few dollars extra, the kitchen brought me a plate of veggies to make the meal fully GF for me. Didn't try the wines - they seemed a little pricey - but might next time around. Glad to have found a spot near my house for when I want a nice night out!
author: Erin W.

description: Knowledgeable, friendly staff, welcoming atmosphere and great food. The hummus, calamari and chicken were my favorites! Will return.
author: Janell H.

description:
Randomly found this place on Yelp last Saturday and decided to give it a try since we love tapas-style food! First of all I loved the ambience -- classy and modern look, seemed casual yet dressy as well. Service was more than great, the hostess was really nice when we dropped in earlier than our reservation and our waiter was very attentive. 

For the food, we got grilled calamari and chicken spiedini, which were both really good! Chicken was really flavorful and I was so sad when I finished my portion. Boyfriend got the steak, which he couldn't stop talking about how good it was, and I got the pork loin. I must say the pork loin wasn't amazing, it was cooked well but a little more on the bland side for my taste. Portions are a good size though, not too much and not too little!
author: Sam U.

description: Amazing restaurant! Every single thing on the menu was awesome! Greats small plates  for a leisurely date night! Location is perfect right by Union street for window shopping! service was exceptional and accommodating! Can't wait to return, I know it will be one of our regular date night spots!
author: Leah S.

description:
I went out on a Friday night with good friends and really enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. The dishes have a mediterranean flair with lots of options to choose from. Being gluten-free, I asked the waitress to modify a couple of dishes and she was quick to respond. I did not get any cross-reaction, which is a good sign that they take food intolerances seriously.
We ordered 3 starters (hummus, beets, salad, octopus) and 3 mains (wild salmon, pork, chicken) and a dessert to share (flourless chocolate). All were perfectly cooked and seasoned, presented with appeal and served in just-right portions. I really liked that vegetables were not scarce, in most restaurants they are purely ornamental. The dessert was decadent, made with quality chocolate.
The wine list offers many options. Service was careful without being overdone. I will definitely come back!
author: Alexandra L.

description:
Another favorite.  Delicious food, delicious drinks.  Great service.

Gnocchi, Grilled Neman Ranch Steak, Braised Moraccan Style Chicken, Steamed Mediterranean Mussels, amazing Prosecco.

Savory, tasteful, heavenly. 

Highly recommend! :)
author: L T.

description:
Terzo was an wonderful experience from the moment we walked in. The vibe is relaxed and the restaurant has a cozy feeling with an elegant touch -- the wait staff is professional and attentive.
We were a group of 9 women, so what did we not order? Everything. Many in our party have roots in the boot and those from Northern Italy all agreed that the gnocchi passed the test. It is an easy one to get wrong. It was not just good, but delicious and light as a feather.  The sauce, well, that, and everyting (steak, chicken, sides, etc.) were pure heaven. We were still talking about the meal the next day.  I saw that someone mentioned the small plates being really small. We thought they were generous.  ...

What a pleasure all the way around!
author: F C.

description:
First time coming here. Took the parents, it turned out to be the perfect spot. Loved the concept of being community based and utilizing organic local products. Perfect ambience for a relaxing early dinner and comfortable for groups and dates. 

Food:

Ice Tea - Freshly Brewed
Hummus - Must have, and they give you unlimited pita bread
Calamari - a bit too much going on in this dish, but the squid was fresh and quite tasty
Meatballs - delicious but only gave you two, wish we could have had more than that.

Sockeye Salmon for entree - Shipped fresh from Alaska delicious, just a bit dry for my taste, but still good.

Recommendation: 

I will definitely be back here, but I think the best way to go, is eating tapas style. Next time I go, I'm going to order all appetizers and share with friends.
author: Alex L.

description:
I'll be back. SOLID 4. 

My family was in town and Terzo was recommend- i'm glad I took up her advice.

Atmosphere was everything I wanted-dim, cozy, and clean (great for a date).

Their Zin-excellent.

Hummus and Pita-good.

Meatballs and Polenta-I felt like I was back in Venice, delicious.

Angel Hair Pasta-good.

Chicken T-AMAZING.
author: Angela B.

description: Thumbs up Good food, satisfied with service and we love how they took care of us. Good for groups
author: Santosh G.

description: I live near by Terzo and it is always my go to restaurant when I want to be sure I will have great food. It never disappoints. The brisket ragu is truly amazing. I love the atmosphere. It is quite romantic and not stuffy. I always have a good time when I go there with my husband. Definitely one of the nest restaurant in the neighborhood!
author: Lili H.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in the city - this place is a neighborhood gem. Awesome ambiance and service, unique dishes that are DELICIOUS. We shared a bunch of small plates and all were fantastic. For me, the standouts were 
(1) Heirloom Tomato and Farm Egg Bruschetta 
(2) Braised Pork Meatballs
(3) Melon and Smoked Prosciutto 

They were also kind enough to forgive my OpenTable screw-up. Oops.
author: Priya N.

description: I absolutely love everything about Terzo - amazing food, great ambiance and fantastic service! I discovered this place 4 years ago and still consider it one of my favorite spots. Every dish I've ever tried has been delicious!
author: Emilia R.

description: Great atmosphere and amazing food. Good place to go and share small plates of food to be able to try many items on the menu. Great Italian sodas. Very nice staff.
author: Lydia I.

description: My favorite SF dinner date spot. Awesome food, cork fee is fair and the atmosphere inside is outstanding.  The menu is always different and the staff is nice.
author: Jake T.

description:
um, this place is top notch. they are quick at serving, and come on...the small plates are amazing.

great birthday place

GET THE HUMMUS PLATE!
author: Ellie B.

description: Upon sitting down, the waiter assured me that they were very experienced in modifying their dishes to make them gluten free. This was a relief to me, since I have celiac disease and have had no choice but to eat gluten free for 8 years now. Unfortunately, when it came to the small plates, modifying the dishes for this chef means removing any semblance of flavor. I had expressed concern about whether a couple of the small plates we ordered would still be good after the removal of the gluten components (chef is unwilling to substitute, only willing to remove), and the waiter assured us that these were still good options. The waiter later admitted that none of the waitstaff ever tries the gluten free versions of these dishes. The frittata was a bland and overpriced green omelette, and the sautéed chanterelles with creamy polenta (the standard crispy polenta must have some sort of flour in it) sorely lacked salt. They also charged an extra $4 for the half a dozen tiny slices of carrot and celery to eat with the hummus we had ordered since pita is a no-go. I wouldn't expect a restaurant that charges $30 an entree to nickel and dime me like that. Entrees were very good, but nothing superb given the price, and I won't be coming back.
author: Ezra B.

description:
Bummer.  Terzo is slipping.  I used to love this restaurant and it is right by my work hence I love to eat here.
I have been twice in the last three weeks and both times I could not help but think about how the food is going down hill.
The service still stands out, wine is still varied and solid and the lighting is still my fav in the city and....both recent meals myself and my guests were not happy.  Why?  The meat, chicken and pork, are absent of flavor.  The chicken skewers were dry and the calamari was not cooked well.  
I hope they reverse this trend bc SF needs this place to stay solid.
author: Kate S.

description:
Atmosphere - amazing
Food - phenomenal
Service - attentive

Cannot ask for more...highly recommend for a date spot.
author: Patrycja K.

description:
Loved. This. Place. 

Total date night spot. Great food; good wine list (lots of high end bottles; good selection of glasses); intimate ambiance. Very attentive staff. 

We had the arugula salad (excellent, if not a little unbalanced - too much salt or vinegar?); calamari (the tentacles are the best part!); and the pork loin, to split (the star of the meal). I had the Napa Cab (bold, oaky, awesome); my wife had the Zin (good, light, very nice).
author: Jon B.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. Pretty much every dish is amazing (so its hard to pick one to write about) but I always get the hummus + pita.  I recommend getting a bunch of small plates instead of the big ones so you can try more things. I also love one of the waiters (can't remember his name) and he always give great wine recommendations.
author: Thomas D.

description: A great neighborhood restaurant.   Brave the parking frustrations ...it's a complete dining experience.  Great food, trained staff, happy diners.  Loved the polenta small plate...had to get two.  Arugula salad is a lovely complement to all dishes.
author: Lisa L.

description:
My friend and I went in around 5:30pm tonight for a light bite and a drink at this restaurant. While I will give our server Michael credit for his cheery disposition, he was absolutely clueless.  The place was empty.  We had to cajole Michael back to our table to take our order. He seemed more interested in sitting behind the bar talking to a co-worker about this and that vs. serving his customers.
The real clincher came when my friend told Michael she thought the lentil soup was bland.  He immediately replied, "Oh, don't tell that to chef."  Yikes!  Seriously?  Please DO tell that to chef.  Someone needs to teach Michael restaurant 101.  Customers drive business not chef idiosyncracies.   Michael then was an idiot enough to press the matter and insinuate that because we liked meat, perhaps the lentil soup was a bit to light on taste.  
I won't return to this restaurant again.
author: Ellen F.

description: Fantastic food and service;  we have not had such a great restaurant experience in a long time!  Isaac Benjamin (our server) enhanced our entire evening.  We are so happy to discover this hidden treasure.  We will be back with more friends soon!
author: Willie W.

description:
We arrived and were greeted by a friendly hostess that took us to our table as we were waiting for friends.  The place looked just the right combo of modern and warmth combined with classy.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive especially since we had to wait half an hour for our friends.  We never felt rushed or uncomfortable, he checked in and we did break down and get olives and the hummus.  Both were great and authentic, good hummus is hard to find.  

Finally our friends arrived and the ordering began:)  We got the beets, mushrooms, chicken, and gnocchi as our starters and steak as the entree.  The starters were all great, the flavors were nice, the combinations balanced.  The beets provided an nice acidic choice for the other richer dishes.  The gnocchi were very tender, a nice surprise because so many places don't get them right.  They were light, fluffy and delicious.  

The only dish that was disappointing was the skirt steak.  It was well cooked and flavored but the steak was chewy and stringy, I literally couldn't chew through several of the pieces. 

We ended with espresso, which did not disappoint and were going to get the apple crisp but it was taking a while so we skipped it.  

The tab at the end was very reasonable, we brought a bottle of wine and paid a $20 corkage fee.  $75 per couple is great for a nice, fit for foodies dinner. Even though we tried almost everything on the menu that we wanted, I would come back.  I love places that don't rush you out and overbook.
author: Inga W.

description: Not sure why it is so hard to get a reservation at this place. My wife and I ate here last night and everything was just ok. The flatbread, the chicken, and the salmon we could have made better ourselves. The meatballs and flourless chocolate cake were the only things I would get again if we went back. This place used to be better...def going down hill some
author: Ross M.

description:
So glad my boyfriend and I stumbled upon this restaurant! 

I'm a fan of it all here: the ambiance, the service, the FOOD!

We tried the: 

Grilled Monterey Calamari (B+)
Keep in mind this is grilled, not fried!

Mozzarella di Bufala (A)

GRILLED NIMAN RANCH SKIRT STEAK (A+++++++++++++)
I NEVER rave about steak. Even when it's good, it's just good. I don't know what they have going on in the kitchen here but this was cooked to PERFECTION. Honestly, one of the best steaks I've ever had in my life...and I'm a red meat lover. When ordering, do NOT forget to order this! Sometimes if I close my eyes and think very hard I can still taste it. Mmmm. 

We had two glasses of wine as well with what is listed above and the bill came out to be $80. Not bad for what you're getting.

It was the perfect amount of food for us. Not too little, not too much. Will be returning...
author: Angela C.

description: I found the size of the portions and their prices to be unfavorable. The hummus was tasty but not much of it. The meatballs for over $12 as an appetizer and the skirt steak for $29 were both steep. The chicken alla Marsala was tender and flavorful but was buried in a mound of goopy parsnips-potato puree. The waiter was brusque and we felt rushed throughout  - so I would say this was a sub-par dining experience. On the plus side, the interior of the restaurant is very attractive with lots of wood, bricks and low-lighting. Our reservation was respected with prompt seating.
author: Cynthia W.

description: Amazing. Service was good. Calamari, potatoes, gnocchi and humus all excellent. Steak and chicken entrees also so so good.,. And then there was desert OMG! Cheesecake wow.
author: myra f.

description: Alway tasty with great service. Ron is the best!
author: Adam C.

description: Local favorite. Good wine and slow eating and munching on small plates ie like tapas. You can eat less and still be full based on the pace of the plates coming out.
author: LQ W.

description: I literally salivate when I think about their hummus/pita and chicken spiedini.  Sooo good.
author: Cin S.

description:
Came here with a group of friends for my birthday dinner a few weeks ago and loved it! I love tapas and getting to share a number of small plates and this restaurant was perfect. We shared 7 or 8 dishes and a couple bottles of wine everything was amazing. We might as well have licked the plates... 

The service was great, the ambiance of the restaurant was great, and we got to sit at a large, high table which I loved.  I told several people after this night that we had dinner at Terzo and every single person told me how much they loved it too. All in all a great place!
author: Monika C.

description: YUM!!! The food was elegant yet comforting. The ambiance was warm and inviting. Extremely reasonable in terms of price, something for everyone, fantastic service. We had the hummus, beets, pork meatballs and the pasta Bolognese. All of it was terrific. I highly recommend this place.
author: Rosanna Y. D.

description: This was our second time at the restaurant and this restaurant is one of our favorites. The only annoying part of this experience was the 30 mins wait even after making a reservation (and hence 4 stars).  The food, otherwise was really good. The chicken spiedini was delicious. The meatballs were tasty and the polenta base was really good. Grilled calamari was really good as well. Overall, great food, good service and good ambience.
author: Chet L.

description:
Many of my friends have been here, and I constantly here the same thing: "meh, it was ok". That being said, I think this place is underrated. I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere. The food was fantastic. The service was so so, but I'm not going to let that bring down the rating this place deserves.

There were three of us, and we split 5 small plates and a dessert. Here's what we had:

1. Heirloom Tomatoes - fantastic. Fresh ripe tomatoes and perfect sized chunks of mozzarella soaked in a flavorful pesto sauce. $9.5

2. Grilled Kadota Fig Bruschetta with Mascarpone, Honey & Mint. $9.5 - absolutely my favorite dish, absolutely amazing.

3. Tuna Nicoise Salad - perhaps the most beautifully presented and largest of the small plates. Delicious. $15

4. Roasted Beets with Labneh, Dill, Nigella & Pickled Onions $8.5

5. Roasted Local Ling Cod with Potato Purée, Corn, Sungold Tomatoes & Tarragon $13 - tasty, but not my favorite

6. Flourless Chocolate Cake with Espresso Whipped Cream $8 - Good but not great

I'd definitely go back again to experience some of the new things they have on their menu everyday.
author: Krista S.

description:
4.5 Stars! I'm surprised this place isn't more popular.  Maybe this is due to the fact that is just barely outside the fringe of Union street madness and a little further away from Chestnut madness.  I find there are only a handful of good dinner restaurants in the Marina and most have a very long wait.

I'm even more surprised to find that Terzo has mixed reviews - I came here once a couple months ago and had an excellent meal.  We ordered:
- the hummus: good, not great. My boyfriend really enjoyed it, but for a Mediterranean restaurant, I expected better
- tomato braised meatballs: delicious! served with polenta, which was a divine combination
- the brussel sprouts: served with honey, rosemary and (I think) goat cheese.  I never thought I would prefer sprouts without pancetta! These were exceptional!
- braised Moroccan style chicken: Holy Sh*t! I've had a lot of chicken and always been a strong believer that no matter how well you cook chicken, it is still, well...chicken.  SO not the case here.  This chicken was so good I would have ordered it before beef, pork, lamb or duck (and this is saying a lot)!  This is the kind of dish that just makes you feel good.

We went back a few weeks ago and had another excellent meal. We ordered:
- a sausage dish: a chef special.  I can't for the life of me remember what it was paired with but it was simple and excellent
- 1/2 portion hand cut fettucine: with fava been pure and creme fraiche. I'm so anti-fava been anything because this usually means bland.  Not the case here, so good we almost ordered another half order!
- grilled skirt steak: with herb potato gratin, asparagus and chimichurri: the most tender skirt steak I've ever had.  Cooked perfectly, incredible flavor and perfectly paired sides

Only disappointment was the dessert menu.  I'm so sick of seeing the same damn panna cotta, flourless chocolate cake, apple crisp BS.  Try something original!

The service was great (2 different servers, both great). Ambiance is trendy & romantic - great date night restaurant.  No trouble getting a table, even on a friday night.  We made reservations both times but didn't need to, which I found so incredibly attractive in the Marina insanity of dining on a friday/saturday night. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Devin W.

description: One of the best restaurants I've found so far in San Francisco. Ordered 5 dishes, and all of them were fantastic: Escarole Caesar Salad, Fried Egg Bruschetta, Pork Meatballs, Greek Chicken (ridiculously amazing), and the Flourless Chocolate Cake. I'll definitely be telling all my friends about this place.
author: Shannon K.

description: Delicious food, with great service, and a few recommendations for an indecisive out of towner. It was cozy, quiet, and very comfortable. If you're up for dessert try the vanilla and cardamom rice pudding with pistachio and candied oranges!
author: Kate P.

description: Super friendly staff and great food.  The Chef was willing to prepare any of the dishes we wanted and still be allergy friendly.  The squid is delicious and the beets were prepared to perfection.  Highly recommended!
author: Karlito S.

description: Great food and great service! Had dinner at Terzo with a picky foodie who wanted to substitute ingredients and sides. They were very patient with us! Haha I highly recommend the citrus salad and the pork shoulder. Very delicious and great presentation on the plate.
author: City T.

description: We went on a double date with friends.  Food is very good.  Service is slow and spotty.  We were not seated at our reserved time.  The waiter was sweet and funny but he would go missing often.  We enjoyed the food but most likely won't go back.
author: M B.

description:
I came here with three friends on a Saturday night. To my surprise it was full of old folks. It didn't knock my socks off, but really enjoyed the chill vibe. The three best plates are the hummus, braised mary's chicken with Moroccan sprices, onions, yogurt & basmati rice, and the spaghetti with rapini, onion, roasted garlic, ricotta & lemon. For dessert, definitely go for the flourless cake with espresso. 

Our dining experience was great. We drank a little too much wine and oh man. My phone fell in the chicken, so gross. I was a bit upset, the chicken was amazing, but no one wants to eat chicken that tastes like an iPhone. We were talking really loud and having a good time, but we did get a lot of stares from the old people around us. There was James Brown music blasting in the bathroom and by the bar, but where we sat, it was more chill. Overall, this restaurant is trendy, best for taking your family or a date and enjoying a laid-back dining experience.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
This is definitely one of my new favorite restaurants in San Francisco! 
We went here spontaneously with one of our best friend couples, and we shared three appetizers, two entrees, two desserts, and a bottle of wine. It was an absolutely delicious, enjoyable experience. The food and service were impeccable!

Highlights: Quality of the ingredients used, flavor combinations, quality of the cooking and preparation, timing of dishes coming out of the kitchen, and great sense of humor that our waitress had were are truly wonderful. 

This is a fantastic restaurant for dates, double/triple dates, or family dinners. There is also a private room that looks really nice. The decor and ambiance is perfect. It's not too pretentious and is very relaxing. The lighting may be too dim for some, but I enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and beautiful wine displays. I just wish the prices were a bit lower, but the food and service makes everything totally worthwhile. ;)

Menu items we tried that I would recommend:  
* Crispy Roasted Chicken Breast 
* Mozzarella di Bufala 
* Roasted Wild Coho Salmon 
* Roasted Sweet Potatoes & Brussels Sprouts
* Warm Apple Crisp with Vanilla Ice Cream
author: Jamie O.

description: Great ambiance and overall feel, our group of four all agreed we would return. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful and the bill was very reasonable. The hummus plate was really good-- I saw that mentioned a few other places. We also really enjoyed the lamb, handmade noodles and beets. The only disappointing dish were the Brussels sprouts--we were expecting something crispy and delicious and they were steamed and not so impressive. Otherwise a really good meal!
author: Kelsey F.

description:
OMG....the food is so delicious.  I had a girls night out.  This place has great food and wine.  I had a great chocolate mint tea instead and it came with a personal teapot!

We got beets with sour cream and fresh dill, homemade pita bread that's chewy and soft with olive oil and hummus, crispy fried onions, truffle mushroom with polenta cake, calamari with pearl couscous, pork meatballs, and sunchoke soup.  That was just the appetizers and so-called small plates.  In truth, these small plates are pretty normal size!  So I was full just off the appetizers.

The other girls kept going with our shared two main entrees: porkloin and skirt steak.  All so flavorful and juicy.  Very filling.  

Then we had 2 desserts.  Haha...apple crisp with vanilla ice cream and 3 different flavored scooped ice cream (toasted almond, mocha chip, and mint confetti).  My fave was the mint confetti.  So minty!  

Must come back for their food and their 50% off special wine bottles.  =)  I believe the 50% is only from Sunday to Wednesday.
author: Linda C.

description:
This is a great spot in Cow Hollow, actually one of the best in the area. Ambiance is definitely cozy, and level of noise more than acceptable. They have several appetizers which are a perfect pick to share, and their hanger steak was just amazing. Wine selection is wide enough for most people.  
Recommended!
author: Steve E.

description:
Great food. Great service. Reasonable price.

The service from the host, the server, and the bussers was great. They are helpful, they aren't intrusive, they seem to anticipate what you need.

The food was equally great. My wife and I each picked two small plates. I think next time I'll go with one larger plate to try that side of the menu.  Portions aren't gluttonous but two small plates was plenty. 

And the prices are very reasonably. I would have expected to pay more. But since we didn't, we'll be back sooner.  So... if you're from Terzo reading this... don't raise your prices. Thx.

It's the kind of place you would bring a date if you really wanted to impress her/him.

And this doesn't impact the review, but the place is actually huge (well, "SF huge"). From the semi-secret front door, it looks tiny. But there's a whole other side to the place.
author: Nathan W.

description:
I loved this place!
We shared 4 tapas and 2 glasses of wine for about $90
Every dish was delicious, we expecially loved the grilled chicken skewered with bread, the sauce was amazing. 
All the wines were great, and reasonably priced. I've found many places are serving very poor quality wine for 12 or 14, whereas here they have decent wine for 8-10. Much appreciated.
Service was friendly.
Decor was current and well done, but not memorable. 
We'll definitely be back!
author: J B.

description:
I just visited Terzo for the first time Friday night.  It makes sense to me why this restaurant receives solid reviews.  We had a cozy table in the back (this restaurant is way bigger than it actually looks!).  We enjoyed two delicious bottles of red wine (for a reasonable price I might add), and amongst the four of us we shared a gang of delicious small plates, indeed *amn near everything on the small plates menu:  

Our favorites:
Fried Farm Egg Bruschetta - BY FAR THE STAR! (and totally unexpected)
Roasted Beets
Tomato Braised Pork Meatballs
Mozzarella di Bufala
Braised Niman Ranch Lamb Shoulder

For dessert:
Organic Gala Apple Crisp with Vanilla Ice Cream

I would highly recommend this restaurant, and was so excited to find a new spot in my neighborhood.  Go forth and enjoy :)
author: Ashley C.

description: Woah this place is super good, if i could eat here every night i totally would.
author: Graham H.

description:
Well - I'm quite torn on Terzo. 

Their food is EXCELLENT. Truly fantastic -- probably some of the best you can get in the Marina area.   I particularly recommend the gnocchi, grilled calamari, beets and mushrooms with polenta. All are delicious.  

Unfortunately however, this is not a service oriented place.   I came with a party of 10 people and we were sitting waiting to order for almost 15 minutes. Then, once our server arrived, she was a bit rude to us.  To almost every question she answered "well it really just depends on what you want" - and then she got visibly annoyed with us for switching around our seats. 

To boot - they charged us a $40 surcharge for bringing our own cake!  Seriously?! This was a festive birthday celebration - was that really necessary? Talk about putting a negative spin on a fun event -- we left feeling a little bit annoyed.
author: Michelle T.

description:
A really nice modern, spacious restaurant in the Marina.

Try the Hummus, Pork Loin, Vanilla & Mint Confetti, and Malbec Recuerdo.

Tasty food, good service, and affordable prices.
author: Francis M.

description: Delish! I sat at the bar and ordered the gnocchi, mushroom & polenta and Chicken Skewers.  All were very tasty. Nice dark ambiance.
author: K B.

description:
Heaven in your mouth!

Hands down one of my new favorite restaurants. Came here with a group of friends and tried several things on the menu. Everything was delicious! My favorites were the skirt steak (which was really tender for skirt steak) and the meatballs. Would give this place 5 stars if the service had been a bit faster. Overall, highly recommend.
author: Alicia B.

description: This restaurant is a must do experience. You will definitely go back again and again if you can. Fabulous wine list and experienced waiters that have mouth watering recommendations. I had the lamb for the main entrée and my spouse had the salmon. Spouses favorite plates were the meatballs and apple crisp. My personal favorites were the beets and the mint chip ice cream.
author: Barb P.

description: First thing is first. Ron is the waiter you need to ask for here; knowledgeable, interesting, has great taste and will not disappoint or annoy. Secondly, the food and wine was incredible and I highly recommend everything we tried: hummus plate starter, homemade pastas, pork dish, calamari, meatballs, and halloumi platter. The wine - wow! A Barbera, Beaujolais, and a Chateau Musar that were all paired incredibly (thank you, Alex!). Ambiance was simple and the restaurant was clean and well lit. In the end 5 stars for the whole experience, with only the annoyance of the bus-boy asking to clear our plates too often. Will gladly go back and see Ron very soon!
author: Ani N.

description:
Came here on a whim with the roommate last night.

Cool decor inside with wine bottles lined up against the wall in these cubbie shelf looking things.

Service was great and on top of it. Background music was enjoyable. Upbeat tunes.

We had a bottle of wine (50% off on Wednesdays) and 4 small plates.
Pita & Hummus - delicious
Broccoli - very tasty with great flavor and not too dry
Meatballs w/ Polenta - moist and delicious
Zeccherle Pasta 1/2 order - wasn't my favorite, too citrusy tasting
Chocolate Mousse - yummy

It was just A-OK. Tab was about $75.00 plus tip
author: DayDay D.

description:
Terzo is one of my top 5 fave restaurants in SF. Sadly, I've only been 4 times in the past 4 years..there are so many amazing restaurants in SF and I'm not fond of going to the Marina but I always enjoy myself when I go to Terzo.

Terzo's menu is unassuming but although the food and preparations are simple, the food is really flavorful. Small plates with a few large plate offerings and a rotating menu. The rotating menu is a double edged sword. New dishes to try but sometimes your faves aren't available that night.

Case in point, my all time favorite is their tomato and egg bruschetta. It's only been on the menu one out of the four times that I've been to Terzo but it's one of the main reasons that I keep returning.

Other faves:  Meatballs with polenta, chicken speidini. But really everything is good. Be careful with the speidini. It is very spicy.

Really good wines (especially the Syrah) and the flourless cake - yum.

Oh yeah, 30% off on Blackboard Eats!!!
author: Kiristen R.

description: We had a lovely experience at Terzo; the ambiance, service and food were all superb. The interior is cozy, warm & welcoming with low lighting (but not too low!). Our server was very sweet, patient and knowledgeable about the menu. She didn't hesitate to provide recommendations for one dish vs. the other. We ended up sharing a selection of small plates (which were paced perfectly): gnocchi with pest, meatballs with polenta, lamb, and the brussel sprouts. The most outstanding dish being the meatballs - very flavorful with the sauce and bed of polenta. Terzo's meatballs have now trumped Verbena to be our favorite in the city :-) We will be back again soon to introduce friends to Terzo - it's a hidden gem that is definitely worth visiting!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
It's always a pleasure finding new place so close to you.

Came here as part of my "Yelp a place I don't know and don't ask questions" once a week policy and Yelp did it again...

Great food, great ambiance, great service and all ingredients are healthy and animal friendly (as much as you can be when you eat one).

Recommend going in a group and share everything, you won't regret it.
author: Assaf B.

description: Five stars for the wilted chicory salad, marshalling a narrow space in such a savvy way, and the extra darling waitstaff.
author: Dana B.

description:
I went to Terzo for the first time on my birthday recently.  It had been on our list to try out for a while and I'm glad we checked it out as we had a really good experience.  They had their 1/2 bottle wine sale so we had a good bottle of wine with dinner.

The atmosphere was very cool and our waiter was great although he was a little too touchy.  The entire meal was good so I would recommend anything on the menu as we and everyone around us seemed to enjoy everything and they had different things than we did.
author: Blake B.

description:
This is a nice place for a date.  The atmosphere is nice and conducive to conversing with your dinner guest(s).

The decor is nice, the food is tasty, the service is friendly and they are on opentable.  All wins in my book.
author: Sofia H.

description:
Great food and nice ambiance.  Terzo has a good selection of small plates, entrees, wine, and beer.  I shared the bruschetta, asparagus, meatball, beet salad, and hummus with two other people.   Everything we ordered was delicious and it was just the right amount of food.  I liked how the items were brought out one or two at a time so that we didn't have to deal with passing around 5 or six plates at once.  

The service kinda ruined it for me.  When we walked in the door, we were immediately asked "Do you have a reservation?"  This honestly seemed like a joke, since the place was literally empty.  But no - apparently it was completely booked except for a few tables by the window.  This information was given with an attitude.  Excuse us for not making a reservation, and as a matter of fact the window tables seemed just fine.

The waiter (who was the bartender, too) took his time coming over to us even though he clearly wasn't at all busy.  There were big gaps between ordering our drinks, receiving them, and finally getting the opportunity to order food.  When we gave our order, he didn't write anything down, and sure enough he had to come back and ask us again about what we'd ordered.  We got our food alright but he never came back to check on us or refill our water glasses.  

Fast forward to the end of the meal, when we were done eating and had somewhere else to be.  The waiter/bartender was standing behind the bar talking and laughing with two female servers, having a great time.  We tried to signal to him that we needed our check, but no dice.  He was completely engrossed in flirting with these waitresses.  We finally managed to flag down another server, and then the bartender/waiter came rushing over and mock-scolding the helpful one for trying to 'steal' his table.  Apparently he would've made his way over eventually and didn't appreciate anyone trying to speed the process along.  

Morals of the story: if you don't want to sit by the window, make a reservation.  If you don't like bad service, skip Terzo altogether.
author: Stephanie S.

description: It's a pretty restaurant in the Marina. It's romantic and just a great place to catch up with friends. The food is middle of the road quality. It wasn't bad for the price and I guess for the neighborhood the food was a better choice. I remember having the steak and it was tender...but I would be shocked if restaurants are still serving overcooked meat. The meal played second fiddle to the company I was with. The service was really attentive but not so much that it was overbearing.
author: Eve C.

description:
Dear Terzo, Will you marry me?  Love, Lesley C.

Chanterelles with Polenta.  Crispy triangles of smooth polenta and savory, creme fraiche mushrooms all over the top!  

Roasted Autumn Vegetables- Onions, butternut squash, pecorino cheese.  Perfectly roasted, everything. 

Pork Meatballs braised in Tomato Sauce with Polenta:  Pork meatballs were fall apart tender but I'm not sure about the tomato sauce.  Very acidic and tart and almost...canned tasting...eek.

Pork Tenderloin with Apple Compote and Cabbage.  I don't usually rave about pork chops but this was perfectly marinated, super juicy and extremely flavorful.  Paired with its good friends apple and cabbage for the sweetness...happy happy happy. 

The restaurant comped us with a chocolate pot de creme topped with whipped cream.  Rich and smooth, great way to end the meal.
author: Les L.

description:
Overall great dining experience.

I came here on a Tues night with a girlfriend and the restaurant was packed! Great ambiance and the service was excellent.

My friend and I had never tried French wine before, and told the waitress we wanted to try a bottle of some good French wine. She suggested one of her favorites and it was indeed perfect. The red wine she suggested was really light and not too filling so it went perfectly with our meal. Here's the scoop on the food:

1) Roasted Eggplant with Tomato, Roasted Peppers & Fresh Mozzarella = mediocre
2) Free Range Chicken Spiedini with Bread, Cilantro, Chiles & Onion = good flavor
3) Summer Melon with Serrano Ham, White Balsamic & Mint = the white summer mellon they served was very sweet and refreshing
4) Arugula & Radicchio Salad with Peaches, Fennel & Honey Vinaigrette = a nice flavor, normally I have a lemony type of dressing with Arugula, the peach and honey was different and nice!
5) Mountain Gorgonzola with Kadota Figs, Saba & Grilled Focaccia= I'm not a huge fan of gorganzola cheese in general, but with the cheese spread on the toasted bread with some figs it was nice. 
6) Dessert: Chocolate Pot de Crème with Almond Cookie = delicious! creamy chocolate with whip cream. went really well with out red wine actually. Also, it was light, so a perfect end to our meal.

Food = 3 stars
Ambiance & Service = 4 stars

I would give this place 3.5 stars
author: Shivani S.
