description: I have been twice now and I am definitely a fan! I wish I could remember our servers name from Saturday night because she was awesome. We had some GFers in our crew and she sat down at our booth with us and went over the entire menu for them as far as what we could order. We only got a few light apps and a bottle of wine (they have some of the best selection). The butternut squash melts in your mouth, the mussels and calamari were both tasty and fresh and the arugula salad was crisp. Love the vibe of the place and the communal table is also fun to sit at! Our first plate came out within minutes and they spaced everything out to ensure we weren't rushed.
author: Michelle R.

description:
This place would have rivaled 5 stars but I had such a terrible start to the experience that I can't justify the 5th star.  To be fair, the food is a solid 4.5.

We got to the restaurant a few minutes late, and checked in. Apologized for being late and the hostess seemed to be cool with it. Our table wasn't ready yet anyway.

Once they were ready to seat us, the hostess told us that they were going to need our table and so she'll give us a heads up when it's time to "wrap it up" UM WHAT?? we ended up having a little exchange with the hostess who was super rude about the timing.  I understand needing the table for another group but I think there were about 5 other ways she could have stated the issue without being a B about it.

Anyway regardless, on to the food and our fabulous server.

We got seated and our server was awesome.  Really knowledgeable and his voice sounded a little bit like Stanley Tucci.

We pretty much ordered one of every small plate.  The highlights were the grilled cheese (not sandwich but a piece of cheese grilled ), the meatballs, and the calamari.  all really tasty.  We also ordered the pasta which was cooked well also.

For dessert we had the pumpkin cheesecake, the chocolate cake and the apple crisp.  By far, my favorite was the apple crisp.  All three were good, but the apple crisp was great.

Thankfully our server and food made up for what started off as a terrible experience. I will be back, but hope that hostess isn't working.
author: Lu E.

description: One of my all time favorite restaurants in SF. Upscale but never pretentious, well-balanced menu with great wine selection. Fresh, delicious and somewhat unique. The best MEATBALL i have had since i moved to SF last year. Beets salad is super fresh too. Loved everything and we are going there again tonight.
author: Sherry W.

description:
Feeling conflicted about this place - I think the problem is that I don't really want to like it , but the food was pretty good. I probably wouldn't go back. I think in any smaller, less food-obsessed city this one could probably stand a chance at standing out a little more. There just wasn't anything that special about this place. The hummus was a less lame choice than it sounds (thanks to the waitress for suggesting it) and the chicken spiedini was just fine. Went there with a large group of girls and sharing lots of the smaller plates worked really well. 

I think the Marina might have gotten the best of Terzo - still likely one of the best restaurants in the area but just nothing to write home about.
author: Joanne S.

description:
Do your self a favor, and get the haloumi cheese with artichoke, it was to die for!

Overall, Terzo was delicious. Go with a group so you can try a bunch of the small plates.  I kept it at 4 stars because while all the plates were good, the only one that really blew me away was the cheese and artichoke dish.  My second favorite dish was the chicken skewers- well seasoned and juicy.  The pork tenderloin was also very well cooked. I was not impressed with the homemade hummus- kind of bland for my tastes.
author: Sasha B.

description: Upbeat romantic spot, perfect for couples and groups. Good music, tasty food, and fantastic service. Small plates and large plates are best shared.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Two years later, still one of my favorites. For some unknown reason, you can almost always get a table for dinner.  The service is consistently great, and one of my favorite waitresses in the city still works here.

We also had my husband's 30th birthday in the private room in the back. They were extremely gracious and accommodating, letting us bring our own decor and storing our ice cream cake in the fridge for us. I  highly recommend that room for private events, and it is not that expensive compared to other options.
author: Rose S.

description:
Visited Terzo a couple of weeks ago with a few friends.  Terzo mostly serves small plates designed for sharing and trying a variety of things. The food is excellent - my favorite dishes (amongst the several that we ordered) were the hummus (fresh and delicious, served with pita), the ricotta stuffed squash blossoms, and the asparagus (I don't eat meat, but everyone seemed to enjoy the meat dishes that we ordered as well).  Terzo has a great selection of wines to accompany your meal (our waitress was helpful in selecting two wines that we enjoyed).

This is a great, classy place for a date or dinner with friends - in other words, it has that "nice restaurant feel" without the accompanying stuffiness that would preclude someone from coming here for after work drinks with friends.  Terzo's staff was friendly, attentive, and helpful.  I'll definitely be visiting Terzo again soon.
author: Rishi N.

description:
Ambiance is excellent--lovely space--lots of clean lines, while remaining warm--unfortunately, it didn't really come through.  We has a reservation for 6:15 on a Saturday night, and needless the say, the place was not slammed...but it still took our waiter 7 minutes to come great us...and we had to ask for him.  

I was with a friend and her mother--and how to put this tactfully....we didn't exactly look homeless.  Nevertheless, it was a challenge to get him to pay any attention to us.  There was none of the seduction that comes w/ eating out, rather, he just seemed to want to rush us through.

On to the edibles--we did a bunch of small plates--started w/ the hummus, which in itself was fine, but the housemade pita w/ za'atar was super delicious.  Less delicious was when the waiter asked it we wanted more (of course), w/o telling us that it was an extra fee for 5 more quarters.  But still--skip the hummy, just get the bread--but worth ordering.  We then did the heirloom salad w/ olives and basil pesto--sounds flavorful, right?  False.  The tomatoes looked lovely but lacked flavor, as did the olives and pesto, which is a challenge.  

The stars of our meal were the roasted beets (pink, on a bed of labneh (okay) and sprinkled w/ fresh dill (yum) as well as the arugula salad w/ ricotta salata and figs.

For dessert we did the flourless chocolate cake, which was surprisingly light and wonderful.

For the 3 of us it was $93, w/o tip, including 1 glass of wine and 2 $4.50 hot teas.  I think I wouldn't have been so critical of the food had the waiter tried to make it somewhat of a pleasant experience, but alas, perhaps I'm expecting too much...like courtesy.
author: Rachel N.

description: Amazing food. Intimate atmosphere. Stellar wine list. Rolled my eyes when my husband ordered the meatballs because I thought they'd be boring...I come back here solely for the meatballs, and everything else on the menu is delicious. It's crazy that I'd write a review focused on this one dish, but here I am. They're that good.
author: Rebecca g.

description: Went here for my wife's b-day and really enjoyed dinner. We order to beets, chicken skewers, hummus (home-made and delish), meatballs, peach bruschetta (also highly recommended), and gnocchi. Service was great and we really enjoyed our time here!
author: Ryan K.

description:
Quite possibly the most perfect meal I've had in San Francisco for the last 10 years!   The food is higher-end californian-mediterranean but don't let that put you off.  It's good honest food that is not pretentious and cooked to absolute perfection.   We had the calamari (perfectly tender), the meatballs and polenta (tender and flavorful and the polenta was nice and creamy), the pita and hummus (fresh breads and some of the best hummus I've had since I visited the middle-east).    For entrees we had the chicken and the pork loin.   The pork-loin was cooked to perfection with just the right amount of fat to give it flavor.

Overall, great service and a nice smart-casual atmosphere.   Although this isn't strictly a kids restaurant my 9 y/o daughter loved the food too!   I highly recommend this restaurant to anybody in need of great food!
author: Mike H.

description:
We came here last weekend for my wife's company Xmas dinner. I made reservations on OpenTable for 6 people. There was no problem with that process.

1. Ambience: Open kitchen, modern look, communal table in the middle. I love the wine displays on the wall. I have noticed this on other restaurants. 

It is a great look.

There is a bar in the front. the tables and chairs were nicely spaced and comfortable. we were greeted by the receptionist and seated immediately at our table.

2. Service: our waiter was very good. I asked him about the wine, particularly whites and he ran off the top of his head 6 or 7 whites and described them in good detail. He knew his stuff. He was funny and engaging but wasn't overbearing with too many is "everything okay?", which I liked. 

3. Parking: only bad thing. it is in the Marina area which is residential. very hard to find in a weekend during dinner time. We did valet($10). The area is very nice with small boutiques.One can get there early and do a little shopping.

4. Food/drinks: We ordered several appetizers or "small plates" as they call it. each one is good for about 2-3 people. 

A. roasted beets: great flavor. would never think about eating beets, but this was good! 

B. chicken spiedini, very tender. roasted chicken with great herb flavor on skewers. each order came with 2 skewers so we made 2 orders which were combined into one plate. The skewers were large portions. People who don't have large stomachs can probably share one.

C. grilled monterey calamari: not the fried type. was okay. it sat on a bed of beans and greens which were flavored nicely. I wish there was more squid.

D. last appetizer was the pork meatballs and creamy polenta: I loved this appetizer the most. So tender! A bit heavy, so don't eat too much or else you won't have enough room for your entrees.

for the Entrees: 

A. I had the grilled Mahi Mahi freshly caught from Costa Rica. Outstanding freshness, grilled perfectly. it was lightly dressed in a lemon butter sauce which gives the food a sour and salty flavor. It sat on a bed of napa cabbage. I would eat a portion of the cabbage and some of the fish together rather than seprately. wash it down with a good white wine. All of the flavors balance each other out. Delish!!

B. My wife had the skirt steak, med rare. Awesome! can't go wrong with steak as long as it is cooked to your liking. Very tender and generous portion!

C My other table mates had Braised Mary's chicken and the Niman Ranch Braised Pork Shoulder: I didn't taste these but they mentioned all were good. the chicken was a HUGE portion.

D. beverages: good selection of beer and wines. I loved my white wine, it was light and had stone fruit accents. a bit on the sweet side almost like a desert wine. it blended with my entree very well. 

Dessert: I had the flourless choc cake and espresso cream: was okay. was a bit too heavy for me. I loved my wife's ice cream medley. it had espresso, mint chocolate and  walnut. 

Price: not too bad, spent a bit over $400 for 6 of us, including gratuity.

I wanted to note that all the food is organic and mostly from local farms.

for a special dinner or a get together with friends/family of business, this place is great. will go back again!!
author: Milton C.

description:
Terzo deserves way more than terzo stars! Yes, it's that good. All the tapas we ordered were tasty. I highly recommend the hummus. It's made from scratch and served with delicious warm pita bread. My other favorites are the grilled halibut with pesto sauce over garbanzo bean and the pancetta wrapped figs. 

The home made noodles with truffles was also good but best ordered with other dishes since it might be too light in flavor otherwise.  

We ended our evening with two, yes two, desserts: the warm crumble with strawberries and vanilla ice cream and another one with strawberries (i can't remember the name but one of the waiter's insisted that it was "so good" and most of the other tables ordered it too). I still preferred the crumble.

Oh and I dined with fellow yelpers Connie C and Yan M so that always makes a meal more pleasant :)
author: Helen Y.

description:
Overall, I enjoyed the food at Terzo. While not particularly inventive, the selections were well-executed and for the most part quite tasty. I was, however, put off by the cool temperature of the Niman Ranch beef. It was served on top of piping hot potatoes and grilled green onions but the meat itself was not hot, let alone room temperature (which is what they claimed the intended preparation was when I asked.) If you want more than a solitary bite of the Serrano ham, better order two plates --- the portion is quite insignificant. 

Ever felt like the whole "small plates" idea is just a way to con you into parting with yet more of your hard-earned cash? Terzo might just corroborate that feeling.

True stand-outs were the hummus and the chicken spiedini. If they are on the menu when you dine at Terzo, do not miss these selections.

Though we were both looking forward to dessert, we didn't order any because none of the selections were tempting. 

Because the menu at Terzo changes so frequently, I think enjoyment is a lot about chance. If you arrive on a night when they've got a lot of things on offer that you like, you'll enjoy it. Conversely. . .

SUMMARY:
Hummus with House Made Pita & Za'atar- Four and a half stars
Free Range Chicken Spiedini with Bread, Chile & Onions- Five stars
Roasted Niman Ranch Beef with Potatoes- Two and a half stars
Serrano Ham with Melon- Three stars

Service --- Three and a half stars
Atmosphere --- Three and a half stars

Final calculation: Nearly four stars, and had it not been for the cold beef, I think I'd have rounded up.
author: Miriam W.

description: We celebrated a friend's birthday here on a busy Friday night.  I was an hour late (!) and the server was perfectly lovely about the other two in our party camping out, having some wine and a little nosh.  How refreshing to not feel pressured to keep the table turning in a packed restaurant.  Food was nice, wine was great, and service was even better!  We will be back! Yay!
author: amy b.

description:
***SF Health Tax Alert!!***

Yes, as I scrolled down my bill I saw the dreadful, SF HEALTH TAX charge. Totally fine, I'm all for health care for employees but didn't think my first time being hit with it would be at this fine restaurant. Made my night end in a flurry of emotions. 

The tapas here are very good. The watermelon salad is a MUST. It could have been very bad, but it was definately a hit! The watermelon was so flavorful. The fact that there was no leafie greens made it all the better. The linguinie was amazing, and with the truffle was probably just as good without it (Truffles are supposed to be an aphrodisiac. I so did not get laid after paying the bill). The king salmon was so-so. The skin on the bottom was burnt leaving an odd taste in my mouth. 

The midnight cake and coconut ice cream should have been the peak  of the night. The champagne was probably the best thing I had that night. 

4 dishes, 1 dessert, 2 glasses of wine, and a glass of champagne, SF health tax charge= $150. Not bad, and not perfect either.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Terzo is solid!.  The service and food were/are fantastic.  The wine list has very good selections and too pricey. The small plates are small and meant to be shared.  Yes the hummus is good (very smooth and creamy) and the chicken spiedini (flavorful chicken on a stick).  I love the onion rings - they are so bad yet soo good.
author: Mr. C.

description: Wonderful atmosphere, amazing food. Great for groups! I really loved the experience, and the service.
author: Jenna W.

description:
Wow. This place was amazing! I went to dinner with my roommate last night and the first thing she said when we walked in was "It looks so chic. Even the music is chic, it sounds like what you hear when the Sex and the City girls walk into a uber chic place in NYC." Not going to lie, that was such a turn off for me. I usually believe the chic places have some of the worst food. I couldn't have been more wrong. In fact, I want to go through my whole meal just to tell you how delicious it was:

First course: Smoked trout and watermelon radishes - I had never heard of watermelon radishes, let alone tried a regular radish, but I saw it at the next table over and it looked delicious. I am so glad we ordered this. I LOVED all of it, especially the radishes. I'm not sure what the sauce on it was, some vinaigrette or something, but it was just perfect. A nice, light salad that's not really a salad. 

Second course: Braised lamb shoulder with mashed potatoes - This was the BEST part of the meal. I love lamb and have eaten a fair share of it, but this far surpassed every lamb dish I have ever tasted. Thinking about it makes my mouth water. This is a must try.

Third course: Skirt steak - After the lamb this didn't do it for me. It's not that it was bad, on the contrary it was great, it just couldn't compare. On the other hand, I found out that I do like brussel sprouts. I have never tried them because my mom hates them, but they were so well cooked. Additionally, the steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare. Probably a little more on the rare side, but exactly how I want my medium rare to look.

Final course: Apple Crisp with Vanilla Ice Cream and Chocolate Pot du'creme. The apple crisp was delicious and had huge chunks of apple. It was perfectly sweet/cinnamony. I would order that again in a second. I had never had a pot de creme and I don't think I would again, its not for me.

Additionally, we both had two glasses of wine each. The waitress knew everything about the wines, and perfectly described them. 

With the quality of the food, environment, and service, I will be coming back! Especially with the current deal Sunday-Wednesday of half priced wines...
author: Emily K.

description: Terrific food and I would agree with others that it's on par with Kokkari but at a lower price point.  I grew up eating Mediterranean food prepared by family members that lived in Lebanon so I can be very picky when it comes to Mediterranean fare.  My husband and I just moved back to SF from LA and have been looking for our go-to restaurant and believe we have found it.  We decided to try as many small plates as possible so went for the Calamari, Salad, meatballs, Brussel sprouts, beet salad, mozzarella di bufala, hummus, Chicken Spiedini & fried onions, wow didn't realize how much we ate until just now, but anyway... Each dish was as good as the one before.  I especially loved the fried onions which came out last and we were pretty much full but one bite and I was hooked. I was surprised by the consistency of the flavor profile.  Everything had it's own distinct clean taste.  All the dishes worked together.  They have a nice wine list (Chateau Masur a Lebanese wine, not easy to find and a reasonable price) and the atmosphere feels very neighborhoodie which I prefer.  I found the prices to be reasonable, especially for what we would consider an excellent meal.  Great experience, we plan on being back soon.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Great food made even better with companionship of fellow yelper Connie C. and Helen Y. Superb food, everything ordered was full of flavor and tasty. My favorites are the hummus and pita bread, pancetta wrapped figs (sooo good!), halibut with garbanzo beans, sausage, ok everything was super dee-lish!

Thanks Connie for the suggestion and mucho gracias to Helen for dinner! 
Where to next? We'll let "Sparrow" nest for awhile in the mean time. :)
author: Yan M.

description:
When I first was invited to this place, i thought to myself.... union street:( i live in marina but not fan of union commotion. Too many drank people yelling and looking for the guy or girl of the night. Pretty soon they start screaming at each other, "your face is uglier than my as*"

This restaurant is far away from all the cow hallow noise with great atmosphere  and unpretentiousness. 

Very nice dinner. 
I had moroccan chicken, pork meat balls, and few other dishes. 
All food was very good and the best part was the music. I loved their music! Never in a restaurant did I say this before.
author: Mika G.

description: Our 4 person group had a great dinner. I wasn't sure what to expect, but the ambiance was warming, good acoustics, there were quite a few people and I didn't have to yell telling a story. The food was great, we shared like a tapa style. The hummus was creamy, the pork meatballs were delicious, the celery/cauliflower soup was subtle yet filling and the fusilli pasta was a great appetizer in a small plate size. We basically tried every small plate and dessert on the menu, so yummy and every plate ranged $6-$12. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Alejandra O.

description: Delicious food and lovely atmosphere! I would have given it five stars but then went to Kokarri the next day which is really phenomenal. But this place is great!
author: Susan V.

description: We went to Terzo for dinner on a Sunday, it was early, so we got a very good table next to the fireplace. The server had a very pleasant attitude, and we got Grilled Monterey Bay Calamari, and Potato Gnocchi for appetizers, and the calamari was very tender. We asked for some breads, they were just plain French bread, but fresh. For dinner, my son and I both ordered the Roasted Mahi Mahi with Basmati Rice and my husband ordered Grilled Roasted Pork Loin with Brussels Sprouts, butter squash puree. All were delicious. We also went for some dessert, a hot chocolate written in French on the menu, and 3 scoops of organic ice cream. The interior of the restaurant was very nice and had a well stocked bar. Overall, a very good experience and I would take my family and friends there again.
author: Portia s.

description: Really enjoyed my experience here! I went to Terzo after hearing about it from friends in the Marina for a girls night out. They have a great modern twist on traditional tapas. Everything we tried was flavorful and the service was great as well. The only downside is if you are planning on sharing the small plates, order more than you think. The servings are quite small though totally worth it.
author: Kat J.

description: Perfect meal. The chicken is lights out. Mark was welcoming and more than willing to discuss his creations. The chicken though, seriously.
author: Lane B.

description: Love Terzo.  It may be one of the only restaurants on this planet where I can take my visiting mother and we both are happy. I love the hummus and pita--warm pita bread with za'atar and olive oil, and she loves the pork loin.  Quality of food is consistent.  And a great wine list to round it out.
author: Nancy P.

description: The food was OK at best. Pork was overdone to a point that I would have been able to make it myself. The squash that it came with was bland and an awkward accompaniment to the dish. Was expecting much more from the restaurant
author: Thomas M.

description:
Terzo is a neighborhood gem.  Tucked away on Steiner Street it offers delicious food in an elegant, but not pretentious, setting.

The two best things about Terzo...

1) Half priced bottles of wine (I believe it's only Sunday - Thursdays.)  They have plenty of reasonably priced wines and the extra 50% off is icing on the cake.  
2) Meatballs.  Tender and bursting with flavor, the meatballs are served with polenta which is a perfect complement
author: Betty Y.

description: This was one of the worst meals I have had in years.  The hummus tasted store bought and it was served with soggy, oily pita bread.  But the worst course was the chicken caccitori.  Two of us ordered it and it was inedible.  It tasted like the chef emptied an entire salt shaker on each portion.  I told the waitress about our concerns and she told us she would tell the chef.  No other accommodation was made by the waitress.  We will never return.
author: Joe K.

description: Unreal. So good. Service was impeccable offering us suggestions around portions as well as what was new/freshest. The food was amazingly good. All around a pretty perfect experience!
author: Michael M.

description:
We went to Terzo for Christmas Eve dinner tonight. In my family we like Trezo and lot and have been there a number of times over the last few years. We used to live in the neighborhood and have a real fondness for the place.

The reasons we like it is for the ambiance, food and of course wine. However my pet peeve is that the last couple times we have been there for Christmas Eve they keep putting us in the back room. As I mentioned one of the reasons to go there for us, is the ambiance and the back room is secluded and does not have much of that.

This time I mentioned in the reservation that we did not want to be seated there. I mentioned again when I walked into the restaurant but the hostess seemed to completely disregard my request. I guess next time I will be finding another place that is willing to understand my request as a customer.
author: Sumati S.

description:
I was going to give this a four star, but when I saw their excellent integration of Yelp, I had to upgrade to a five.  These people definitely know what they're doing when it comes to running a business and they also definitely know what they're doing in the kitchen. 

We had the patatas, the yellowfin, the arugula salad and some grilled cheese plate.  Our server was awesome, explained very well how everything worked, and he delivered everything with good timing and in good order.  I would come back in heart beat to experience some of the other items.  

The only reason originally I was only going to give four stars is that they don't have a full bar and I think a nice classy martini would go well with some of their food.  I am a martini-whore though, so please don't let that dissuade you from trying this very unassuming, brilliant find.
author: Lacie T.

description: Amazing dinner! Definitely a gem since it doesn't have more than 1000 reviews but still, in my opinion, ranks in the top with other sf restaurants.  The service, food and ambiance were all amazing.  Our server was very helpful in picking out wine and great appetizers. Usually at a restaurant, if I order a bunch of appetizers, there will be some hit or misses.  ALL the dishes were a hit! The steak was cooked just right, and juicy, the chicken fell right off the bone, and all the appetizers were just the perfect amount.  The waiter was even awesome enough to course out the appetizers so we didn't just get them all at once.  All in all, a great experience and a must try!
author: Derrick W.

description: Great service and food. The variety of vegetable small plates were tasty. Beets and Calamari were my favorite.
author: Sandra S.

description:
When my friend Matt T. told me we'd be dining at Terzo, I catapulted myself out of bed, waited impatiently for Winblows to start up, and feverishly perused the Yelp reviews - I was determined to get the skinny before doing the dining.

This wise decision made it possible for me to declaim with nary a hint of superiority - "...see? we should have made reservations", when we showed up and were told the wait was an hour.

The bar was well-appointed, with a friendly staff who kept handing us the wine list. In the interim, I took in the decor (quite nice, muted and ... solid tones) and participated in the shall-we-stay-or-shall-we-go session that had broken out between the crew. Eventually the couple that was hogging seats and keeping a couple of us standing got a table, and we realized that we had pretty much conquered the bar area. So we decided to stay.

Most of you mere mortals place your order by saying something along the lines of "and I'll have the xyz, and she'll have the abc..." - well, not us. We took it to the limit when I said "Yeah, we're going to tell you what we *don't* want - bring us everything else on the menu!"

I was serious - so we had everything on the Tapas menu with the exception of the Sea Bass (bad reviews on Yelp), the apple/peach Remoulade (sounded like a product of the Gerber company), the Salad (greens. Nuff said) and the Soup (how were we going to split it?)
Of the Tapas that was memorable, the sausage comes to mind - as do the mussels, the chicken and the beets. The portions were *exceedingly small* - one of the reasons for the three star review - but definitely tasty.
On an auxiliary note, we also enjoyed the juvenile humor endemic to consuming the "spicy salted nuts", the "sausage" and "the cockburn tawny port".

The price for this repast, you ask? About $50 per person - including a bottle and a few glasses of vino. Our bartender was a nice guy, who entertained us with conversation and added to the (considerable) ambiance. Definitely a reasonably priced meal, all things considered.

Parking really isn't a problem - they have valet - we easily found spots for two cars on the same block. The pipes being torn up on the street outside definitely detracts from the place.
author: Maxx L.

description: I had dinner here last night.   The Heirloom tomato and mozzarella di buffala was good but only two thin slices of tomato.  The main dish was the pork chop with polenta, peach and broccoli rabe.  It was very good!  The restaurant is very nice with the wine cellar selections on display over head (they needed dusting).
author: John V.

description: This place is a MUST! I took my husband here for his birthday and we had a great time. The food was outstanding! The Heirloom Tomato dish and the chicken skewers were the best! The pita bread and hummus were great too! The service was awesome too. We had a great table next to the fire place. The tables are very close together and it is a small place so you end up listening to others conversations. But it is a very cute and inviting place.  I highly recommend this place!
author: Debbi C.

description:
Found this place while on vacation in SF and staying in Cow Hollow for the weekend.

Not only was the food on point, but the service was perfect. Our server (forgive me for not remembering his name, Ron maybe?) made us feel very comfortable. He was confident about his wine and menu items. This was our first time here and he immediately took away any apprehension we may have had by telling us a bit about the chef and they way he selects his ingredients and how he cooks. The dishes are small so you can share a bunch of them and relax. 

The Chef changes the menu often which is of great appeal if you can trust him. After sharing truffle gnocchi, brussel sprouts hummus, a mushroom soup, a great dessert and a terrific bottle of Blackbird Vineyard "Maisonry" Cabernet - I trust everyone here.

Terzo will definitely be on the must goto place whenever we are in SF!
author: Matt E.

description:
We went here on a week night with another couple and their 6 month-old to celebrate my birthday after Nick's cove robbed my of the celebratory experience one hope's for on such an occasion.

We were seated immediately in a smaller back room where another couple with their child were well into their meal.  Our drink order was taken right away and the drinks soon followed.  We prompted our waitress for her favorite items on the menu and she named 4 small plates and 2 entrees, and that's precisely what we ordered.

The small plates came in twos with the roasted beets and the buffala came first and they were awesome.  Next was the meatballs and the chanterelle mushrooms over crispy polenta.  As soon as the mushroom dish hit the table we ordered another one on sight!  Our table service was awesome and consistent. Water glasses filled and clean plates provided every couple of minutes it seemed.

The big plates were as good as the openers.  We shared the skirt steak and pork shoulder and both were unbelievable.

For dessert we split the flourless chocalate cake and the lemon pot de creme.  Just as with the dinner these were extremely tasty!  The staff also brought a little trio of ice cream with candles to celebrate my birthday.  I had related how poor the service had been at Nick's Cove on my actual birthday and offered my compliments on both the service and the food at Terzo.  

I wholeheartedly recommend Terzo!!!
author: Joe M.

description:
They have a great deal currently offered Sunday-Thursdays. If you order 2 small plates or 1 large plate (per person) you can get 50% off bottles of wine under $40. I went with 5 friends and we each got two small plates, shared it all, and had two bottles of wine. 

The food is amazing! I would recommend the chicken spiedini which they are well known for. Also the bruschetta was amazing. Apparently their hummus is really tasty too but we didn't try it. For greens/veggies, try the aspargus and also the arugula salad. The meatballs come with a delicious polenta. Basically, you can't go wrong with any of the small plates.

Our waiter was very friendly and helpful in selecting a wine that we all loved. The music was nice, not too loud and nothing boring. The ambiance is also great - you feel like you are at a very nice restaurant but you can just hang out, enjoy a comfy meal, chat quietly with a friend or laugh with a whole table. I would highly recommend this place and can't wait to go back!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Really high quality food, their chicken dish is just amazing the meat falls right off the bone.
Their small plates of hummus and meatballs w/ polentas are equally delicious.

Just outstanding across the board.
author: Jordan G.

description:
Incredible hummus beginnings. Epic strawberry finales.

Everything else was so so.

Perhaps you should just stick with these two. The hummus comes with a house pita topped with a delectable Middle Eastern spice blend called za'atar. The strawberries come both as a sorbet and as a shortcake with
strawberry sauce. We couldn't decide so we got both. No regrets. Just delicious memories.

Can't speak as highly of the cauliflower (too buttery), the calamari (too oily) or the salmon (too much of both).

Space and service were warm and friendly. We ate earlier in relative peace and by the time we left it was packed.

No doubt having come for the strawberries.
author: Jason B.

description: It's my favorite restaurant in the Marina so 5 stars is appropriate. Their food rocks - well, I can speak for the seafood and veggie dishes. The place also has some decent vino.
author: Phil L.

description:
I think I would come here everyday if I could! I love the ambience-it's the kind of place where it's classy, but not pretentious; fancy, but okay if you aren't the 'hippest' dresser (which I'm definitely not!); the kind of place that seems to foster great conversation over a glass of wine.

I love grazing, so I love places that have small plates. We grazed through the arugula salad, meatballs, and  fava bean bruschetta before sharing the pork loin. I swear, it was the best meal I've ever had (other than in Tours, France but that was 20 years ago). I've had decent arugula salads and meatballs (I love meatballs), but Terzo just has a way of making them taste well beyond decent. I can't remember the name of the wine we had, but it was amazing. I can't wait until I go again.
author: Nic Z.

description:
My fiancee and I decided to try this place last night for our anniversary dinner based on the yelp reviews.  In summary, we had a great time.  Terzo had a nice vibe to it:  very warm but still had a modern feel.  The decor and ambiance were nice without being stuffy...and had enough of a modern feel without feeling too loungy or feeling like management was trying too hard.

And the food...delicious.  We started with the fried egg bruschetta and the hummus with homemade pita.  The hummus was good and the pita was nice and warm with a slight crisp.  The fried egg bruschetta though was scarfed down in no time at all.  Strange how some egg, bread, greens, ricotta and olive oil could taste so good but that's what it was.

For our main courses, we had the skirt steak and the pork loin.  Both dishes were excellent.  The skirt steak was cooked a perfect medium rare and combined with the chirrichurri, was very flavorful.  My fiancee thought the pork loin was just slightly overcooked.  I disagreed but in any event, that's the reason for the one star deduction.  Irregardless, the flavor was still delicious and she still enjoyed it.  

To wrap it up, we had the apple crisp.  Very good.  That's all I really have to say about it.  So yes...Yay! I'm a fan.
author: Francis S.

description: Great food, great service and great ambiance. One of my favorite places in the bay area.
author: Alok P.

description:
Pork meatballs. Yum. And half priced wine on special nights - what more can you want? The bruschetta was a bit odd, with fried egg on top, but still delicious even for a non egg person like myself. The service was exceptional - seriously some of the best service I have had dining in San Francisco. The mozzarella on the salad was so creamy and melted in my mouth - I definitely recommend it. 

We tried 2 different wines - both were very good. I find it rare to really enjoy the wine I order at restaurants but it is clear that this place has put a lot of effort into their wine list. we had to order 4 small plates or 2 entrees to get the special 1/2 off wine price. 

The atmosphere is great too - good lighting, not too loud and small plates for sharing. I can't wait to go back!
author: Katherine B.

description: Had dinner and a couple glasses with a friend visiting from out of town. We split the Mozzarella with broccoli, the Meatballs on polenta, the Steak, and a couple scoops of ice cream. Everything was wonderfully prepared. And despite licking every plate clean, we left perfectly satisfied without feeling like gluttons. I will definitely be back.
author: Victoria L.

description:
My parents were in town yesterday and offered to take my BF and I out to dinner. I found Terzo on Yelp and was not disappointed. The menu is mostly composed of small plates. Its limited but everything we had was delicious. We ordered almost one of every of the small plates. The best dishes were:

1. Meatballs (tasty pork and delicious, flavorful polenta)
2. Mushrooms (on top of something fried and delicious and served with a tasty mushroom cream sauce) 
3. Calzone (pretty standard but the crust was just so fresh and delicious) 
4. Patatas bravas (more potato chip style served with lemon aioli) 

But truly everything was good. The prices looked a little expensive, but I didn't pay so I don't know exactly what the total bill was. 

The ambiance was very nice (though a little loud) and the service was professional. I would recommend this place to anyone and am definitely looking forward to going back again sometime.
author: Blond E.

description: This our absolute favorite restaurant. And it basically is all due to one dish. The atmosphere is very "chill" and the wait staff has always been very accommodating. A couple years back our housemate worked there and he turned us onto Terzo. The braised pork meat balls with polenta is amazing! I believe they braise the meat balls for 18 hours then they add creamy polenta with this amazing sauce. Its on the appetizer menu so at first me and my wife would share it then order a regular entree.....but no more! I had to put my foot down and loosen my belt (for the food). We both came to agreement, we need to order 1 for each of us. Anyway, we like the other dishes there such as the hummus and very tasty pita bread. The sparkling wine selection is also very good.
author: Chris Y.

description: What a fabulous dinner.  We had the following: humus with fabulous pita, the fava beans - to die for, asparagus with fresh egg - divine, arugula salad - amazing, the fresh pasta with peas, Mozzarella de Bufala - off the charts - two great bottles of Primotivo and yes  the chocolate cake and apple crisp.  I am checking, but I think I died and went to heaven!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! OMG - it was wonderful1
author: Regina P.

description:
much overdue review! had a fabulous date night here a couple months back. Great ambiance. Yummy food- We started with brushetta and meatballs for apps and then I had the skirt steak for the main entree- sooo amazingly good! We had a nice bottle of Rose' to go with our meals. 

Not the most amazing service, got our table moved due to noisy close table mates, but overall a great dining experience and more importantly, a great date night :)
author: Lauren S.

description: My husband and I had a great dinner here last night.  The space is very chic, the service was awesome and our food was delish! We split the celery soup, calamari, chicken kebabs, and mushrooms with polenta. Can't wait to go back!  What a treat!
author: Carrie C.

description:
Absolutely adorable wine/tapas bar in my favorite neighborhood in my new hometown!
My friend stumbled upon this place in her MIchelin guide and I am so glad we went. The decor leans towards Tuscan and the food selection is like the lovechild of Greece and Italy.
Fresh flowers, big wooden tables, candlelight and a fireplace, lots of wine- it's the perfect setting to a romantic date night.
The ingredients are fresh and the meats well marinated. The hummus was so incredibly delicious, as was the peach and ricotta bruschetta. 
The service is nice and the bathrooms are grandiose and clean (a chef friend once told me to always check the restrooms because no matter how good a restaurant is, if they don't have time to clean their bathrooms, they don't have time to clean much else. yuck.)

Anyways, tangent aside, this place seems like a neighborhood staple with seasonal menus and hopefully numerous returns.
author: Lianne Z.

description:
We were very happy with our experience at Terzo.  The food was excellent, especially the Moroccan Chicken, Skirt Steak and Gnocci.  Prices were reasonable, especially with the 50% off wines.

Loved it.
author: R L.

description: Good food.  Nothing stood out, but nothing was bad either.  I would go back.  Not cheap, but not expensive.  nice atmosphere.  nice date spot.  Had the grilled calamari, which was good.  Hummos was ok.  Meatballs were tasty.  Buffalo Moz with toast was good, but then again, it is just cheese from a store.  Sundae was lacking fudge and the orange peel was a nice touch - not worth $8 though.
author: Jordan S.

description:
My boyfriend and were in San Fran for a little romantic get-away and we called down to the concierge to recommend a nice low-key spot for dinner in the North Beach area. He came back with Terzo and we were glad he did! We arrived a little bit early for our reservation and found 2 spots at the bar. We decided to order a bottle of wine and an app while we waited. The bottle of wine was fantastic, it was a Pinot Noir from California (I told him we were only ordering CA wines since we were in CA) and we both found the quite very tasty. We then ordered the Meatballs and polenta and it came out with lightening speed and was absolutely delicious!!! The meatballs were sooo tasty as was the  marinara sauce, but the stopper was the polenta. It was so creamy and tasty, we were in heaven. 

 We were then seated for dinner and we decided to don one more starter so we had the hummus. The bread was amazing, it was piping hot and hand this wonderful seasoning to it. The hummus was good as well with a little bit of olive oil on top.  For our mains, I had the spaghetti and my boyfriend had the pork loin. Mine was absolutely AMAZING! I was expecting a red sauce, but was pleasantly surprised when it was just a noodle with tons of veggies, red pepper flakes and the topping was bread crumbs instead of Parmesan cheese. OMG, was it every tasty!!! If you don't like spicy, I wouldn't recommend ordering this dish (I happen to love spicy), it had very nice heat at the end of each bite. It was simply amazing. My boyfriends Pork Loin was delicious as well and we were both way too stuffed to even think about dessert. 

 I loved the ambiance of this place as well, we chilled at the bar for about a half hour before seated and we felt like we were in someone's kitchen. There was this little knook with tons of cook books on the shelves it was like being at home! I would definitely recommend this to anyone in the area, it was delicious!!!
author: Kori E.

description:
Stopped by Terzo on a Saturday night with a group of friends.  The restaurant itself is really nice.  They kept lowering the lighting which created great ambiance.  We all commented on the cookbook area which made the restaurant more welcoming (as if you were eating in a friend's kitchen).  They sat us at the communal table since there was not an open table for five available.

We opted to do family style (which in retrospect in my opinion was a bad idea).  The food was tasty, but because we only got a "taste" you really couldn't get the full experience.  At these nicer restaurants I think I'd be more satisfied with one dish for $30 rather then one bite of 5 dishes.

All in all, everyone enjoyed the experience.  Also, I'm probably would enjoy Terzo a lot more if I was a wine lover (they've got an extensive list).

Small plates
author: Christopher W.

description:
I went to Terzo with a group of seven ladies last night to celebrate a friend's birthday and just could not be happier!  The food, the wine, the service -- perfection!!!  

Truly, I wish i could remember our waiter's name because he added so much to our experience.  We readily took up the restaurant's offer of 1/2 off any bottles of wine under $40 (mon - thurs, i believe), ordering a white and a red for our group.  The waiter scored his first (huge) point by suggesting the to die for Chateau mas Neuf.  He brought out a couple of tastes for us to try when deciding on our second bottle, but in the end his original suggestion trumped everything else!  He also brought out veggies for the gluten-free member of our group to accompany our hummus.  He was attentive but never pushy and made several stellar recomendations.

The food was fabulous -- the mussels, chicken speidini, and calzone were all wonderful, but in the end, it was the desert that won us all over.  The gelato, flourless cake, and apple crisp were all delicious!

All in all, we couldn't have asked for more from Terzo and plan on coming back again very (very!) soon:)
author: Cary F.

description: Terzo has more than a positioning problem but that may be the root cause of their challenges. Is it Italian? Is it mediteranian? After a series of under seasoned dishes, accompanied by a hopeless 80s playlist and a sporadically attentive waitress I can only conclude that I'm not coming back. San Francisco makes you a food snob whether you are comfortable admitting it or not. Terzo unfortunately just doesn't cut it, which may be why the restaurant was half empty on a Sunday night.
author: Jonas O.

description:
Loved this place! 1. because its so close to me and 2. food/service was wonderful. Not to mention the ambiance and decor is very tasteful, classy, and relaxing. We started out with the Pork meatballs and beets salad. I'm a big beets fan and this one was great! Portion size was very favorable for a beets salad and the taste was perfect. Next up, meatballs...liked the meatballs but didn't love. I think it needed more tomato sauce but other than that they were good. And on to the entree, I had the Moroccan style chicken and my date had the flank steak. I love loved the chicken and I typically never order chicken because steak or fish entice more; however, it was awesome. Basmati rice, juicy chicken leg, mango (I think), dates
or some type of prune, nuts, and a great sauce. It won me over. We ended the meal with a refreshing and hearty warm nectarine crisp topped with vanilla ice cream. It was fantastic as well! Highly suggest this quaint place in the Marina if you want a relaxing and satisfying evening.
author: nicole s.

description:
Probably 3.5 stars overall... with 4 star potential 

Staff:  I've had very hit-or-miss service.  One time we wanted to (secretly) pay for the wine from my parent's bill and the server completely forgot at the time she presented the full bill to my parents.  Another time the server was clearly eager to leave given our reservation was for 9PM on a weekday... came across VERY divo-ish.  That being said, nothing is perfect in client service and the potential fix is there.  I have had equally positive experiences with the wait-staff.  Mark, the owner/chef, is extremely talented, devoted, and fantastic handling customer requests so the restaurant is in good hands overall...

Wine:  good enough wine list that's approachable.  nothing outstanding or dissatisfying to mention.

Food/menu/chef:  excellent.  i did have to send back chicken that was uncooked once, that experience has not deterred me from coming back and digging into the food.  A very approachable menu for all kinds of eaters.

Ambience:  if you are stuck in the Marina, this is definitely a top choice.  I like to dine late and I find that they are limited by their closing time.... even if they didn't take reservations that late, they should do something to prevent the customer from feeling like as soon as they leave, the entire staff walks out behind them.

If you can dine anywhere in the city, there are better 4-star recs for the same price.  Bar Jules, Range, Delarosa, ....
author: Gracie L.

description:
The beauty of a neighborhood restaurant is it's ability to let you forget that you ever left the comforts of your own home.

Terzo, tucked in a wonderful spot on Union and Steiner, is an inviting dinner party with a knockout menu, and captures the essence of  a napa sunset with its soothing tones and clean decor.

Friday night, my friends and I rested on the communal table and began the drive through Mark Gordon's intricate yet simple menu of delectable plates.

Beginning with the hummus and home made pita, you felt as if you were on your first trip back from college. Delighted to be back home, and to be served the warmness only a mother could bestow upon you.

A treat, that was immediately ordered again before it was even finished. 

The spicy coriander sausage was one of a kind, my only complaint was that there was only 1.

The warm goat cheese on the sliced sour dough baguettes were desperate for attention and I found myself without guilt giving it the attention it deserved. ( what can I say, cheese has a soft spot in the heart of the Palindrome )

The skirt steak was the highlight of the drive, and left you blind to the others in the room. The warm potatoes played perfectly with the salty after taste of the medium rare steak, and the seasoned baby lettuce left your mind in a soothing slumber.

Finished the meal with the watermelon and feta tasting, which was a perfect injection of sweets with a tempered release of bite.

Terzo is a home, not a restaurant. When you enter and when you leave, you were simply part of a magnificent dinner party that you know you'll be back too.
author: Mike K.

description:
We had dinner at Terzo.. The ambiance is intimate and quiet. We ate the grilled asparagus, buffalo mozarella, and the king salmon braised in a piquant tomato sauce.
All delicious. The flour less chocolate cake with expresso whipped cream topped off the meal. The service was excellent. Would return.
author: Susan C.

description:
We came to Terzo after wanting to try it out for quite some time.  I was beyond impressed!  We ordered the mussels which were probably some of the most delicious mussels, which were large and tasted extremely fresh, in a great broth.  The skirt steak with chimichurri sauce will definitely be ordered again as well.  Our waiter was extremely nice and even included a candle in our dessert after slyly mentioning my boyfriends birthday.  I also loved the interior of the restaurant, cozy and welcoming.  

The small plates are great to share and order a few to taste (we also had the cheese plate that was grilled and the corn dish, both delicious!

DEFINITELY worth going to and returning again and again.
author: Emma A.

description:
I was SO disappointed and won't go back... maybe if this were some back water town but SF fine dining? Don't insult them by including this restaurant...
Any restaurant that uses soy or canola oil is either A.) cheap B.) not into health
The fish was farmed (not a viable option for those who like healthy food, "go sell crazy somewhere else")
I'm sorry, but maybe the high praise was written by those who think Ragu makes a good sauce...
service was mediocre. ...
author: caroline j.

description:
On the recommendation of a cousin from the Midwest (no, she's not the farmer's daughter - Beach Boys), our family dined here tonight. Nestled in this quiet block in Cow Hollow (saw the Hollow Cow down the block), this seemed like unfamiliar ground for me; heck, I couldn't even remember whether Steiner was east or west of Fillmore Street. Reading some of the promotions and postings, this is obviously a good spot for wine connoisseurs, given the large list and their reasonable pricing specials (half off on selected wines). My cousin used to work in a nearby office, so she was familiar. The menu is not huge, but has a good variety of small plates and about five large plate selections. We strategized the following menu of shared appetizers for a party of eight (2 each except for the cured meats, 1): 
1) Hummus (signature dish) - I'm not big on this, but everyone seemed to enjoy it. - $8.00 
2) Bruschetta - My personal favorite. How can you hate on crispy toast covered with tomatoes and a sunny-side egg? Love my runny eggs. - $9.00 
3) Cured Meats - Mixture of three or four different meats. Was afraid to eat beyond my share (eight in our party). - $9.00 
4) Panzarotto - Their version of calzone, filled with gooey cheese and topped with their tangy tomato sauce. - $9.50 
5) Meatballs - Two raquetball-sized pork meatballs in a tangy, cheesy tomato sauce on a bed of polenta. My #2 choice of appetizers. - $13.00 
Large Plates 
I ordered the Grilled Skirt Steak, done medium rare (perfectly done). It came with baby carrots and braised potatoes, which were melt-in-mouth good. There was some small glob of buttery substance that melted on the steak; it made the dish a little too rich for my taste. - $26.00 
My parents and cousin gave me portions of their Braised Chicken, served on a bed of tasty rice - $22.00, and Wild Salmon (from Washington state, as emphasized by our waiter), which came on a bed of garbanzo beans - $27.00. The salmon was okay, but the chicken was probably the star large plate. They basically give you the drumstick and thigh as the waiter aptly warned that it is dark meat. The braising (slow cooked) process kept the meat both tender and moist with the chicken flavor infusing into the rice. The pork chop, ordered by a friend, looked very good, but I didn't try it - $24.00. 
Sides 
Crispy Onions - We ordered two servings of this for the eight of us to share, which was more than enough. Think temperature hot, crunchy onions strings in a large crock-sized bowl. Great with the steak. - $3.00 
Desserts 
Nectarine Tart - I ordered this to share with my parents as the above was enough for a more-than-satisfying meal. Small slices of white nectarines in a light sauce top a flaky,buttery crust; the tart is topped with one small scoop of vanilla ice cream. Love our seasonal fruits and vegetables here. - $8.00 
The waiter was pretty efficient to start (stating that many if not all ingredients are organic from Napa and Sonoma counties), but, as the meal progressed, there were some "errors" to our meal: a) ordered grilled asparagus - was not placed, b) friend ordered pork chop, but originally served spaghetti (which looked delish, BTW) - ten minute wait afterwards. But, since the food was very good, they became afterthoughts. Prior to leaving, they comped an extra order of the nectarine tart to our table, which was a nice gesture. The servers were very efficient in keeping water glasses filled and removing empty plates, often a daunting task with big parties. I was ready to give a 3.5 star for the entire experience (minus 0.5 for the errors), but then I heard my cell phone voice mail. Someone from the restaurant apologized for an error and informed me that they credited my credit charge for about $20.00 to correct this. Since they a) noticed the error and b) erased the error, it is only appropriate to refund them the 0.5 star. Nice...
author: Mike C.

description: The food was so yummy. I was surprised by all the different tastes that each dish had. The chicken kabobs where amazing as well as the polenta with mushroom and onions.
author: deepika y.

description: this is our favorite spot, we always have great service and a phenomenal meal.  Sometimes we want a quick early dinner and sometimes we want a long dining experience - it works for both.
author: Cristina S.

description: Best neighborhood restaurant in the neighborhood. By far.  Innovative food (but not too innovative), warm atmosphere, top-notch service.   I also like their focus on fresh, organic food.
author: Dorian F.

description:
Probably the most fantastic place for Tapas! Why did I not give it 5 stars? The service. 

We arrived right on time for our 8:30pm reservation on Thursday night. The place was busy not every table was full. We waited for a good 10 minutes for out table. Is that weird? And there were others waiting as well - so this wasn't just a "we don't like you so we're going to have you stand awkwardly for a few minutes before we seat you" type of a deal.  Although I have to say, the service once we sat down was fabulous! 

It is super romantical - my specialty when it comes to picking restaurants. I need to work on that... sometimes it just isn't appropriate :P But overall the food was great! We had the arugula salad, the chicken skewers, and the fried mozzarella thing. Man. I wish I remembered what the names were! Then we shared the pasta and the steak. We then shared the chocolate pot de creme. I think I like Townhall's better... but this one was very decadent, so still very good!  The flavors were excellent! WAY better than my last tapas experience. 

And the best part, is the 1/2 off wine Mondays - Thursdays! They'll even cork and wrap it up for you if you don't finish it! 

Parking is hard to find in this area, but worth the drive and adventure. Just remember, patience is virtue!
author: Lisa L.

description: Im a fan of tapas and Mediterranean food so this place was awesome to me!
author: christopher h.

description:
We went here for my birthday dinner this week and it will definitely go down as one of my favorite meals!

Atmosphere is great, romantic.  Service is quite good.

Wine deal w/ the 1/2 off a bottle is an awesome deal.

Food - we had 3 courses of small/large plates.  Roasted Beets, Grilled asparagus, Black cod, skirt steak (marinated to perfection), soft shell crab with a cole slaw (I never like cole slaw, but it didn't have mayo and was divine).  Oh and we ended the meal with the apple crisp.  It was so yummy.  This is now one of our new favorite restaurants that we'll be taking our friends too.
author: Denice L.

description:
A friend and I had dinner there this past Saturday, having planned on going elsewhere, but having sat in my apartment having a couple of drinks.  I have lived 1/2 a block from this restaurant for nearly a year, and have never been.  What a mistake!  I was missing something great!

The ambiance was wonderful . . . very warm and cozy, yet spacious enough to have a good amount of tables.  The service was friendly and knowledgeable . . . I love it when a server speaks of a dish about which you can tell they are genuinely passionate. 

We chose a bottle of a French Syrah blend, which was spicy, and much broader than you usually get for a digestible price point.  They were out of the meatballs and the pork (not a big deal, since it was close to closing time) so we had three starters and a main.  I am still thinking about the Ling Cod (which is what led me to come and write this).  We also really enjoyed our calamari (not fried) panzanella, and the fig bruchetta.  For our main, we shard the chicken over basmati rice.  This was the dish that was so clearly loved by our waitress.  She did not steer us wrong.  It was divine. 

Not usually a dessert person, we were persuaded, as my friend and I had been speaking about fresh peaches, and there was a fresh peach cobbler.  I do not regret those calories, even as I head to the Coit tower stairs today to burn it off.

All in all, a treat.  I was only left asking my other friends, "why have we not been here before?"
author: Linda A.

description:
A great spot to take a date or simply if you crave tasty mediternaneen food. Love the atmosphere!

They have about 15 items on the menu and we tried about 8. There wasn't one dish I didn't enjoy. I have to give it up for the hummus and the olive oil brushed pita bread which was absolutely delicious as well as the roasted eggplant with red peppers. 

I also highly recommend the Cod with corn, red beets and the calamari. 

For desert, we had the flourless chocolate cake, d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s!
author: Nez B.

description: Country Boy finds Terzo, Country Boy finds that the food taste like food, the decor was comfortable and relaxing and they even let me wear my country hat. Two Thumbs Up
author: Jim W H.

description:
Although located only around the corner from our home we enjoyed Terzo for the first time last night and we were impressed.

The food, wait staff and decor are all appreciable and we will return.

I must note that bill was placed on table before my wife finished her pumpkin cheese cake.   We were only able to secure an 18:15 reservation and we do understand turning tables but this little push out the door was unwelcome and a behaviour I for one would suggest be reversed.
author: Jay D.

description:
I love sitting at the bar after a long day at work and being treated like a guest in a friends home.  They always make great wine selections and help me enjoy my meals even though I have allergies.

The lighting is superb, low enough to soothe the eyes and just bright enough to read the menu.

Cheers! I'l see ya soon!
author: Andriana M.

description:
I had no idea what we were in for when i decided to give Terzo a shot, i've read about it, heard about it, but had never been.  It was a Sunday evening, we arrived around 9, they were surprisingly happy to take us in, considering they closed at 10.  the crowd consisted of a few table for twos, buzzed/drunk groups of friends, talking about god-knows-what, laughing and having a good time, some were dressed in business attire, others in jeans, sneakers and a fleece...in short, the atmosphere was care free and comfortable.  the place is i'd say on the smaller side, maybe ten or so seats at the bar, a handful of window tables, and seating/tables for maybe 30-40 (not quite sure, we were at the window) as you go inward.  i should add that it was not small in a claustrophobic way, but rather a cozy and intimate way.

i'm a big wine drinker, but not a wine connoisseur.  i'm the type that loves to drink wine, but i pay little attention to the names of the wineries, or the different types of wine...i just know when a wine tastes great to me, and that is what matters.  with that said, i told our waiter (i forgot this great gentleman's name) my take on wine, and asked for a bottle of red wine that would compliment our meals.  out of the handful of recommendations he readily provided, i chose a pinot noir.  awesome...simply awesome.  a small plate combo'd with a large plate is perfect for each person, satisfying your hunger and easily pleasing your taste buds, all while leaving enough room in your tummy to take in a substantial amount of wine to drink and talk the evening away.

as the10 o'clock closing time closed in, our waiter simply let us pay for our check ($84 for two large plates, two smalls, a shared dessert, and a bottle of some good stuff), gave us a complimentary glass of wine, and told us not to rush.

hospitality:  awesome  
ambiance:  intimate and welcoming
food:  worth it
the wine:  it worked for us just fine

would i go back?  you wouldn't even have to ask.
author: Ian Q.

description:
I've walked by this place without even noticing what I was missing all those years. 

All I can say is DELICIOUSNESS at every bite, so amazing! I will definitely be back. Service was attentive and wine list was a nice variety with plenty to choose from in the under $40 a bottle range. 

The highlight of the evening was the nectar crisp, just mouth watering. 

I would suggest making a reservation, even though we got lucky and walked in without one - several parties were turned away.
author: Kristina A.

description: Finally tried Terzo again and I wasn't quite as happy with the food. We ordered the polenta with mushrooms, papas bravas, hummus, butternut squash and a salad. The papas bravas were very spongey (not at all what I expected) and hummus was a little bland. Overall everything was VERY salty, including the salad dressing. Not sure if they were laying it on thick that night or they now have a heavy hand with the salt but it was way too much... Still love the interior and the staff is very friendly but they need to get a handle on the salt!
author: Gina C.

description: I had visited this restaurant a few years ago - took my wife here when we were still dating. We had a great time. Things have really gone down hill. I brought a client of mine here for dinner on a Saturday night. The first red flag was how easy it was to get a 7:30pm reservation. First of all, the tables are way too close and there are no sound-dampening solutions, so it's loud as hell, even though there are not that many people in the restaurant. We had no idea who our waiter was; we waited 20 minutes for someone to come by and take our drink order. We finally had to has the hostess to send someone over for that. My client asked about the 3 champagne options (each $12+ per glass) they had available and the waiter had no clue. That's tacky. The food was certainly not worth the money. It was dull. Tasted like something from a food truck. Would never go back. I'm surprised this place is still in business, but I guess that's obvious based on all their open Saturday night reservations.
author: Jake B.

description: Great food even better service, for sure Recomend
author: Ilya K.

description: I used to live around the corner from Terzo and ate there at least once a month. The hummus is to die for! They change up their menu a lot, but the small plate meal is the way to go. Everything is always very yummy and they have a great wine selection too! Wonderful staff as well...
author: Katherine L.

description:
At last! Small plates done right! Beretta should take a note. Perfect portions (in other words, they don't take the word "small" to the extreme), great selection, reasonable prices, and everything tastes great. Of course some plates were the clear winners - the pork belly and the black trumpet mushrooms. Oh, and don't think you can only order onion rings with burgers. You know how when you bite into fried onion, it always comes out of the batter and burns your mouth? These don't do that! Don't skip over them. 

The waitress cracked me up. She was really great, but she kept trying to add this awkward sophisticated tone to everything by saying "beautiful" after everything we said to her. 

"Are you ready to order?"

"No, I think we're still working on it."

"beautiful, beautiful. Take your time."

5 min later...

"I think we're going to order 4 plates now, and go for another round after we're done."

"Beautiful."

The more wine I drank, the funnier that became. My dinner was so good (probably enhanced by the people I was there with), that I almost gave it 5 stars...one of those meals that for the next 2 hours the only thing I said was "Wow, that was good! We had so much fun!" But, to be honest I could probably make most of those plates at home, so I can't go all the way. But I would definitely go out of my way to go back for a lively dinner with friends or family.
author: Kelsey E.

description: Came with a gal pal on a Sunday at 5:30pm, so had the place to ourselves.  The waitress was super nice and didn't make us feel bad for only ordering a couple items and glasses of wine.  The asparagus salad was the best item we got (also got buffalo mozzarella and meatball app).
author: Kate B.

description: Simply delicious! Everything was excellent. Flourless chocolate cake FTW.
author: Lia H.

description:
Got to love the 1/2 price bottles on weekdays (just make sure to ask the waiter about the fine print--only good on bottles $40 and under, must order 2 small plates or 1 entree per person).  
Great menu that changes daily, which means I can come a lot and never get tired of it!  Best thing on the menu (and it's thankfully always there) is the hummus and pita. The pita comes out fresh from the oven and it's so delicious! 
Great little neighborhood place, lots of charm and good food and wine.  I'm a fan.
author: M. C.

description: The small plates are fantastic, the nectar of "Gods" amazing, the ambiance was just what me and a couple GFs needed on a Monday night.  What is even more impressive is the customer service when I left my Gucci cosmetic bag .  I did not realize the mistake made until the following morning.  Once I call and spoke to the staff, they put in an envelope and mailed it to me in San Jose.  Thank you for your honesty and customer service.  I will be back with other friends soon for the great food and just as important to me,  your fantastic customer service.  By the way, the amazing food is still haunting my palate.
author: Meilan F.

description:
Great Maître d' - Great Food - Great Wine - Fair Price

They put new items on the menu everyday - chicken skewers and hummus however are always on there and both were really great.

Roasted beet salad was also excellent.

Good luck saving room for dessert.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Great Ambiance - the place is very warm and inviting.  We were lucky enough to have a fun group sitting next to us who were inviting and engaging, which added a bunch of laughs to the evening.

Great Menu - Wonderful selections of small plates and large plates with something for everyone.  Some were very simple such as the asparagus to much more robust flavors across the large plates.

Wine list was a extensive range of California, Europe & beyond with many fantastic by the glass options.  

The service was fantastic.  Very friendly, helpful, responsive.  

Overall I think it is a wonderful place for a week night date or a few friends to get together to share drinks and food.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Its a good place. Not spectacular. But really good. 
Service: 5 stars
Food: 4 Stars
Value for money: 3 strars
Ambience:  5 stars
author: amit s.

description:
Surprise me with a date night, I asked.  Meet me on the corner at Geary and Kearny at 6pm, he says.  We meet at the bus stop and take the 45 cross-town.  A colorful route from Fidi through C-town, North Beach, Washington Square and ultimately to the Cow Hollow.  The adventure continued upon entering Terzo.

Small plates, huge flavors.  Hummus was a recommend.  Really?  I make my own.  How can it be different?  The sesame chapati-esque pita dusted with za'atar with a schmear of olive oil unlocked a different dimension.  Then quickly, it became Yes to the rest.  Grilled chicken spiedini (gremolata, I love you).  Fava Bean bruschetta with leeks and ricotta (not salty, refreshing and light).  Grilled calamari over broad beans (the most tender).  Day boat scallops over asparagus and spring peas (wow, here is spring in a bowl).

Wine List is lengthy.  Rubico 2007.  Awesome.

Dessert could not be skipped.  Strawberry crostata.  Fresh mint infused tea was amazing.

Service was the best.  

I think we definitely have a new go-to for date night or otherwise.
author: K W.

description: We had a perfectly decent meal here. We really loved the ambiance, and the service was very good. Our food was all good (LOVED the squash!), but nothing on the menu is making us race back. It's hard to stand out in San Francisco!
author: Heather K.

description:
I love Terzo!  Everything from the atmosphere and service to the food and wine.  I've been here four times (all within the last 3 months) and the food has been consistently good.

The first two visits, we had the same super friendly server.  She remembered what we ordered the last time (pry not from memory but instead a good POS system.  But kudos to her for using it  to provide good customer service).

I have too many good things to say about the food so I'll just highlight my favorites.  Anything with polenta in it is good (I'm usually not a fan of polenta, but i love it here).  Braised chicken thigh was delish.  Wild mushroom appetizer super flavorful.  Fresh mozzarella was freaking amazing (i know, it's just cheese!  but it melted in my mouth).  Lastly, desserts are a must here (try something with the chocolate mint tea!).  Usually I find desserts at restaurants to be "just okay."  They're either good, but uninspiring, or they're creative, but not so tastey.  Terzo's desserts are comforting.  I thoroughly enjoyed Terzo's pear crisp, cheesecake, blood orange cake, and chocolate mousse...yum
author: Vonnie L.

description: I came here for a fun dinner with friends last night and it was a good experience.  The service was good and the food even better!  We had the mozzarella, the assorted meat platter and the fava bean bruschetta. The bruschetta was by FAR the winner of the night. It was served with marscapone cheese and mint and the flavors melded together perfectly. Our large plates were greek chicken, skirt steak and the pork loin.  All in all it was a great meal.  The desserts were the only part that were lacking a bit, but the rest of the food made up for it.
author: Katharine A.

description:
Yay!  Another great restaurant in the Marina/Cow Hollow area that competes with A16!    Can't believe it has taken me so long to get here.  If I would have had any idea it would have been this great, would have been here months and months earlier.

Beautiful, hip, happening, but still able to have a good conversation ambiance.  Service was good...they offered great suggestions, cleared plates in a timely manner, and timed the shared items to come out so that we never had more than 2 at a time.   We shared numerous small plates and an entree:  fava beans, mussels,  asparagus, grilled artic char and lamb shoulder,   We shared a bottle of red that was recommended by the server..excellent and for 1/2 price Sun-thurs (Bargain!).  I think it was the Rioja??  

Fava bean dish was quite small, tasty, but I wouldn't rave about it.  Asparagus was...really good simply prepared asparagus.  The mussels were absolutely divine...I think the best I have ever had (I eat mussels a fair amount).  The server had recommended them as being "particularly good" that evening, and they were!  (they put Plouf's to shame!)  Artic char was simply, but deliciously prepared with a pesto of some sort and the lamb shoulder was obviously slow cooked and incredibly tender.  We enjoyed high quality coffee and a ginger cake that was the dessert special for the evening.

I would highly recommend this spot if looking to dine in a more sophisticated spot in the Cow Hollow/Marina area.  Though, just down the street from me, it ranks as worthy as a destination from any neighborhood in SF.
author: Elle S.

description: Just had one of the best dinners, great food and service! Ron you were an amazing waiter! Thank you for a great dinner! Highly recommended!
author: Vita S.

description:
I love this place.  The food is really good (a little spendy, but really good), the staff is friendly, and environment stylish.  Nicole, the regular bartender is super-friendly and definitely makes dining at the bar an enjoyable experience every time.  I do miss Alison and the the rest of the old staff, though.  They really made you feel welcome.  They new "manager" is not terribly friendly, but she's very young, so I assume she'll figure it out eventually.  And as long as the food stays good and Nicole is behind the bar, I'll keep coming in.

5/29/08 update:  Nicole is no longer there and I really can't see a reason to eat there any more.  It is, after all, in the Marina.  Yikes.
author: Joe C.

description:
Terzo is a great addition to the Marina, the name is Italian for "third" and the owners told me they picked it because they wanted this place to be customers' third place to gather after home and work. I like that just off thought just off the bat.

Making a reservation helps, since the restaurant was packed on the Tuesday night we showed up. Our waiter was friendly and attentive through the night, and made us feel instantly welcome.

The Mediterranean style menu is made up of small and medium plates, and that's half the fun - the picking and choosing, the mixing and matching. I can easily recommend the housemade pita and hummus, the pancetta wrapped figs, the roasted beets, the spicy calabrese sausage, I could go on.

Ok, I will. The free range chicken spiedini was another favorite, as were the crispy onions. As you can see, there's a variety of items to choose from, and our waiter and the kitchen were great about pacing the meal.

Evidently you can sit at the bar as a walk in, and there's are a few different bar items like lemon-rosemary chicken wings and assorted pickled vegetables to enjoy while having a nice glass of wine.

Speaking of which, the wine list is daringly non-Californian, and I have to give Terzo credit for pulling that off successfully in a city like ours.

Good times all around, and unlike some of the reviewers on here, I actually found the pricing to be pretty reasonable all things considered. 

If I lived closer to Terzo, this would certainly become a regular spot for me, much like NOPA has become in my own neighborhood.
author: Nish N.

description:
My friend took me to Terzo for dinner a few months ago.  It is essentially his "kitchen" as he dines here a couple of times each week.  We shared 3 small plates and one entree - plenty of food for both of us.  Hummus with pita was the most memorable.  Many restaurants have hummus on their menu, but to make a simple and easy dish memorable takes special talent.  The meatball and steak entree were yummy too.

The restaurant has a nice vibe with warm and intimate decor/ambience (great 1st date place!); fashionable clientele; and staff is very friendly and professional.
author: Joan C.

description:
Wow, what a surprise, and yet not a surprise given the pedigree of Laurie Thomas and Nice Ventures of Rose Pistola and Rose's Cafe fame.
