description: What a great cozy restaurant in the Marina. Have dined here numerous times and have always had such a great dining experience. Great service, great tapas and great atmoshphere ... how can you beat that? Food has alot of flavor and the desserts are amazing. Great wine list and the waiters have a great handle on the menu. Will be back!
author: JaVae B.

description: Solid San Francisco Dinning! Waitstaff was decent but not perfect and lets face it San Francisco has high standards for dining room service. In Phoenix, Denver, or Dallas the service would be 5 stars.  Solid wine list...no complaints. The Highway 29/commercialized napa drool was kept to a minimum. Just a few more hipsters than I like; but what do you expect it is in Cow Hollow.
author: J B.

description: Just visited San Francisco and went to several good to excellent restaurants for dinner. (Des Amis, Bix, Spruce, A16) This cozy restaurant stood out--just super fresh, quality and delicious food.  The chef (so friendly-stopped by our table) said the arugula was picked that morning and was generous enough to share his meatball recipe which were some of the best I've ever had. (It's complicated so I'll just have to return)  Our table tried most of the items on the menu and it was all good.  Go!!!
author: J B.

description:
Start to finish, this place did the right thing.  My Bday and my choice, so let me say Bravo!
We brought a bottle of wine and ordered a beautiful bottle of Sancerre and were informed that corkage would still be applied, which we acknowledged and accepted without hesitance.
We were assigned a center table next to the bus station but when asked,  the server moved us to a more desirable table in her section, without any ado. 
Our server explained the menu and the way the small plates worked and recommended how this would work for us.
Start with a few plates and add if you wish.
Crispy Chantrelle mushrooms over polenta cake with just a hint of Parmesan cheese, WOW!
Lemon squash with Feta, shaved onions and olive oil, oh la la!
Chilled tomato soup with chili heat yum!
Onion rings, not a big flabby chewy mess, but light crispy puffs. 
Pork tenderloin was OK but the plate mates were, not identifiable.
Sea Bass with warm Chick Peas, the Sea Bass was tough and had way to much parsley, but the beans were great!
Then came the dessert, plum upside down cake, this was a hubba-hubba dish. Just the right balance of sweet cake and tart fruit, nothing better.
At the end of the meal, we had offered our server a glass of the Burgundy we brought with us and the house waved the corkage fee, just share, it works!
I'll be back without hesitation.
author: t b.

description:
Incredibly yummy and great service. Vibrant ambiance but somewhat cramped.

Arugula salad: Light and fresh.
House Cured Meats & Focaccia: Good.
Free Range Chicken Spiedini: Tasty.
Trumpet Mushrooms: Amazing.
Gnocchette: A MUST!
Honey-Pine Nut Tart: Irresistible.
author: JDandCarol W.

description: I am a huge fan of Terzo!! After 3 visits, have yet to be disappointed. The brushetta, steamed mussels (broth is to die for) and argula salad are my favorites although the menu does change daily. Great ambiance, wine bar feel, open kitchen, some counter seating. Perfect for an intimate dinner to a medium-sized group, especially if you can reserve the large communal table.
author: Lisa C.

description:
some of the food is to-die-for. some of it is closer to ordinary. nothing's bad. 

we especially liked the fig bruschetta, the linguine with pancetta, and the meatballs. 

our server was friendly and knowledgeable, both about the food and the wine. 

the decor is uber-stylish; loved the bathroom.

the music was a bit aggressive. heavy club beat coming from a speaker right above our table. it made it hard to relax. but we asked the hostess if she could do something about it, and she very happily lowered the volume. it made a big difference. great service.

the small plates came a bit fast, one dish after another. it was a bit relentless and didn't leave us time to breath. a small palate cleanser, something to slow the pace, would have been a nice touch. 

wine list is incredible (and the half-off special is a bargain!). 

all in all, the place was sweeter and more neighborhoody than we'd expected. we enjoyed it a lot.
author: Chris R.

description: This restaurant is unexpectedly large and trendy! What a great surprise to find such a beautiful restaurant behind the outdoor seating that had initially attracted me to this wonderful place. The food was excellent... the service was on point... We will definitely be going again!
author: Alyssa B.

description: Fantastic restaurant.  We've eatn here only once but can't wait to go back.  We've been raving about it to all of our friends.  Great food, great service and great atmosphere.  Definitely give this place a try!
author: Debbie M.

description: I absolutely love this place. I have lived in SF for two years and have dined here about once a week. I have never tasted anything that wasn't excellent! It is consistently amazing - the food, the service, and the chef... one of my SF all time favorites!
author: JEFF B.

description: Good food, great ambience, great wine, decent prices! This is a great restaurant for group dining- everyone can find something to eat. And the ambience is great- one of those restaurants you can go for a casual night out or if you're having a special night.
author: M S.

description: Super ambiance, excellent food, and friendly staff.. The bruschetta  is to die for... Very creative and just the right portions... highly reccomended
author: Alex L.

description: I joined the legions of people waiting to get into Terzo. It's a cool place with bottles of wine lined up on the wall and a bright interior. I wouldn't call it romantic inside since the tables are so close, but subtle trendy would be a good description. The food which is Mediterranean inspired small plates really impressed. Despite the fact that there were two of us, we brought big appetites and managed to try almost everything on the menu. The standouts included white corn chowder, chicken skewers with a fancy name that were some of the best cooked chicken I've had out, the halibut with an amazing romesco sauce, grilled asparagus, and black truffle ravioli. The only thing that disappointed was the salmon which just seemed a little off but wasn't bad. Dessert didn't blow me away but was good. Service was very friendly and the waiter did a great job of explaining the small plate concept and steering us towards the right amount of food. The only problem was a small error with our check, but it was fixed quickly. I'd definitely go back even though I'm not a huge Meditteranean food fan.
author: Keith R.

description: Why do I keep trying the 'small plates' concept?  I should know better, but I with Rose's and Rose Pistola on their resume, I thought maybe I would find the spot that deviates from the overpriced and uninspired standard.  Not so.  The highlights were the extremely gracious hostess and the glass of prosecco while we waited for our table.  If I went back (not likely), I would remain at the bar and choose a few selections from the enoteca window, which had an authentic European vibe.   On to dinner...  arugula salad - blah; steak -chewy; and we waited 40 minutes for mussels, watching the waitstaff deliver plates and plates to all of the other tables without as much as a passing glance at us, waiting, wondering.  And then, when the mussels came (all 10 of them), they were tough and lacked flavor.  Service was nothing to write about either way.  With all the wonderful dining in this fair city, I would take a pass on this one.
author: Julie L.

description: To be honest we were a little disappointed with Terzo, especially given it's reputation as a foody place. Maybe we made a mistake in going for large plates, some of the small plate dishes on neighbouring tables looked and smelt more uplifting.My pork loin was excellently cooked but could have done with more seasoning or a suace to lift the rather bland flavour. The braised cabbage and spaetzle which accompanied it really had no flavour at all. My friend's chicken served on a bed of Orzo pasta was equally bland and about a third of the size of the portion I'd eaten elsewhere the night before for about the same price. My dessert of chocolate midnight cake was moist and light but lacked the big chocolate hit one might have expected whilst my friend's sundae consisted of two scoops of ice cream with a squirt of chantilly cream and a drizzle of sauce. On the plus side there's a reasonable range of well kept beers, service was friendly and prompt and the decor and ambience are very good. But this was our most expensive meal around Cow Hollow and by far the least satisfying. I also couldn't quite understand their adding a 1.5% service charge (yes that's right not 15% but 1.5%). Not really likely to influence the size of the tip and surely just a way of pushing up the prices?
author: elanman

description: So Terzo is the reason why I actually became a Yelper.  I feel like this place has solid food, atmosphere and ambiance but could definitely benefit from a Yelp review on service.  I came here in April to take my best friend to dinner for her bday since I was missing her bday celebration (yes, I am a big slacker and never got around to yelping about this till now).  The food was pretty good.  Nothing super memorable although I liked their homemade pita and hummus.  I had two major problems with Terzo.  One, the server brought us a side of olives at the very beginning.  Neither of us had ever been to Terzo so we assumed that every table gets this.  About 10 minutes later, the server tells us he made a mistake and the olives weren't supposed to be for us.  He asks if he wants us to take them away; since, we had been eating them for the last 10 minutes, i don't really see the harm in leaving the rest on the table.  When it was the end of the meal, I let the server know it was my BFF's bday and so he immediately sweeps up the dessert menus and tells us it's taken care of.  we got the dessert - something with chocolate, pretty good but not anything to rave about.  Well, the check comes and it turns out that he charged us for both the olives and the dessert.  WHAT??  the olives were his mistake..that makes no sense he would charge us for it.  and if i had said, go ahead and take away the olives, would he have then given the remainder of my half-eaten portion to the rightful table?  Or, did my assent that he could leave them on the table, meant that I actually ordered them?  Also, with dessert...i feel like its pretty normal that most restaurants comp it when its somebody's bday.  but if you aren't going to comp it, then let us pick the dam dessert!  I'm fine with chocolate but if ain't free, you better believe I'm going to take my sweet time looking at all the options and deciding what looks most appetizing.  not huge errors in service, but definitely something they could work on...consider this your constructive feedback terzo.
author: Cathy L.

description: I really enjoyed the food and wine at this restaurant. I made a reservation on Open Table...very easy...and when running late and after adding a person, the hostess helped us to reschedule our reservation for later in the evening.  The food was very tasty...between 3 of us we ordered 5 plates and had plenty of food.  We also had a bottle of wine. Surprisingly the prices were pretty reasonable...it ended up being around $40 a person. Not bad for a small plates restaurant in the city!
author: Kelly M.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city - great seasonal food, good prices, and half price bottles of wine during the week. (note, you need to order at least one entree or two small plates per person to get the half priced wine).  It doesn't get much better.  Their eggplant dish that is sometimes on the menu is absolutely amazing, and the pork meatballs over polenta are delicious and seem to be a staple on the menu.  And the service was fantastic - they let us linger for a long time, knew the wine list well, and had great suggestions.
author: Kelsey M.

description: Eclectic food makes this place a fantastic place to eat. I especially like the hummus appetizer.  Very clean and the service is great.  I would definitely eat here again.
author: Matt J.

description: This was my 6th time to Terzo and the most disappointing. Tonight the service felt very rushed which was a very different experience than my prior ones. I was with a couple of friends and we were in deep discussion about an important topic when we were abruptly interrupted by the hostess "asking if we valet parked" ie: we need your table, so let's go ... now, if she was a good hostess, she would have taken notice that we did not valet. Of course, this rude interruption of our conversation made it quickly end and we headed for the door. When I approached the hostess and let her know that I thought her behavior was rude, she was quick to blame it on our server. Poor form all around. Disappointing experience.
author: Kristin P.

description: Just returned from my trip to SF.  Boy was this restaurant a treat!  My friend and I and her boyfriend had 6 small plates and each was absolutely out of this world.  YUM.  Meatballs over polenta.  fig bruschetta.   SO good and so wonderfully San Francisco.
author: Katie C.

description: Love, love love. Great food, great wine list and great atmosphere. Wow, you also have to tryout desserts if you have sweettooth.
author: kumiko m.

description: went here for desert and wine the other night and i was very pleased. their flourless chocolate cake was really gooey and the Spanish wine i had with it was just an excellent pairing. just enough to make me want to go back and try their food too :)
author: Dot K.

description: i came here for a birthday so we had enough people to try several of the dishes.  my favorite was the roasted beets with avocado.  a couple other good dishes were the seabass with garbanzo beans and the hummus.  we also tried the carrot salad and the mussels, both of which were good, but nothing fantastic.  for dessert, we tried the pistachio and strawberry pavlova (meringue).  it was a little sweet, but then again, i'm more of a chocolate dessert or cheese plate type of person.  aside from the food, the staff was friendly and i loved the space.
author: Amy K.

description: I haven't dined at Terzo, but I did attend a fantastic Holiday party hosted by the restaurant.  The wine was excellent as was the service, ambiance, decor and vibe.  I forgot my jacket at the restaurant and called and asked them to hold it for me until I could pick it up the next day. Somehow it was stolen.  Management and the owners were professional and handled the situation extremely well, apologizing profusely and reimbursing me for the jacket.  I look forward to dining at Terzo next time I am in San Francisco.
author: G X.

description: Decent food but DEFINITELY not worth the cost. The plates were way small, and yes, I understand they're supposed to be small plates, but at $10-$15  per, I expect a little more in both quantity [for 3 people we had around 8 plates, still hungry afterwards] and complexity. The dishes were good but plain; they tasted fine but nothing that stands out. Great ambience but I wouldn't go back.
author: Tina L.

description: Great food, great wine, great atmosphere...but you're not really getting any bang for your buck!  They don't serve bread, which for me can be a deal breaker -- and the "small" plates are very small for the price.  The food is excellent but i think they need to work on their portion size...considering we ordered a pizza when we got home!  I'll give them a few weeks to work out some kinks and give it another try.
author: Liz H.

description: I have been twice and LOVE this space.  They did a fantastic job with the decor.  I love the big communal table.  The food was great.  I really liked the chicken spadini.
author: B K.

description: Great food and atmosphere.   We were lucky enough to be one of the first groups to reserve the private back room that will fit 10 people comfortably.  With a skylight and window to a little garden (?), the room is cozy and perfect for a group dinner.  While you wait for your table, you can have a glass of wine and some tapas ($4 a plate).   The steamed muscles and broccoli are a must.  Bartenders and Servers were awesome.
author: Nancy J.

description: This is my second time dining at Terzo and both evenings it's been a treat. The hummus is delicious, especially the warm and olive-oily naan bread that accomanies it- the brushetta is also a good, especially with the fried egg on top twist. The small plates are a better value and tastier than the large plates- the wine is great and the environment is tough to beat!
author: Cynthia P.

description:
Hello to all

Here is my experience at Terzo last monday night 
First after spending a hundred had to stop in at A 16 for a pizza at the bar
anyway called the place was told no table before 9/930pm but try the bar or communal table Walked in at 6 30 , place empty a supicious look form the host ended up sitting next to each other at the communal table Way too large to have a conversation across from each other HELLLOO DARLING DO YOU WANT SOME WINEEEE???  7 pm place mostly empty we had 4 or 5 small and I mean small plates I am watching the action happen to know the amigo in the kitchen we worked together in the past , the chef is either checking the computer talking on his cell or looking at reservations on open table ( They had 97 that night I checked because I am a restaurant spy) and spent most of the hour and a half we were there in the dining room not once I saw him go into the kitchen maybe he is afraid of damaging his new blond hair style We had a dessert at around 8 pm cant even remember what it was place still empty a few ancient people making their way in as we exit the place 
Great rip off if you ask me 
I give them 3 months before they close
author: didi c.

description: Went there last night with a group of friends.  I really like the atmosphere.  The candlight and fireplace make it very charming and cozy.  It's small plates served family style.  The portion size is extremely small, so be prepared to each order 2-3 plates.  I gave it 3 stars because the food was solid, but nothing off the charts spectacular.  I also thought the female bartendar was a bit snotty.  They have a seabass that was quite tasty, as was the beet salad.  I thought the salmon was sort of salty and fishy.  The only thing I had that I thought was worth of 4 star rating was the flourless chocolate cake....yummmmy!  They have valet parking as well.  It's a nice local spot, and I'd definitely go back for a date or something.
author: clancy t.

description: I love this place too.  Warm, inviting, caring service, attention to details, great wine list and solid Mediterranean small plates.   What's not to like?!   Wish Terzo was in my neighborhood!   But until I move there, I'll trek 'cross town monthly to have my Terzo fix!  A safe bet for a nice conversive dinner with friends.
author: David M.

description: I was shocked at the treatment of our host last week.  A respected gentleman and long time patron of this restaurant he had made specific table reservations well in advance of our dinner - and called twice that week to confirm the table. We arrived on time.  The hostess was clueless and unhelpful in locating the reserved table...we were placed by the bathroom-kitchen entrance, set for 5, we had a window seat reserved for 6.  The "GM" asked my wife, not the host, how he could help....and then he did not help...the waitress was agressive ....I have dined here three times previously in the past 3 years and it has gotten worse in food quality and service.  There were no apologies...unbelievable....for any customer let alone a long time customer this was a shocking display of how to not run a restaurant.  An apology and show of deference makes a big difference when a mistake is made...but Terzo kept making it worse.
author: andrew m.

description: I've been at Terzo 5 times now, and it's consistently good. The atmosphere is great and I've had excellent service every time. This feels like a local place to me, pretty down to earth while providing the important combination of good food, service and atmosphere. I'd say 2 dishes per person is enough.
author: Peter J.

description: i had a horrible experience at terzo last night. i left my iphone on the table after dinner, and when i called 5 minutes after leaving the restaurant, they said they hadn't seen it. everyone was very rude and condescending about the entire situation, including the general manager. they just implied that i had lost it and to call them if i found it, when i was 100% sure that i left it at their restaurant on the table. when i called an hour later to double-check if it had turned up, no one would look or ask again, they just kept telling me that "no one had seen it". we even offered a $500 reward, which the general manager just told me "wouldn't be necessary" so i doubt he even communicated it. i had over 1,000 videos and photos of my newborn son on the phone. i like the food but i will never go back to terzo and will tell my friends the same. you would think in that neighborhood that you could expect someone working to turn in your phone when you leave it. and you think the management would be more understanding and helpful. really makes you lose faith in people.
author: brooke s.
